events.id: D. H. Lawrence's The Fox-Gryphon Theatre, 22 Ghuznee St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: D. H. Lawrence's The Fox
events.venue: Gryphon Theatre, 22 Ghuznee St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Premiere production of D.H.Lawrence’s The Fox adapted for the stage by Keith Scott, Dunedin playwright. Directed by Annabel Hensley

It is 1918, immediately after the armistice which ended the Great War. Two women struggle to run a small farm in rural England and are moderately content. Their comfortable, albeit unfulfilling lives, are disrupted by two visitors. A fox has begun to take their hens and a young soldier arrives. These seemingly unrelated events combine and clash with unexpected consequences. The play explores the dynamics of power play when instincts are triggered that are as old as life itself.

The play explores gender roles, sexuality, femininity, and the pity of war, with Scott’s adaptation maintaining the authenticity of Lawrence’s original work.

events.id: The Ballad of Maria Marten-Te Raukura ki Kapiti, Sir Jon Trimmer Theatre, 34a Raumati Rd, Paraparaumu-Event Finder
events.name: The Ballad of Maria Marten
events.venue: Te Raukura ki Kapiti, Sir Jon Trimmer Theatre, 34a Raumati Rd, Paraparaumu
events.description:
Maven Theatre Company, in partnership with Te Raukura ki Kapiti, proudly presents the New Zealand premiere of The Ballad of Maria Marten, an innovative reimagining of the infamous ‘Red Barn Murder’ of 1827.

Maven’s inaugural offering, The Ballad of Maria Marten explores the notorious ‘Red Barn Murder’ of 1827 which has become a part of British folklore and the subject of sensational gossip and grim speculation. A young woman named Maria Marten went to a barn in Suffolk to meet her lover with plans to elope. A year later, her body was discovered hidden beneath the floor. What is the truth behind her murder? Why was she killed? And who was responsible?

Rather than providing a literal retelling of this historic true crime, the play offers a thrilling reappraisal that focuses on Maria’s life. It celebrates the solidarity among female friendships and highlights the stark realities that young working -class women in rural areas faced, including limited choices due to their gender, social class, and lack of education. Through a mix of storytelling, dance, and humor, Maria's fate is explored through the eyes of the women who loved her, illuminating a complex narrative of love, loss, prejudice, and patriarchal power.

Join us for this thrilling New Zealand premiere, where historical crime meets contemporary theatre, and Maria Marten’s story is told through the eyes of the women who loved her.

Maven is the newest theatre company on the Kapiti Coast and was born from a passion for bold storytelling and a commitment to creating immersive, thought-provoking theatre that challenges conventions. Maven was formed by Sera Devcich and Jessica Clough, the creative team behind the extended sold-out season of Nick Dear’s Frankenstein on the Kapiti Coast last year. That production received numerous accolades at the Wellington District Theatre Federation Awards, including Best Drama and Best Overall - a first for any production from Kapiti. The overwhelming feedback received from patrons was a desire to see more locally produced, ambitious, meaningful, and expertly crafted theatre. And so, Maven was established.

Content Advisory: This play contains adult themes and some content that may disturb. Recommended for audiences 16+

--

For accessibility seating information and wheelchair space bookings please email kiaora@teraukura.nz or call 04)9740535 during office hours.

events.id: The Nerd (by Larry Shue)-166 Muritai Road, Eastbourne, Lower Hutt 5013, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: The Nerd (by Larry Shue)
events.venue: 166 Muritai Road, Eastbourne, Lower Hutt 5013, New Zealand
events.description:
NOTE Performances on 10 & 11 July are cancelled and extra performance on 16 July.
The Nerd by Larry Shue
Aspiring architect Willum Cubbert has often told his friends about the debt he owes to Rick Steadman, whom he has never met, but was saved by, after he was seriously wounded in Vietnam. Willum is thrilled when Rick shows up unexpectedly for his 39th birthday, but his delight quickly fades as Rick is a hopeless nerd – a bumbling idiot with no social sense, little emotional intelligence, and even less tact.  Rick moves in and stays on and on, his continued presence among Willum and his friends creates unimaged chaos, until the normally placid Willum can no longer take it and he and his friends devise an insane plan to finally get Rick to leave.
Don’t miss this hilarious farce that ran on Broadway for 441 performances and went on to be performed the world over.
Performance dates: 12 & 16-19 July 2025, 7.30pm, Muritai School Hall, Eastbourne

events.id: The Superjesus - Aotearoa New Zealand Tour With the After-Meow, 9 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The Superjesus - Aotearoa New Zealand Tour With the After
events.venue: Meow, 9 Edward St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
THE SUPERJESUS - A long career in the music industry is much of a rarity these days but Adelaide rockers The Superjesus have managed to hold their place as one of Australia’s most respected live bands for almost 30 years.

Emerging in the late 90’s and signing to Warners worldwide they released 3 classic albums, Sumo, Jet Age and Rock Music, two of which went platinum. The 3 x Aria award winners took a hiatus in the mid 2000’s to work on solo projects and re-emerged in 2013 to test the waters. Pleased to have found themselves well received by the public they headed back into the studio for 2016’s EP Love And Violence followed by a double live album.

The South Australian Music Hall Of Fame inductees have a strong work ethic and an ear for a good hook. With hits such as ‘Gravity’ , ‘Secret Agent Man’, ‘Down Again’ & ‘Now And Then’ under their belt their songwriting has always remained their strong point. It has been 20 years since The Superjesus have released a full-length album of new music. In 2025 the band released their first self-titled album ‘The Superjesus’. After 30 years of crafting their sound, the songwriting partnership of Sarah McLeod & Stuart Rudd has truly found its sweet spot.

Rudd say’s “our writing partnership together has blossomed into a fantastic place to be creative. McLeod backed this up with “When you find a great creative writing partner, stick with it” From the opening bars of ‘Starlight’ we hear classic TSJ, tipping the hat to the 90’s sound they are known for while surging forward lyrically & melodically to create something really special.

This is the new Superjesus, a more soulful engaging version of the band we know and love where song writing is king. To date 5 singles have been released from the forthcoming self-titled album “Money (We’re Only In It For Love), ‘Lights Out’, ‘We Won’t Let Go Until It’s Over’, ‘Something Good’ & a cover of Generation X’s ‘Dancing With Myself’. All 5 singles have gained national airplay, setting the mood for this highly anticipated release.

They have kept the beautiful ballad ‘Diamonds’ to accompany the release. Here we see The Superjesus like never before, a beautiful emotive stirrer written on the piano showcasing how far the band has come musically, coupled with Sarah McLeod's classic rich vocals. The Superjesus are back stronger than ever and according to Rudd “not going anywhere anytime soon” . McLeod said “For us the magic is in the creation of the music & as a band we have found this process very soul enriching, I truly feel it’s our best work yet, I love every song on this record ”.

Supporting TSJ on the NZ shows is NZ’s THE AFTER.
The After are a pop/rock band blending moody grooves, gritty guitars & soaring melodies into emotionally charged soundscapes. Already two massive Asia Pacific tours under their belt, a string of NZ tours, significant airplay & video successes; The After are a well-oiled live act with a fast-growing international reputation. At the helm is the magnetic Ruby Fraser, whose powerhouse vocals and searing guitar work channel raw emotion & rebellious spirit. Founding member Andrew Featherstone lays the groundwork on bass with tight, tasteful songwriting. Behind the kit, Gareth Scott delivers versatile, thunderous rhythms, while Bruce Madden—a true Hammond organ virtuoso—elevates the band’s sound with lush swells & soul-soaked textures rarely heard in modern pop/rock.

Singles co-produced & mixed by Steve James (Screaming Jets, Sex Pistols), latest track “Mesmerised” mastered by Leon Zervos (INXS, AC/DC, Pink). • ‘Mesmerised’ radio & TV in NZ & the Philippines • ‘Clear to Me’ (feat. Split Enz legend Eddie Rayner) the most-played rock track NZ’s Juice TV in 2021, airing on 500 stations worldwide.• ‘Doesn’t Matter’ Radioscope Top 40 & a JUICE TV staple. • ‘Where There’s a Will, There’s a Way’ 600k views, video shot in Tokyo, Manila, Hong Kong, Singapore, & Auckland. • cover of Filipino band Dilaw’s hit “Uhaw” 500k views.

events.id: Diesel Jenny x Synthetic Children-Valhalla, 154 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Diesel Jenny x Synthetic Children
events.venue: Valhalla, 154 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.description:
Two of Aotearoa’s most rungle hardware acts are joining forces for a mid-winter tour across the country this July. Armed with new releases and a reckless lack of MIDI cables, longtime pals Synthetic Children and Diesel Jenny are packing gear into the whip for a trip up and down the motu. The six-date tour will see the pair serve up their respective dishes in Pōneke on Thursday the 17th of July, alongside ethereal favourite Ekho Laliah.

Via hardware synths and drum machines, Synthetic Children (Te Papaioea’s Celina Goacher) is bringing bubbly synths, auto-tuned vulnerabilities, and sub-rattling beats. Her latest Smooch EP, and appearance on the Big Fresh Collective’s Footmahi compilation, show an emerging fun side to her dancefloor arsenal, following the murky weight of 2023’s Everything’s Perpetual. Donnys worldwide have heralded the new release as a “freshly cooked 3 course meal, served up by Palmy’s premier snack pack herself”. Think wonky hyperpop with plenty of low end.

Diesel Jenny’s (Pōneke’s Josh Finegan) live set will blend brain-breaking breaks with sugar-rush synths and 3D club energy years. This tour will celebrate the inaugural release of Diesel Jenny’s white label series with a rock-solid RUC-exempt two-tracker.

With multiple releases on underground mainstays Big Fresh Collective and Bankrupt Records as ABG, this isn’t the first time Diesel Jenny’s revved the engine.

Ekho Laliah is an Aotearoa based artist who stitches together elements of dream pop, freak folk, and ethereal electronica into sonic tapestries with experimental production as the backbone.

Tickets $15 through UTR or $20 at the door

To enter email contact@humorous.co.nz, all you need is 6min of original material, and the guts to give it a go!

events.id: Diesel Jenny x Synthetic Children - 'Backroom Smooches' Tour-Valhalla, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: Diesel Jenny x Synthetic Children - 'Backroom Smooches' Tour
events.venue: Valhalla, Wellington
events.description:
Diesel Jenny and Synthetic Children announce ‘Backroom Smooches’ tour

Two of Aotearoa’s most rungle hardware acts are joining forces for a mid-winter tour across the country this July. Armed with new releases and a reckless lack of MIDI cables, longtime pals Synthetic Children and Diesel Jenny are packing gear into the whip for a trip up and down the motu.
The six-date tour will see the pair serve up their respective dishes in Ōtautahi, Ōtepoti, Tāmaki Makaurau, Pōneke, Te Papaioea, and Whanganui. Joined by local favourites, the tour will bring the sounds of provincial Aotearoa to the big smoke. To pair will also make a special stop in at the legendary Tūrangi dairy ‘Sanjay’s Selection’, to spin some tunes through the most bass boosted speakers in the Waikato.

Via hardware synths and drum machines, Synthetic Children (Te Papaioea’s Celina Goacher) is bringing bubbly synths, auto-tuned vulnerabilities, and sub-rattling beats. Her latest Smooch EP, and appearance on the Big Fresh Collective’s Footmahi compilation, show an emerging fun side to her dancefloor arsenal, following the murky weight of 2023’s Everything’s Perpetual. Donnys worldwide have heralded the new release as a “freshly cooked 3 course meal, served up by Palmy’s premier snack pack herself”. Think wonky hyperpop with plenty of low end.

Diesel Jenny’s (Pōneke’s Josh Finegan) live set will blend brain-breaking breaks with sugar-rush synths and 3D club energy years. This tour will celebrate the inaugural release of Diesel Jenny’s white label series with a rock-solid RUC-exempt two-tracker. With multiple releases on underground mainstays Big Fresh Collective and Bankrupt Records as ABG, this isn’t the first time Diesel Jenny’s revved the engine.

Diesel Jenny and Synthetic Children ‘Backroom Smooches’ Tour:
4 July – Ōtautahi – Flux* (with BWD)
5 July – Ōtepoti – Yours (supports TBA)
11 July - Tūrangi – Sanjay’s Selection (DJ sets b2b Skymning)
12 July – Tāmaki Makaurau – Audio Foundation (with Baby Zionov)
17 July – Pōneke – Valhalla (with Ekho Lahlia)
18 July – Te Papaioea – Snails (with Club Tremaine, Cradle)
19 July – Whanganui – Porridge Watson (with Alphabethead, Club Tremaine)
Tickets available from undertheradar.co.nz *Tickets from flicket.co.nz

events.id: The Oscar Garvie Quartet Plays Coltrane-Rogue and Vagabond, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: The Oscar Garvie Quartet Plays Coltrane
events.venue: Rogue and Vagabond, Wellington
events.description:
Join us for a powerful evening of music celebrating the legacy of one of jazz’s most visionary artists — John Coltrane. From his soulful early ballads and hard bop classics to the boundary-pushing spiritual intensity of his later free jazz works, this performance traces the full arc of Coltrane’s musical journey.



Led by drummer Oscar Garvie, the group is anchored by the expressive and deeply studied playing of saxophonist Isaac Randel, whose sound channels the fire and depth of Coltrane’s voice. Randel brings a commanding front-line presence and a profound connection to the material, making him the perfect interpreter of Coltrane’s vast and evolving musical language.



The band also features Jack Harris on bass and Tane Kelly on piano — a dynamic rhythm section that navigates the full emotional and sonic range of Coltrane’s music.



Together, this quartet dives into every era of Coltrane’s work — from the lyrical beauty of Naima and the modal mastery of Impressions, to the raw, transcendent fire of Ascension and Interstellar Space. This tribute isn’t just a look back — it’s a living, breathing expression of what Coltrane’s music still means

Music from 9pm, FREE ENTRY

events.id: DARKFIELD: FLIGHT-Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington , NZ 6011, New Zealand-Ticket Master
events.name: DARKFIELD: FLIGHT
events.venue: Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington , NZ 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Buying tickets to FLIGHT and SÉANCE? Book your first experience and then wait to receive your confirmation email to access your unique discount code to book your second experience at a discounted rate.
Two journeys, two worlds, two realities: There are many worlds in which this plane lands safely.
FLIGHT is an unsettling journey in complete darkness, using DARKFIELD signature 360 degree sound design inside a custom-built shipping container. 
In the unlikely event of a sudden loss of cabin pressure, alternative scenarios will be provided. The many worlds interpretation of Quantum Mechanics proposes all possible outcomes that could occur, are occurring in countless worlds of varying similarity. 
Find comfort in knowing that however ill advised your life choices have been - there is a version of you who made better ones and is suffering less regret and embarrassment. 
We are not responsible for your final destination

events.id: DARKFIELD: SÉANCE-Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington , NZ 6011, New Zealand-Ticket Master
events.name: DARKFIELD: SÉANCE
events.venue: Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington , NZ 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Buying tickets to SÉANCE and FLIGHT? Book your first experience and then wait to receive your confirmation email to access your unique discount code to book your second experience at a discounted rate.
A twist on a traditional séance relying on psychology and inclination towards superstition to alter your perception of reality.
Step inside, take a seat but don’t get comfortable.
Transforming a shipping container into a Victorian séance room, SÉANCE makes audiences question not just their beliefs, but also their own senses.
SÉANCE explores the psychology of a group of people who have been bombarded with suggestible material, and asks that they believe in what might be conjured up into the room with them.
Using complete darkness and binaural 360 degree sound, over 20 minutes audiences go on a journey with the medium that blurs the line between what is real and what is imagined in the darkness.
We ask you proceed with an open-mind.
Do you believe…?

events.id: Orchestra Wellington 2025 Season-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Orchestra Wellington 2025 Season
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
Orchestra Wellington is New Zealand’s oldest professional regional orchestra. Its busy concert series includes music from classical, romantic, and contemporary periods. You’ll also see it regularly performing with the Orpheus Choir, Royal New Zealand Ballet, and New Zealand Opera.
For its 2025 season, ‘The Dictator’s Shadow’, the orchestra focuses in part on Dimitri Shostakovich. The programme includes masterpieces that symbolise the artist’s struggle and resilience under repression and political control. Coupled with works from other composers, the concerts feature local and international soloists.

events.id: Come Together 2025-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Come Together 2025
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
Recreating three entire classic rock albums live is no easy feat. The crew from Come Together are up for the task — they have been doing it for five years. The group of famous New Zealand musicians has organised a stellar lineup for 2025. First up they aim to capture the raw emotion of Neil Young’s album ‘Live Rust’. Later in the year, they’ll tackle the atmospheric complexity of Pink Floyd’s ‘Dark Side of the Moon’, followed by the thunderous power of Led Zeppelin’s album ‘Led Zeppelin II’. 
Each of these legendary albums will be performed in its entirety — track by track, back-to-back. There will also be an additional bonus set of deep cuts and classic hits. Some of the most talented musicians in the country pour everything they have into recreating this music with precision and passion. Look out for Reb Fountain, Jon Toogood, Julia Deans, Luke Buda, Jol Mulholland, and many more. Expect extended solos and spontaneous moments of magic. The electrifying energy between performers makes each show unforgettable.

events.description:
The NZSO’s reputation for artistic excellence attracts many of the world’s leading musicians, conductors, and soloists. In 2025 American mezzo-soprano and multi-Grammy Award winner Joyce DiDonato leads the star-studded international list. At 26, British saxophonist Jess Gillam is the youngest soloist to perform with the NZSO. Japanese conductor Masaaki Suzuki lends his skills to interpret Baroque works. 
Wellington shows are hosted in the Michael Fowler Centre, home of the NZSO. The touring programme will see the orchestra perform over 100 concerts in over 30 communities. Be among over 100,000 people across the motu who experience live orchestra music.

events.id: Circa Theatre 2025 Season-Circa Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Circa Theatre 2025 Season
events.venue: Circa Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
Inside Circa Theatre’s waterfront venue, you’ll find two performance spaces. Both offer a smorgasbord of professional theatre throughout the year. Playwrights from international heavy hitters to brilliant Kiwi voices are represented. It also includes programming from comedies and cabarets to contemporary dance and pantomime. 
Before or after your show, visit the on-site café brasserie and restaurant, Chouchou. It opens out onto a deck, where you can take it views across the harbour. Look up to admire the art installation above. Called ‘Velarium’, it undulates in the wind mirroring the water in the harbour. 
Circa Theatre began its life in 1976. A breakaway group of actors and theatre practitioners decided that Aotearoa needed a new and innovative approach to theatre. Five decades later it is still pushing boundaries, making people laugh and cry, and creating theatrical memories. 
If you don’t have your own Circa memory yet, there’s an opportunity to create one nearly every night of the week.

The month of festivities includes lights, laughter, and fun for all ages. This year’s theme, ‘Christmas Carnival’, applies to events including a Light Up Tractor Parade, Illumination Night Walk, and Kids Circus School Programme. There are also street parties, house tours, live music, and fireworks.
The main street in Greytown provides the hub for many activities across the four weeks. It will offer twinkling lights, themed shopfronts, delicious street food, and live entertainment. events.venue: 331 Suffolk Road Stoke Nelson, Nelson 7011
events.description:
The Hospice New Zealand Fundamentals of Palliative Care is for Health Care Professionals.
(Not suitable for the general public)
If you have not already registered and started the online Fundamentals Programme, here is the registration link to enrol https://knowledgehub.hospice.org.nz/
* Please note the Pre-requisite to attend this workshop is to complete the modules 1 & 2 online self-learning.
The 5 self learning online modules are :
*1. Essence of Palliative Care,
*2. The Palliative Care Approach,
3. Managing Pain and Long Term Illness, which consists of two modules Pain,
4. Other Symptoms and Pharmacology, and Chronic Illness & Dementia.
5. The last module is Care and Support at the End of Life.
Once you have completed all the online modules and attend a Workshop, we can then award you the Hospice New Zealand certificate of Fundamentals of Palliative Care, which is 8 hours professional development.
Workshop details:
Date: Friday 18 July 2025
Time: 0900 -1630
Cost: Free to attend *Please bring your own Lunch (Tea and coffee is supplied and a light morning/afternoon tea) Light refreshments are also available for purchase onsite at our Manuka café opens from 0900 – 1300.
Presenters: Chris Dunn & Suss Walding Nelson Tasman Hospice Nurse Educators
Venue: Nelson Tasman Hospice 331 Suffolk Road, Stoke, Nelson.

events.id: The Intersection workshops-45 Laings Road, Hutt Central, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: The Intersection workshops
events.venue: 45 Laings Road, Hutt Central, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand
events.description:
If you know Aotearoa history — and feel the weight of it — but you're unsure how to show up in everyday moments with integrity and impact, this workshop is your next step.
In celebration of Matariki, we’re calling in those who are ready to do more than just know — those who are ready to act.
Join us for an immersive, transformative wānanga series designed to move you from passive awareness to active, accountable allyship.
WORKSHOP ONE - 6 JUNE 9-4
A full-day wānanga to weave relationships, build trust, and grow accountable allyship through values-based connection, storytelling, and Indigenous-led practice.
WORKSHOP TWO - 18 JULY 9-4
A dynamic day of kōrero, games, courageous conversations and collective action to deepen allyship, explore accountability, and grow relational skills grounded in Te Tiriti o Waitangi.
Cost: Free or koha
Who is running it?
The Intersection is a collaboration between Sarah Morris (Pākehā, Ngāpuhi), and Jewelz Petley (Te Rarawa, Ngati Kuri) who will co-facilitate the workshops. Sarah lives in Te Awa Kairangi and is a policy and social change consultant with an interest in accountable allyship. Jewelz Petley (Te Rarawa, Ngati Kuri) based in Tāmaki Makaurau is a social change advocate with a strong focus on equity, allyship, and Te Tiriti-led practice.
Sign up here! https://forms.gle/x1kP8mPfT64Y4zmZA

events.venue: Capital E, 4 Queens Wharf, Wellington
events.description:
Sniff, scratch and burrow at Ngā Turua Kiwi, Kiwi Burrows.

In our latest play activation, whānau can explore themes of creating homes, a connection to whenua, and the importance of conservation in Pōneke.

Imagine yourself as a Western Brown Kiwi as you:
- Wriggle and crawl through kiwi burrows of different shapes and sizes.
- Discover hidden surprises on the forest floor, including crunchy textures, a bouncy seat, and even pests hiding amongst the leaf litter.
- Climb the towering tree to the top of the forest canopy, then slide all the way down to the forest floor.
- Get creative and build your own cozy tūrua burrow using ‘raw’ materials (wheelchair-accessible).

There will be something for every age and accessibility-level, with both high-energy and low-energy play options, a pēpē baby area, and wheelchair-accessible play stations.

This activation is supported by Capital Kiwi Project.

PlayHQ is Nōku te Ao Capital E’s public indoor play space for tamariki aged 0-5.

Open Monday-Saturday, 9.30am-3.30pm.

Ngā Tūrua Kiwi will be our final PlayHQ activation at Queens Wharf, before we move to Te Matapihi ki te Ao Nui, the new Central Library.

Nōku te Ao Capital E is located at 4 Queens Wharf, Wellington. No bookings required, donations appreciated.

events.venue: Greytown Town Hall, 89 Main St, Greytown
events.description:
Step Inside: Greytown’s Inaugural Mid-Winter Christmas House Tour

This winter, step inside eight handpicked Greytown homes, each beautifully styled and transformed with festive flair for the first-ever Mid-Winter House Tour. From traditional charm to contemporary chic, explore the main living spaces of these inspiring homes and discover how their owners bring the magic of Christmas indoors.

Wander through spaces warmed by crackling fires, admire exquisite table settings, and take in thoughtful, seasonal touches that are sure to spark ideas for your own winter celebrations. Whether you're a design lover, a Christmas enthusiast, or simply looking for a little mid-year magic, this is an event not to miss.

Tickets $75 plus fees

Go VIP for the Ultimate Experience – Tickets $145 plus fees
Upgrade to a VIP ticket and unlock two exclusive experiences:

Rototāwai Tour
Visit Rototāwai, a privately owned homestead on the outskirts of Greytown. This lovingly restored historic home features a unique landscape and an impressive private art collection. A rare chance to view an iconic home not usually open to the public.
Please select your preferred time for the homestead visit: 10am or 12pm.

Exclusive Wine Tasting at Alexia Urban Winery
Recently named one of The Real Review's Top 10 Wineries of 2025, Alexia is leading the way in innovation while celebrating its winemaking heritage. Enjoy an intimate tasting hosted by acclaimed winemaker Jane Cooper, and sample a selection of fresh, distinctive wines, including Gamay, Chenin Blanc and Grüner Veltliner.

Please select your preferred time for the wine tasting: 3pm or 4pm.

Programme for the day:
9am - 10am: Collect your shoe bag and programme from the Greytown Town Hall, and find out where you'll be starting your self-drive tour.
10am: Go to your first allocated home, then make your way around the remaining homes in the order and pace that you wish. Feel free to stop for coffee or a bite to eat, or some shopping on the way!
Note: VIP ticket holders need to be at Rototāwai and Alexia at their allocated times (as selected when you purchase your ticket)
4pm: Tour finishes, feel free to make your way back into Greytown to enjoy the Wairarapa Festival of Christmas festivities

This is a self-drive, self-paced tour. Proudly supported by Dave and Jennah of Property Brokers , in support of our charity partner, Hospice Wairarapa.

Tickets are strictly limited – don’t miss this mid-winter celebration of style, creativity, and seasonal joy. This event is part of the Wairarapa Festival of Christmas programme. All the details at www.greytownvillage.com

events.venue: Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable St, Wellington
events.description:
Eat Your Art Out brings a creative twist to high tea, inspired by the bold and brilliant works of Toi Art.

Enjoy a menu of classic treats with an artistic edge: from the Sweet William’s Dish, Golden Ratio Scone, Madeleine Moment, and the Mint to Be mousse. Each dish is a playful nod to the world of art, clever, colourful, and made to be shared.

Your high tea includes your choice of tea or coffee. Alcoholic beverages are available for purchase, and dietary options are available on request.

Every purchase helps to support Aotearoa New Zealand’s national museum.

------

Set Menu
(Includes one of each item per person)

Cheery Cherry Curator
A silky milk chocolate crémeux layered with vibrant cherry glaze and topped with a dark chocolate disc creates a perfectly balanced blend of tart and sweet

Mint to Be
Cool mint and sweet strawberry mousse gently resting on a white chocolate base, combining vibrant flavours that are meant to be together

Madeleine Moment
A citrus-infused madeleine paired with silky sambuca namelaka, vibrant green apple gel, and an elegant chocolate garnish delivers golden flavours with a playful twist

Sweet William’s Dish
Mānuka honey ganache nestled in a crisp vanilla tart shell, topped with a chocolate ‘The Dish’ by William De Morgan. A refined take on New Zealand’s liquid gold

The Golden Ratio
A perfectly proportioned cheese scone layered with sundried tomatoes, olives, and fresh basil brings Mediterranean flavours in perfect balance

The Pecking Order
Tender horopito-spiced chicken layered with creamy Tatua mayo and peppery watercress on fresh focaccia fingers, with native pepper leaf adding a bold, warming kick

Still Life with Eggplant
Tangy eggplant and native kawakawa caponata with buffalo bocconcini and fragrant basil pesto on artisanal brioche. A bold sandwich blending native botanicals and classic flavours.

events.id: ThroughBlue: Support Group 4 Women With Depression-Lifepoint Church, 61 Hopper St, Mt Cook, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: ThroughBlue: Support Group 4 Women With Depression
events.venue: Lifepoint Church, 61 Hopper St, Mt Cook, Wellington
events.description:
Any woman in Wellington is welcome to attend our regular meetings which have been running for the past 15 years.

There is a wide spectrum of experience of depression in the group - from very mild to more severe. Some people may have experienced depression in the past and come along to help manage relapses. It is a very diverse group and ranges in number from week to week - from 3 to 14 people.

It is a friendly and non-threatening environment and most newcomers find it to be very welcoming and inclusive. ThroughBlue is not affiliated with any religious organisation or church. You are welcome to participate as much as you wish in terms of talking about your experience or to sit and observe without having to say anything, depending on what suits you. There is a structure to the meetings, with a new topic each week.

The group is facilitated by professional counsellors. We ask for a donation of $10 waged and $5 unwaged per meeting to cover food and go towards some of the venues hire costs.

What is the structure of group meetings?
- 12:30pm - Meditative grounding exercise
- 12:40pm - Opening round – how was your week, a highlight, did you achieve your goal or anything else you’d like to say
- 1:30pm - Tea break (about 10 minutes)
- 1:40pm - Educational topic
- 2:20pm - Closing round - what you found useful, something you are looking forward to this week, possibility to set a goal for the week to come.
- 2:30pm - Finish

events.id: Padel New Zealand Tour 2025 Registration - Wellington-48A Kemp Street, Kilbirnie, Wellington 6022, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Padel New Zealand Tour 2025 Registration - Wellington
events.venue: 48A Kemp Street, Kilbirnie, Wellington 6022, New Zealand
events.description:
Event description
Welcome to the inaugural Padel New Zealand Tour 2025, a nationwide series of tournaments designed to bring players of all levels together.
There will be three events in 2025 – starting off in Tauranga, then off to Wellington in the winter, and lastly Auckland in the summer—each offering the opportunity to earn official ranking points and showcase your skills.
Join us in Wellington July 18-20th
3 indoor double courts, 1 single (warm up) court
Hosted by Padel House NZ Address: 48A Kemp Street, Kilbirnie, Wellington
Registration - NOW CLOSED
Registration entry fee: $75 per player. Humanitix booking fees apply(100% of Humanitix booking fees donated to charity). 
Registration closes Tuesday July 8th at 9pm unless sold out prior. Limited spaces so be quick to not miss out!
Tournament Format
3-day event (Friday–Sunday)
Friday: Games commencing from mid-afternoon to evening - required to attend for all players.
Saturday & Sunday: Games from morning to evening - required to attend for all players.
Categories:
A Grade Men - 10 teams (FULL)
B Grade Men - 16 teams (FULL)
A Grade Women - 8 teams (FULL)
Update June 19th: due to low sign ups in Women's B-grade, this category will be cancelled. The B-grade Men category filled up early due to very high interest and had a waitlist so 4 additional team spots have been allocated to this category.
Maximum number across all 3 grades: 72 players/36 teams (due to size of venue and number of courts)
Match format:
Pool play 
Two sets, tiebreak if 1-1
Golden point (no deuce)
Players self referee. Players to call the score so officials and spectators can easily follow the game.
Matches under standard padel rules.
Minor variations are possible if court time is limited. 
Note: The format could vary some for different grades depending on number of total entries.
Full match format information will be provided prior and at tournament.
Schedule/Draws
The draws will be done by the hosting clubs through the Tour. Schedule and draws will be released at beginning of the week before the event commences (week commencing July 14th).
Player License
To play in national tournaments arranged by Padel New Zealand you will need a player license. Please note that all players for Wellington will need a new license for the new financial year starting July 1st, 2025 and valid to June 30th, 2026. All previous licenses purchased will expire June 30th 2025.
Please purchase the player license, ideally when you register for the tournament but at the latest before closing of tournament registrations July 8th 9pm.
The license fee is $25 per annum for the new financial year July 2025-June 2026. Credit card fees apply. 
Licenses are required by International padel standards for any tournament organised by a federation. They also help Padel New Zealand maintain accurate records of player participation, skill levels, and ranking points throughout the season.
More information on how to register for a license here: www.padelnewzealand.org.nz/player-license
Ranking Points
All Padel New Zealand’s tournaments will have Ranking Points.
Points will be awarded at each tournament based on match results.
Rankings will be updated on our socials(top 10) and website(full list) after each event.
Full details on how points are calculated and used can be found on the Padel New Zealand website
Frequently Asked Questions
1. Who can enter these tournaments?
Anyone with a valid Padel New Zealand player license is welcome, regardless of skill level or nationality.
2. I don’t have a partner—can I register?
Please find a partner before registering - you will need to enter as a team. Your local club may able to assist to find partners or try to contact other players in the various padel Whatsapp groups.
3. What is an approximate guide for the A and B grades?
A‐grade: For competitive players with stronger skills - strong upper intermediates to advanced levels.
B‐grade: Ideal for more more casual/social players - lower intermediate to mid-intermediate levels.
4. What equipment do I need?
A standard padel racket and non-marking shoes. HEAD padel balls are provided, and a limited number of demo rackets will be available to borrow at some venues.
5. How do match formats and scoring work?
Matches will be 2 sets and tie break if 1-1(first to 7). Golden Point - no deuce play. Pool tie breaker will be calculated on games won in pool play. Top 2 teams in each pool qualify for play offs.
Players self-referee but there will be access to an official from the club or Padel New Zealand to call in at disputes/queries. 
6. Are spectators allowed?
Friends and family are welcome to come along and support. There could be limited space in some venues of the Tour. Each venue will have its own food and beverage options. 
If you have any questions about this tournament, please contact Padel New Zealand

events.id: Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents: Dave Wilson-Bedlam And Squalor, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents: Dave Wilson
events.venue: Bedlam And Squalor, Wellington
events.description:
The next concert in our series presents a new project by Dave Wilson titled Free, Free: Meditations on Liberation. This project brings together a collective of musicians from across the music communities of Pōneke in an invitation to explore the expansive possibilities for what liberation might sound like.

Free, Free draws from legacies of musical collectivity, and celebrates a commitment to both collaboration and the distinct expression of each individual.

Ranging from contemplative minimalism to ecstatic ensemble energy and body-moving grooves, the music of Free, Free invites musicians and other listeners to tend to each moment, making their own offerings to shape the collective sound.

Dave Wilson is a saxophonist, clarinettist, composer, producer, and interdisciplinary scholar. His music bridges avant-garde and experimental music with various groove-oriented styles from the worlds of jazz, R&B, electronic music, and more. With his 2023 album Ephemeral, described as “quite spiritually intense music” by The Guardian, he was a finalist for Te Manu Taki Tautito o te Tau | Best Jazz Artist at the Aotearoa Music Awards, and for the APRA Best Jazz Composition Award. Before relocating to Te Whanganui-a-Tara Wellington in 2016, Dave grew up in the Chicago area, lived for a decade in Los Angeles, and spent several stints living in Skopje, North Macedonia.

Free, Free: Meditations on Liberation
Dave Wilson, Tyaan Singh – alto saxophone
Louisa Williamson – tenor saxophone
Monique Lapins, Mana Waiariki – violin
Ken Ichinose – cello
Kaito Walley, Natania Ngawhau – trombone
Ben Hunt – trumpet
Daniel Hayles, Andrew Faleatua – piano and keyboard
Phoebe Johnson – bass
Callum Allardice – guitar
Hikurangi Schaverien-Kaa – drums

The performance will begin with an opening set by Flute Journeys, an offbeat mass flute ensemble with the self-described playing abilities of 5–12-year-olds, embodying a form of liberation in music.

The Jazz Orchestra Composer Series showcases original music for large jazz ensemble by New Zealand composers. Concerts take place every 1st and 3rd Friday of the month, from May to October, from 7pm. Tickets are $15, door sales $20.

Thanks to CNZ for their generous support. See less

events.id: Monthly Jazz Night: Les Tripes - Parisian Swing Trio-Thistle Inn, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: Monthly Jazz Night: Les Tripes - Parisian Swing Trio
events.venue: Thistle Inn, Wellington
events.description:
Get ready for a night of irresistible rhythm and sizzling jazz!

Swing clarinetist Oscar Lavën, guitarist Adrian Jensen, and double-bass raconteur Robert Henderson are Les Tripes (french for The Guts) ; a hard-working interpretation of the irresistibly heart-pumping film-noir sound of Django Reinhardt's Quintette du Hot Club de France. Lavën, Jensen and Henderson are professional musicians based in Wellington, and have honed their project through years of performance in venues large and small.

Les Tripes will have you tapping your feet and swinging along as they infuse each performance with passion, precision, and a touch of French flair.

Don’t miss the chance to experience a night of pure, swinging magic!

events.id: Urinetown: The Musical-38A Duncan Street, Tawa, Wellington 5028, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Urinetown: The Musical
events.venue: 38A Duncan Street, Tawa, Wellington 5028, New Zealand
events.description:
Urinetown: The Musical, is... well it's a musical that takes place in a dystopian setting where, due to an immense drought, its townsfolk have to pay fees in order to pee, controlled by a money-hungry corporation. But we wouldn't want to overload you with too much exposition, huh?
And before you scoff at its oddities, don't worry, Urinetown's already laughing at itself with jokes like "Wee-wee never fail."  But beyond its potty humour and absurd premise, Urinetown: The Musical, unveils itself with its political messages that also satirises the musical genre. From a gospel number to a climax that references Les Misérables, it dazzles at the same time as it depresses.
So-- come and watch. If not for the comedic choruses, then for the capitalistic commentary. The musical reminds us, as much as we can laugh at the central conceit of the show, we're not so far from the songs it's singing. 
Original music and lyrics by Mark Hollmann and Greg Kotis (2001); performed by Tawa College."

events.id: Ōtari Glow Worm Tour-Ōtari-Wilton’s Bush, 160 Wilton Road, Wilton, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Ōtari Glow Worm Tour
events.venue: Ōtari-Wilton’s Bush, 160 Wilton Road, Wilton, Wellington
events.description:
Take a guided night tour through Ōtari-Wilton’s Bush and discover some of the fascinating night-time residents on your way to see the titiwai/glowworms. Enjoy the tranquil beauty of the bush after dark and witness the magical glow of these unique creatures.

This outdoor night-time tour takes just over an hour.
If bringing children, we find it most suitable for those aged 5 years and older.
The tour requires a moderate level of fitness, the route includes numerous steps to and from the glowworms.

Meet at the Ōtari Visitors Centre, 150 Wilton Road. Bring warm clothes, walking shoes, and a torch.

This tour is operated by the Ōtari-Wilton’s Bush Trust. Join the Trust from just $20 a year and the glow worm tour is free, plus you’ll be supporting the amazing work the Trust does. Join today at owbt.nz/membership-donations/

Glow Worm Tour Ticket Refund Policy
• No Refunds: We do not offer refunds for Glow Worm Tour tickets.
• Ticket Transfers: If you can’t attend your booked tour, we will put you on a future tour, subject to availability. Please contact us as soon as possible to arrange this.
• Weather Conditions: Tours operate rain or shine. In the event of extreme weather or unsafe conditions, we will reschedule your tour or provide a refund.

For any changes or inquiries, please get in touch with us in advance at Treehouse@wcc.govt.nz or call 04 499 1400.

events.id: 'Chemical' Acoustic Concert-Te Auaha, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: 'Chemical' Acoustic Concert
events.venue: Te Auaha, Wellington
events.description:
In anticipation of the release of her next single, Emma Kate presents an intimate acoustic showcase of original music, stripping back previously released songs to share how they were first conceived.

Bio:
Emma Kate is a confessional and open singer-songwriter who captivates listeners with her raw, heartfelt lyrics. Writing songs for the yearners, the existential dreamers, the hopeless romantics and those who love too deep; Emma Kate's music is a diary-shaped window into her most personal experiences. Relatable and authentic, she writes songs about everything; from crash-out moments to inevitable heartbreaks. Listeners can guarantee that her straight-to-the-point lyrics will hit them right in the heart - "why'd you go and throw away the best thing that you ever had?" (Invisible Broken Hearts).

Beginning her songwriting journey at just 8 years old, Emma Kate blends catchy pop melodies with descriptive storytelling. A truly unique voice from New Zealand, she's only just getting started. Listeners should be ready (and excited) for her next chapter.

events.id: The Tempests EP Release-Beach Road, Paekākāriki 5034, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: The Tempests EP Release
events.venue: Beach Road, Paekākāriki 5034, New Zealand
events.description:
The Tempests
Vocalists Jade Eru and Lynley Christoffersen weave vocal magic born from a shared experience and bond that only comes from years of singing together to create a sound greater than the sum of its parts. 
Soulful, sweet harmonies skillfully backed by a band of accomplished yet understated musicians.
Drummer Richard Te One, bassist Miklin Halstead, guitarists Chris Armour and Rob Matthews form the backbone of The Tempests. Drawing from a deep well of musical knowledge and influences, their supportive and tenacious musicianship help to swell the sound of the Tempests and serve the song. 
The Tempests have crafted timeless melodies and emotionally rich songs into vivid aural tapestries.
Hamish Graham.
Hamish has often been found on a baritone guitar with Wellington stalwarts Hobnail, or fronting his own cello-pop ensemble, Milkthistle.
Hamish brings his distinctive take on the world around us with lush and lively approaches to well-crafted songs that follow an arc of experiences and emotions.

events.id: Delaney Davidson Anniversary Tour-Meow, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: Delaney Davidson Anniversary Tour
events.venue: Meow, Wellington
events.description:
Banished Music proudly presents
Delaney Davidson
Anniversary Tour 2025, With Support From Hemi Hemingway

With multiple album Anniversaries this year, Delaney Davidson takes to the road in July to celebrate his extensive and star studded catalogue with special band The Anniversaries.
Generally dealing with the darker side of things, Delaney Davidson has been described as “being the reigning king of capturing the essence of “Noir” in Country and Folk Music, pushing at the framework and preconceptions of roots music with his brand of modern gothic Americana.” (Post to Wire).
Having spent the last 20 years as travelling “troubadour” around the globe, sometimes solo, sometimes with accomplices, but always with his Ghost Orchestra, Delaney Davidson has found new focus embracing a love of Aotearoa.
Through his collaborative work with Troy Kingi “ Black Sea, Golden Ladder”, his visual art work with Tame Iti, and his most current album “Out Of My Head” produced by Merk, he has featured such varied talents as Hayley Westenra and Reb Fountain and has toured with Chamber Music New Zealand - all the while continuing to reinvent concepts and challenge expectations, and gaining respect and admiration from audiences.
“Incontestably one of Aotearoa’s most influential and lauded contemporary songwriters” Under The Radar
Delaney Davidson now takes his band of Anniversaries on the local roads around Aotearoa, don’t miss a night of wry sense of humour, some theatre of unease, and a rocking collection of bangers from his extensive back catalogue as he celebrates the music that got him where he is today.
Pre-sale tickets – 9am, Friday 21 March
General tickets – 9am, Monday 24 March
Tickets from Banished Music
Subscribe to presale at: www.banishedmusic.com/subscribe

events.name: Double Trouble: An Evening of Singer/Songwriter Duos
events.venue: The Pow Wow Room, Wellington
events.description:
Double, double, toil and trouble! Come seek refuge from the cold winter night as we get the fires burning and cauldrons bubbling at Pow Wow!

You'll be in for a night of the best duo acts that Wellington has to offer, with tunes ranging from hackneyed old favourites to cutting-edge originals. Get ready to sing, dance, drink and leave the bitter Wellington cold at the door!

About our acts:

Plaid Moon Rising:
UVSH's own Wolf Truong joins longtime friend and talented singer/instrumentalist Daniela Butterfield to bring you Plaid Moon Rising, your friendly neighbourhood covers duo! Sit back and relax for some easy listening as these plaid-wearing nerds give you harmony-laden acoustic renditions of your favourite folk rock tunes. Featuring hits from music greats including Cat Stevens, Paul Simon, Credence Clearwater Revival and Fleetwood Mac, there's bound to be something for everyone!

Yellow Rooms:
Yellow Rooms are Pōneke based sister duo Sarah and Grace Lawrence. The sisters swap between the violin, guitar, keys and vocals on songs that are both soulful and witty. Look out for their new release ‘Cool’ in the coming months!

The Footnotes:
The Footnotes are Wellington’s first ever 4-piece band with only 2 members featuring the inimitable talents of local legends, Theo Sekeris (guitar and bass, simultaneously) and Vorn Colgan (accordion and drums, simultaneously). Demonstrably the best pound-for-pound party band in the land!

events.id: Electrify Levin: how to save money on your energy bills feat. Mike Casey-32 Bristol Street, Levin 5510, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Electrify Levin: how to save money on your energy bills feat. Mike Casey
events.venue: 32 Bristol Street, Levin 5510, New Zealand
events.description:
It keeps getting more expensive to heat our homes and water, cook our meals and get around. But there is a way to avoid those rising costs and Electrify Levin will show you how.  
Most Levin homes could be saving thousands on their energy bills each year, while also slashing emissions, simply by upgrading their gas and petrol machines to the electric equivalents available today - and ideally powering them with solar and batteries for more self-sufficiency in case of power cuts or natural disasters.
Levin has crossed the “electrification tipping point” where homes, farms and businesses can now save money and reduce their emissions by going electric. It’s a massive win-win and a lot of people don’t know about the potential savings that are hiding in their cupboards, kitchens and driveways. 
Rewiring Aotearoa is trying to change that and we’re supporting grassroots action across the country. Community electrification groups are popping up all over the place and helping to raise awareness about the benefits for their local region and helping locals through the process. Now, it’s time to bring the buzz to Levin.
Come along to hear from Mike Casey, who is saving tens of thousands a year on his all-electric solar-powered cherry orchard, and find out how electrifying Levin is the smartest, cheapest, and healthiest way to power our lives.

events.id: The Sound Inside-Circa Theatre, 1 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The Sound Inside
events.venue: Circa Theatre, 1 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.description:
Bella Baird is a brilliant Ivy League writing professor. Christopher is a talented yet mysterious student. Between real-life and literary fiction, an unusual friendship grows between lonely souls. Until Bella asks an unthinkable favour.

A gripping yet delicate new play that explores the limits of what one person can ask of another; beautiful in its writing and thrilling in its drama. The Sound Inside has seared through Broadway, earning six Tony Award nominations, including Best Play. Now making its New Zealand premiere in 2025.

A slick, shivery production starring Dulcie Smart who makes her long-awaited return to Aotearoa especially.

* 2019 New York Times Critics Pick *

* Listed among “Best of the Year” in Time, Chicago Tribune, LA Times, Daily News, The Hollywood Reporter *

Reviews:
“Dulcie combines a shining intelligence with a strength of spirit” — Sunday Times

events.id: Chris Parker — Stop Being So Dramatic!-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Chris Parker — Stop Being So Dramatic!
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
He’s the self-proclaimed People’s Princess of Aotearoa. Funny man Chris Parker is back with a new (and dramatic) stand-up show. Stop Being So Dramatic is his latest creation and it’s heading to The Opera House in July 2025. People have been telling Chris that he’s dramatic since childhood. Now that he’s 34 he’s ready to address the drama queen allegations head-on. Join him for an hour of high-intensity, feverishly paced, and dizzyingly expressive comedy. Chris says, “I’ve cried in every speech I’ve ever delivered publicly, and this year when I slept on my neck weirdly, I may have bought myself an unnecessary neck brace. Still, I’m desperate to prove that I’m really chill and down to earth.”
Chris Parker is a graduate of Wellington drama school Toi Whakaari O Aotearoa. He first built a reputation by posting funny videos on social media. Now he tours live shows and is a regular face on New Zealand TV. See him in ‘7 Days’, ‘Have You Been Paying Attention NZ’, ‘Jono and Ben’, ‘Funny Girls’, ‘Taskmaster, NZ’, and ‘Golden Boy’. He has appeared in feature films ‘Baby Done’, ‘The Breaker Upperers’, and ‘Nude Tuesday’. He has two feature films of his own currently in development.

events.id: PADI Open Water Diver Course-New Zealand Sea Adventures, 9 Marina View, Porirua - Mana-Event Finder
events.name: PADI Open Water Diver Course
events.venue: New Zealand Sea Adventures, 9 Marina View, Porirua - Mana
events.description:
PADI is by far the largest and most popular Scuba diver certifying system in the world and for good reason. Courses are fun, safe, relevant, and packed with excitement! No matter what country you are in, your PADI qualification will be recognised.

The practical part of your Open Water Scuba Diver course takes just four days! During the first weekend, we make it very easy and convenient for you with our on-site dive pool (the only one in the Wellington Region). Our pool is where you learn to dive, so we can go at your pace, no matter how long it takes. During the first weekend, you learn and practice all the necessary dive skills. Once completed, you will be ready for the sea dives.

Once you are a certified diver, you will receive an eCard on your PADI App showing your qualification – and any PADI Dive Centre will be able to confirm your certification on-line. You will also be qualified to attend the PADI Advanced Open Water Diver course, and our regular Dive Days.

We want to make your diving safe and enjoyable. Welcome to the exciting world of Scuba diving!

If you have any questions please call, email or stop by our Dive Store.

Kind regards,
Tony Howell
PADI Course Director
Tel: 04 233-8238 Email: nzsa@scubadiving.co.nz Web: www.scubadiving.co.nz
9 Marina View, Mana, Porirua 5026


PADI Open Water Diver course at a glance:
•Digital theory: Open Water Diver eLearning Course (allow 8-14 hours)
•Practical: One weekend pool training, one weekend with four sea dives
•Options: One-on-one or unscheduled dates – additional costs apply.
•Start Time: Please be at NZ Sea Adventures by 8.30am daily.

Location:
We are located at 9 Marina View, Mana, Porirua; just north of the Paremata bridge on SH1. Look for the big yellow building. Check our website for location.

Prerequisites:
•Be at least 10 years old (special conditions apply for 10 and 11-year-olds)
•Be able to swim 300m (no time limit) and swim/float for 10 minutes.
•Be medically fit to dive. Check the Diver Medical Participant Questionnaire. If you answer YES to any of the questions or have any doubts, a visit to your doctor is required.
•Elearning must be completed before your pool training can begin.
•Complete the RDP Tables Quiz and Exam if you don’t have a dive computer.

What to Bring:
•Completed Diver Medical Participant Questionnaire.
•If Under 18 years – bring a Parent or Legal Guardian to sign your forms.
•A pen, swimming costume, towel and a snack for the breaks.
•Any personal dive equipment you wish to use.
•The $450.00 balance of your course fee.

Cost:
•Scheduled Open Water Diver Course Fee: total is $750.00; deposit is $300.00.
•Includes: PADI eLearning Course, Dive Gear Rental, Pool Sessions, and Sea Dives. Rental wetsuits are available in stock sizes only. Other sizes are available for purchase. Made-to-measure options can be ordered and purchased
•10% off all in-store purchases during your course. Does not include packages.
•$20 off your course fee for every person you get to sign on with you.

When:
Our PADI Open Water Diver Courses are scheduled year-round. See our online calendar for scheduled course dates or ask in store. Booking early guarantees your place and price.
Looking for different dates or smaller classes? Ask about our one-off course options. Let us know what you need and we will do our best to help (conditions may apply).

Booking your course:
•Course bookings can be made in-store, via email, online or over the phone
•The deposit of $300.00 secures your place on a course and purchases your eLearning course.
•Deposits are transferable to another person but are not refundable.
•Elearning courses, once redeemed, cannot be transferred.
•Before we can send you the eLearning link, we require your full name, date of birth, a valid personal email address and phone number.
•Your course balance is to be paid before we can begin your pool training.

events.venue: Rewa Rewa Station, 166 Rewa Rewa Road, Tinui, Masterton
events.description:
Our on farm Craft Open Days are aimed primarily at knitters, spinners, crocheters and other fibre crafters.

Nestled in the small rural community of Tinui is Rewa Rewa Station. Operating as a hill country Sheep & Beef breeding farm with a strong focus on NZ Wool & Fibre. Romney, Corriedale cross Romney, Polwarth & Gotland sheep provide the fleeces to create fibre products for crafters which are sold via the Rewa Rewa Station website, and at Fibre Markets. Our Studio Shop is also open during Craft Days, or by appointment outside of these days.

Our Craft Days give you an opportunity to work on your own project, seek advice, learn a new fibre skill or maybe just spend time with fellow fibre crafters while potentially ticking off a project or two in the process.

Please bring your knitting, crocheting, spinning , hand sewing, or any project you are working on and enjoy a drive in the country!

Coffee tea and snacks provided, but bring your lunch and stay awhile.

Everyone is welcome the more the merrier!

Note: Craft Days are primarily held on the 3rd Saturday of every month but occasionally we do have to juggle the dates.

events.id: Seeding hope-115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Seeding hope
events.venue: 115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Dr Jessica Hutchings has been leading and researching Indigenous food systems for decades, working from Papawhakaritorito, the farm she shares with Jo Smith at Kaitoke.  Jo and Jessica teach hua parakore, a kaupapa Māori system and framework for growing Kai Atua (Māori organic kai) and in November 2024 they published the book Pātaka Kai, which celebrates abundant food communities throughout Aotearoa.   In October 2024, Jess and Jo led mana wahine to Vandana Shiva’s Navdanya centre in India to present a Mana Wāhine Declaration on Seed and Soil.
Jessica will talk about the three pillars of seed, soil sovereignty and kai sovereignty as key food food futures as well as what it means to be in right relationship with our soil, seed and food systems.

events.id: Whakataua: An adornment workshop with Neke Moa-45 Laings Road Lower Hutt, Wellington 5010-Event Brite
events.name: Whakataua: An adornment workshop with Neke Moa
events.venue: 45 Laings Road Lower Hutt, Wellington 5010
events.description:
Bring in any treasures that you’ve foraged – shells, sticks, stones – and create a wearable artwork out of them. Some shells and fibre will be supplied. There are a limited number of spaces available for this workshop, so make sure you register to guarantee your place.
Neke Moa (Ngāti Kahungunu ki Ahuriri, Kai Tahu, Ngāti Porou, Ngāti Tūwharetoa) is an adornment and object artist, predominantly working with Pounamu (NZ jade). In 2000 she gained a Diploma of Design and Art at Te Waananga-o-Raukawa and then furthered her studies at Whitireia NZ, completing a Bachelor of Applied Arts in 2007. Moa has exhibited widely throughout Aotearoa and internationally. Over the last 4 years Moa has taught shell craft in Fiji and Tonga and continues to teach and learn as part of her art practice.

events.id: Chasing the Light-South Coast Studio, 1/408 The Esplanade, Island Bay, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Chasing the Light
events.venue: South Coast Studio, 1/408 The Esplanade, Island Bay, Wellington
events.description:
Creating a sense of light is a voyage of discovery. Good lighting makes a composition believable and emotionally resonant. We learn through practical exercises with examples from classical and contemporary artists and references from nature.

This is an introductory workshop and a pathway for an ongoing journey.

What we will cover


Greater awareness of light in form and composition

Tone is more important than colour

Different types of light

Colour temperature 

Local colour shifts under different lighting


Observe real life whenever possible.
Use soft transitions for form shadows.
Keeping light consistent across the scene.
Light revealing form; shadows hiding it.

What you will come away with:


Tone and value ranges

Studies in monochrome, which can be the basis of a coloured work

Downloadable handouts


Why Come?


A painting with good lighting always attracts the viewer. 

Understanding and constantly learning about light is integral to painting.

Developing an understanding of light rewards and expands your art practice


Notes
There is a minimum of four participants for this class to go ahead. 

Marc’s background
Marc has a background in film and theatre, art directing Maxwell Tapes and Turkish Delight directed by Howard Guard.

Around 2010 he took up photography and filming,  He’s worked with pilots throughout New Zealand, Alaska and the Canadian Arctic providing experiences resetting how he experienced light and mood.

These days he paints full-time and is represented by Exhibitions Gallery Wellington

events.description:
Come join us for a fun-filled day of sewing and socializing at Karori Arts & Crafts! Whether you're a seasoned pro or just starting out, this event is perfect for anyone who loves to sew. Bring your latest project or start something new - either way, you'll have a blast chatting with fellow sewing enthusiasts. Don't forget to pack your sewing machine, fabric, and any other supplies you'll need. We can't wait to see what you create! You will need to bring your own machine and materials. We'll supply an iron and ironing board to share, as well as a table and relatively comfy chair each. There are also spare cutting-out tables at a taller height. events.name: Conscious Connected Breathwork Immersion: Release, Reset & Realign
events.venue: Awhi Yoga and Wellbeing Centre, 15 Johnston St., Wellington
events.description:
If you’ve been stuck in your head, second-guessing, holding it all together - this is your invitation to let it all go.

You weren’t made to play small. You were made to feel free, powerful, and wildly connected to yourself. This session is about coming back to your truth, reclaiming your spark & putting full trust in the beautiful way your life is unfolding.

What is Conscious Connected Breathwork?
It’s a powerful somatic (body-based) practice using a slow circular breath pattern to move stagnant energy, release stored emotion, and tap into clarity, safety and deeper connection. It’s simple, potent, and deeply transformative.

Think: therapy meets meditation meets energetic upgrade!

• Release stuck energy, stress, and emotional weight
• Move through big feelings instead of spiraling in them
• Drop into your body like it’s home again
• Soften fear and reconnect with deep inner trust
• Reignite your fire + right to take up space
• Unravel old stories and remember your power
• Learn how breath rewires patterns + unlocks your truth
• Leave clearer, braver, and more fully alive

We’ll begin with cacao, grounding practices, and a Breathwork intro, before guided Breathwork, a lush sound bath for integration, space to anchor the shifts, and tea & snacks. You'll also receive my Post-Breathwork Care Guide and a personal follow-up from me to support your process.

No experience needed – just curiosity and an open mind.

Any questions, reach out!

Instagram: heyhailey_nz
https://linktr.ee/heyhailey_nz
hailey@heyhailey.co.nz
www.heyhailey.co.nz

events.id: Bach Choir of Wellington presents French Impressions-St Mary of the Angels, 17 Boulcott St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Bach Choir of Wellington presents French Impressions
events.venue: St Mary of the Angels, 17 Boulcott St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Join us for French Impressions, an exciting programme of French Romantic choral music. This concert features Louis Vierne’s Messe Solennelle, Op.16 and Gabriel Fauré’s Requiem, Op. 48, two deeply expressive works that embody the boldness and tenderness of these masters’ compositional styles.

The Bach Choir of Wellington welcomes soprano Rowena Simpson and baritone Joe Haddow, with Douglas Mews (organ), to bring these luminous works to life in the resonant acoustic of St Mary of the Angels.

Vierne originally envisioned his Messe Solennelle to be accompanied by orchestra, but his teacher, Charles-Marie Widor, advised him to use two organs (for practical reasons). Written while Vierne was organist at Notre-Dame de Paris, the work showcases his mastery of harmony with moments of both solemnity and radiant joy.

Fauré’s Requiem is a beautiful contrast to Vierne’s mass, offering a more intimate and consoling vision of the afterlife. Though, when asked why he composed it, he declared, “my Requiem wasn’t written for anything – for pleasure, if I may call it that!” Beloved for its gentle melodies and serenity, the Requiem reflects Fauré’s belief in eternal rest and peace.

We invite you to experience this afternoon of majestic and introspective French choral music.

events.id: Hands-on Sourdough Workshop-Headquarters Wakefield, Tasman 7025-Event Brite
events.name: Hands-on Sourdough Workshop
events.venue: Headquarters Wakefield, Tasman 7025
events.description:
Sourdough for Beginners - $120 (paid via internet banking)
Come join us for a hands-on, in-person sourdough workshop at Willow Corner Collective headquarters (aka my home)! This workshop is currently the only hands-on sourdough workshop being offered in the Nelson region - I teach and demonstrate to you and then you get to mix and practice on your own dough as we go along.
Whether you're a seasoned baker or a beginner, this event is perfect for anyone looking to master the art of making sourdough bread, learning from someone who has 10+ years of experience. Perhaps you've found all the Youtube tutorials and Instagram how-to's overwhelming and are keen to learn via an in-person class. Then this is for you! I've baked hundreds of loaves in the last year alone, sold at a market, and hosted a pop-up shop. However, my passion really lies with teaching others to bake their own sourdough in their own homes, for their own families (or small businesses - one day!).You will be taught, demonstrated to, and then you get to have a go yourself; whilst learning my tips and tricks along the way. Plus we finish by sampling some delicious, fresh artisan sourdough with some favourite toppings!
You'll go home with all you need to make a good loaf of sourdough bread:
Knowledge
Student Guide, including recipes
Bowl, liner, bowl scraper, and razor blade... all the tools you'd need to make sourdough
Dough made in class to bake the next day at home, to wow your family/friends
Confidence to continue the process yourself
Healthy, bubbling starter to continue your journey at home
Continued support and encouragement via our own private Facebook community group, for class attendees only*I recommend you already have a pair of digital scales, and a cast iron dutch oven at home to bake your loaf with as this makes the best, artisan sourdough, with great rise. Alternatively, a large, lidded casserole dish or enamel roasting pan work also. (The lids are a necessity).
Note: You will have your dough to take home after the workshop that will need shaping around 7pm, so please ensure that will work for you that day.Also, please double check the date when booking. Unfortunately if for some reason you are unable to attend on the day, due to time constraints, I am unable to refund your ticket. I am happy for you to send someone in your place, though. In extenuating circumstances I may be able to hold your ticket for a future workshop; this is decided on a case-by-case basis.
"Sarah’s sour dough class is for real life! Achieve beautiful delicious bread easily in your own kitchen. Sarah teaches you how to fit sourdough into your busy life. She clearly and passionately gives the essential information, tips and tricks to make your own loaf. I loved getting to have a go at each step in the process. I love Sarah’s catchy philosophy “The goal is good bread, not perfect bread.” This took all the pressure off, for me, and I left the class empowered with all the knowledge and skills needed to give it a go at home. I appreciated the thoughtful and well prepared resources Sarah gave us. Thank you!" - Megan
"Sourdough with Sarah was a delight!From feeling overwhelmed and giving up on the idea of ever making my own loaf of sourdough, to dancing with joy as i watch a beautiful perfect sourdough loaf get nice and golden in the homewood stove!The information was packaged in bite sizes with hands on practice in between, where we all got to experience each step of the whole process, which was cleverly condensed and prepared so that despite normally having waits in between, we were able to see it all play out in a short few hours!The process was beautifully organised with attention to detail that had us fawning, came away feeling so blessed and privileged!Sarah's glowing personality made all the information feel easy and palatable, it was so fun!Such a lovely time, great environment to learn with ease." -Melody

events.id: Harvest Moon-Hilltop, 17 Upland Road, Kelburn, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Harvest Moon
events.venue: Hilltop, 17 Upland Road, Kelburn, Wellington
events.description:
Gate opens 6.30pm Music Starts 7pm Saturday 19 July 2025
Americana and Country music band Harvest Moon feature a dazzling array of instruments including pedal steel, mandolin, guitars, banjo, accordion, and dobro, playing a diverse collection of classics from legends like Johnny Cash, John Prine, Dwight Yoakam, and Neil Young. The Wellington-based band’s front-man, lead vocalist Rob Reid provides a powerful and smooth singing style. Founding member & multi instrumentalist Garrett Evans plays pedal steel, dobro, guitars and sings vocals too. Dave Allen is Harvest Moon’s lead guitarist and banjo player - he also plays in Salty Hearts, and Hogsnort Bulldogs Goodtime Show. Another original member, Wayne Mills plays keys, accordion, bass and sings. A veteran of NZ’s vibrant 60s and 70s music scene, bassist Frits Stigter brings a wealth of experience and groove. On percussion - Robert Antonio is another well-known personality in the close-knit Wellington musical scene.
Come along to this special space and enjoy these guys playing up close and personal.
Not for profit, supporting our dedicated musicians. Suggested donation $40
Please reserve a seat via the Hilltop website.
Teas, Coffee and Snacks provided. You're welcome to bring anything you'd like to eat or drink.
Parking available in the Coupon zones of Upland Rd & Glasgow St free after 6pm weekdays, and free all through the weekends. The Wilson Carpark at the top of the Cable Car charges 24/7.

events.id: Before We Slip Beneath the Sea-Wairarapa Events Centre, Holloway St, Carterton-Event Finder
events.name: Before We Slip Beneath the Sea
events.venue: Wairarapa Events Centre, Holloway St, Carterton
events.description:
An immersive theatrical experience, brought to you by Red Scare Theatre Company.

On a small island off Wellington’s north coast, the local community have gathered for the last time in the wake of an impending evacuation due to rising sea levels. When one community member decides to take a stand against the evacuation, the community is divided, long-buried tensions come to the fore, and everyone must decide how to cope with change, loss and forces far greater than themselves.

“A hauntingly beautiful portrayal of human relationships. It’s a fantastic immersive experience that plunges you into the sea of its drama, and you don’t even really want to come up for air.” - Elliot Lam, Wellyott

Winner of Best Play by a Woman Playwright and overall Runner-Up at the 2024 Adam NZ Play Awards.

STARRING:
Charlie Potter, Hannah McKenzie Doornebosch, Craig Geenty, Megan Connolly, Helen Jones, Billie Deganutti and Ralph Johnson.

WRITTEN AND DIRECTED BY:
Cassandra Tse.

events.id: Elton John vs Billy Joel *NZ Tribute*-Copthorne Hotel & Resort Solway Park, 246 High St, Solway, Masterton-Event Finder
events.name: Elton John vs Billy Joel *NZ Tribute*
events.venue: Copthorne Hotel & Resort Solway Park, 246 High St, Solway, Masterton
events.description:
NZ’s Award-winning hit tribute show “Elton John vs. Billy Joel” are coming to Solway Masterton as part of their NZ-WIDE TOUR!

Doors 7pm , show starts 7.30pm sharp

After wildly successful sell-out shows across New Zealand, join Cam and Sam for an intimate night out as they wow audiences both young and old performing the greatest hits of Elton John and Billy Joel LIVE! Piano Man, Rocket Man, Uptown Girl, Goodbye Yellow Brick Road, We didn’t start the fire, Bennie and the Jets, She’s always a woman, Crocodile Rock and many many more.

Your favourite Elton and Billy songs are in safe hands with Cam and Sam, these professional touring NZ musicians have performed on live national television, commercial radio and featured in the NZ Music Charts in careers spanning two decades. This amazing Piano Man extravaganza features astonishing costumes, two grand pianos in black and white, a lighting show plus plenty of banter and all the songs you love.

Let's face it, Elton John and Billy Joel require little introduction, their music has provided a soundtrack for generations of loving fans. Englishman Sir Elton John has sold over 300 million records, making him one of the best-selling music artists of all time. He has more than fifty Top 40 hits on the UK Singles Chart and US Billboard Hot 100, including seven number-ones in the UK and nine in the US, as well as seven consecutive number-one albums in the US.

American Billy Joel has sold more than 150 million records and ranks as one of the most popular recording artists and respected entertainers in the world. Joel has had 33 Top 40 hits and 23 Grammy nominations. In 1999 he was inducted into the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame and has received the Recording Industry Association of America Diamond Award, presented for albums that have sold over 10 million copies.

events.id: Polar Extremes Album Release w. Bottom Bunk Club + The Rugs-MOON, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: Polar Extremes Album Release w. Bottom Bunk Club + The Rugs
events.venue: MOON, Wellington
events.description:
Polar Extremes is the sci-fi infused, post-modern satirical, apocalyptic musical endeavour of Auckland based creative Quaint.
Shrouded in mystery, Quaint was purposefully restrained in online presence, but has been a driving force in New Zealand’s underground scene since the 1990s, when eclectic performances across Wellington, and the songwriting of his debut record STRANGE VISIONS 1, began.
The first installment of a swirling trilogy detailing the apocalypse, STRANGE VISIONS 1 briefly emerged in 2019 and caught the eye of NZ music critics such as Graham Reid, who described the work as “fun, surreal, clever, fantasy-full, adultly childish (and vice-versa).”
In 2025, with the musical world-building of Polar Extremes as relevant as ever, STRANGE VISIONS 1 has re-emerged for an official release via digital streaming platforms.
The self-produced, mixed and mastered 12-track record paints a surreal scene for an uncertain future, but all signs point to Quaint nearing the completion of his fanciful trilogy. When? No-one knows!
**This event also features the multi-faceted talents of 'Bottom Bunk Club' and 'The Rugs'
***Doors will open by 8pm, and the performances will commence soon after!

events.description:
It is My Pleasure to invite you to a Bri Louise single release event for their new single “My Pleasure.” on the 19th of July starting at 9:30pm at The Rogue and Vagabond.

Bri Louise band consists of Bri Louise (vocal/keys), Molly Wyatt (flute/vocals), Becky Devine (bass), Theo Thompson (guitar), Eloise Edmond (Saxophone) and Ateo Buhne (drums). Bri Louise's band blends sultry queer R&B with smooth jazz and undeniable groove. Bri’s sound has roots in Gospel and Neo-Soul, evolving into a rich fusion of Jazz, Hip-Hop, R&B.

Supporting acts:

Tui the Band - a three piece Hi-Tek reggae band consisting of bassist Becky Devine, drummer Harper Champion and vocalist/guitarist Harry Young. The band merges electronic explorations with reggae making a unique experience spanning the many dialects of dub music. Echo drenched skanks meet heavy basslines and repetitive drum grooves that are bound to make you dance slow, low and easy!

John Paul Jr. - a DJ, musician, and producer from Te Whanganui-a-Tara. Drawing from soulful underground sounds, he fuses the warmth of boogie, jazz dance, rare disco, dub, and global rhythms with deep, percussive energy built for the dancers.
