After the last two sold-out parties, Mr Tubbs turns to one of Wellington's most respected underground heroes, DJ KOA. A famed global warmup specialist for Fat Freddy's Drop, Koa is also a complete weapon when it comes to taking you to that special place amongst the heat and the smoke.

events.id: Gong Bath at The Lotus Centre 26.07.2025-91 Ruapehu Street, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Gong Bath at The Lotus Centre 26.07.2025
events.venue: 91 Ruapehu Street, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand
events.description:
Nick is a musician and Mindful Somatic therapist based in Wellington and has been putting on gong baths throughout Wellington and more recently in Kapiti. The session has been crafted musically, leaning on deep drones from Paiste gongs and other instruments that harmonize together in layers, rather than loud, crashing strikes of the gong. Nick considers the nervous system throughout, giving you an experience of 'dropping' into deeper brainwave states through the form and gentle introduction.
The sound of the session is more like contemporary ambient music using acoustic instruments than traditional Eastern music, and positive feedback has included: feeling extremely relaxed, to having psychedelic imagery, to processing old memories. You never know what might happen, so its about just being open to the experience.
$35 per person with limited tickets/spaces!

events.id: Albi/Chris Dent & Hannah Morrell-Hilltop, 17 Upland Road, Kelburn, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Albi/Chris Dent & Hannah Morrell
events.venue: Hilltop, 17 Upland Road, Kelburn, Wellington
events.description:
Gate opens 6.30pm Music Starts 7pm Saturday 26 July 2025
Auckland based Albi/Chris Dent is an earthy songwriter who keeps both feet on the ground while being expressive and heartfelt in his stories and music.
His appearance is striking as he wields his albinism with pride in the form of a big white beard. His voice too isn’t quite what you’d expect. More smooth, more pronounced, and more powerful than his rough exterior may evoke. Chris grew up in rural New Zealand and likes to tell tales about the little things, as those are what make our lives rich and full. He’s mostly performed with award-winning indie-folk band Albi & The Wolves but has written songs in many different projects, including a collaboration with Mt Eden Dubstep that has amassed over one million streams, or his side project Sneakers which has a single with over 750,000 streams.
Whether it’s on the stage or off Chris is known for his work ethic and as he sets out on a new journey, quietly creating new solo music, he’s excited to see where that leads. For this show, Chris will be joined by the accomplished musician Hannah Morrell on the violin and maybe even the banjo. She is a seasoned touring musician who hails from Tasmania, Australia and has performed with the likes of The Dead Maggies (TAS), Claire Anne Taylor (TAS), Looking For Alaska, Finn Johanson, Holly Arrowsmith, and Jess Bailey (Fables).
Not for profit, supporting our dedicated musicians. Suggested donation $30
Come along and enjoy this gig in our special space, up close and personal.
Teas, Coffee and Snacks provided. You're welcome to bring anything you'd like to eat or drink.
Parking available in the Coupon zones of Upland Rd & Glasgow St free after 6pm weekdays, and free all through the weekends. The Wilson Carpark at the top of the Cable Car charges 24/7.

Joining the celebration are The Hutt Valley Singers, alongside a host of talented local artists and soloists. Raise your voice and wave your flag as you revel in stirring favourites like Jerusalem, Land of Hope and Glory, Sea Songs, and rousing patriotic marches — timeless highlights that capture the true spirit of this grand musical tradition.

events.venue: The Undercurrent, Wellington
events.description:
Saturday 26th July

The Undercurrent presents The Oscar Lavën Quartet: The Music of Django Reinhardt!

Dynamic woodwind virtuoso Oscar Lavën joins forces with swing guitarist specialists Adrian Jensen & James Quick, and double bass raconteur Robert Henderson to present a homage to the unique music of guitarist Django Reinhardt and violinist Stephane Grapelli. Together they will create hard-working interpretations of the infectious, foot-stomping, film noir music known in 1940s Paris as Hot Club, in the perfect venue for this music, the bohemian wonderland, The Undercurrent.

Saturday 26th July
Doors 7pm/ Doors 7:30pm
$20
Tickets available on the door & online!

events.id: Interlopers-Vogelmorn Upstairs, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: Interlopers
events.venue: Vogelmorn Upstairs, Wellington
events.description:
Interlopers will stand out at Vogelmorn Upstairs on July 26th, but we're sure they'll fit right into this gorgeous venue's shagpile vibe.

Following a memorable city debut at the Undercurrent, the quartet return with their fully-formed set of acoustic indie pop songs and stories. And tickets are priced like a bottle of bachelor wine!

Interlopers are based around the long-gestating songbook of Andrew Armitage and mellifluous cello and vocals of Sarah Laing, backed by the solid sync of Phil Peleton on bass and David Morgan on percussion.

Mr. Morgan described their drummer-less incarnation as 'The Front Lawn' meets 'Violent Femmes' so they had no choice but to let him join. A few post-punk covers are thrown in for good measure, but their focus is on time-honoured song craft with a good measure of wit and wisdom.

Interlopers are as yet unrecorded, but you can check out their little live music video of 'Bachelor Wine' for a wee taster...

Alan McElroy is an award winning Irish comedian, living in New Zealand. He is fresh from a sold out run with The Full Irish & The Comedy Pub Crawl at Melbourne International Comedy Festival and also a regular guest on RNZ’s The Panel. He has performed at the Edinburgh Fringe, Electric Picnic & performed to sold out crowds around New Zealand with his Irish & Scottish comedy show, Booze & Craic.

“Excellent Irish story teller performing a hilarious night of comedy” Funny Tonne, Melbourne International Comedy Festival

And Samantha Hannah
From her homeland in Scotland to her new home in NZ, Samantha has had audiences laughing around the globe. A class act.
Host of award-winning podcast Are We Pals? and as seen on the NZ Comedy Gala
“a talented raconteur” - Fringe Biscuit “Expert stand up throughout“ - Chortle “One of the funniest ladies on the planet” - Remote Goat

events.name: Showstopper: A Magical Musical Drag Show
events.venue: The Fringe Bar, 26 Allen Street, Wellington
events.description:
They say the neon lights are bright on Broadway …

Give them the ol’ razzle dazzle, gather your supporting cast and follow the spotlight downtown - it’s Showstopper: A Magical Musical Drag Show!

On opening night July 26, join our star-studded cast of local dragsters as they pay homage to rich and glitzy showbiz history. And where else but at the best little off-off-off Broadway theatre in town, The Fringe Bar!

You’ll see no understudies backstage here, but a 5 star review of leading ladies, principal actors, and so many triple threats you will be screaming for an encore and bringing down the house! They will be slaying upstage, tap dancing downstage, defying gravity and waiting in the wings for that callback that will shoot them to stardom!

Now break a leg and grab your tickets from just $25 on Eventfinda.


Venue, seating & show info

Cash only door sales are available if not sold out prior ($3.00 per ticket)

GA seating is unallocated, make sure to arrive early to nab a good vantage point.

Doors open one hour before showtime.

If you are part of a large group, contact us to save seats together, or you may be split up
Latecomers may not be admitted, you may be asked to wait before finding your seat if a performance is underway.

The event space is located up 6 upstairs, with narrow walkways between seating. The regular seating are black metal folding chairs, please contact us to discuss alternatives if this isn't an option for you. We will do what we can to accommodate as many bodies and abilities as possible.

Trigger warnings will be given before every show and we have a zero tolerance policy for abusive behaviour.

You can contact us at willysmackntush@gmail.com

events.description:
Get ready, Upper Hutt — the Brewtown Winter Craft Market is back and bigger than ever!

Foxtail Events are thrilled to bring the magic back to Brewtown this Sunday, 27 July 2025, from 9am to 2pm, for a winter market experience you won’t want to miss!

Set in the heart of Brewtown’s central Greenspace, this vibrant market transforms the chill of winter into a warm and welcoming celebration of local talent. Wrap up and wander through an exciting mix of handcrafted treasures, artisanal eats, and seasonal treats, all while sipping on brews from some of the region’s best local bars.

Expect a carefully curated lineup of talented artisans and makers, offering everything from:

* Unique handmade gifts
* Delicious artisanal food
* Warming drinks from Brewtown’s iconic breweries
* Cosy crafts and homewares
* Stunning local art and design

Plus, it runs alongside the regular Sunday Farmers Market, making this your one-stop destination for everything fresh, fun, and fantastically local.

Whether you're shopping for that perfect winter gift, treating yourself to something special, or just soaking up the lively community vibes — the Brewtown Winter Craft Market is the place to be.

Mark your calendar, gather your friends, and don’t miss this epic winter market event! Come for the crafts, stay for the brews — and make a day of it at Brewtown!

events.id: Wellington Winter Foraging for Wild Edible Weeds: SOLD OUT-Innermost Gardens Site, Lawson Place, Mt Victoria, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Wellington Winter Foraging for Wild Edible Weeds: SOLD OUT
events.venue: Innermost Gardens Site, Lawson Place, Mt Victoria, Wellington
events.description:
Join Felicity of Homegrown Botanica for a wander around the edges of the Innermost Community gardens to learn about commonly found, wild, edible weeds. Build a relationship with a natural world that is overflowing with abundant, wild, edible, nutritious, medicinal plants. Learn their names & get to know them, along with folklore & stories from the past.

By the end of the workshop you will:
- understand the basic principles of foraging, including sustainable harvesting
- feel confident in identifying 10-15 wild edible plants
- know about their nutritional & medicinal benefits
- know about common toxic/dangerous plants to avoid when foraging
- know about the best ways to prepare your foraged greens for maximum nutritional benefit & flavor
- feel empowered to include foraged greens in your everyday diet

Walk away with hands on, practical skills & knowledge that you can use in your own life.

Investment includes hands on wild weed walk & discussion, cup of foraged herbal tea & wildly delicious foraged snack.

To learn more about Felicity and her offerings,
visit @homegrownbotanica on social media
or www.homegrownbotanica.co.nz.
For any queries, please email felicity@homegrownbotanica.co.nz.

events.id: Natural Textured Rings-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Natural Textured Rings
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.description:
Make your own personalised ring - a gift for yourself or someone special! :-)

Learn the basic technique first in copper or brass, and then craft your final piece in silver!

Over this taster class, you’ll be guided through the process of heating and texturing metal, cutting and shaping with traditional jewellery tools. Use feathers, leaves, or fabrics to create a unique texture for a beautiful ring!

Learn to measure your finger, cut metal to length and texture it without rolling mill, hammers and punches. Then use a jewellers torch, sandpaper and polishing, and your beautiful new ring will be ready to wear.

This 3-hour class is ideal for beginners, groups of friends and visitors to the city.

Included in the class fee are copper and brass for practising on, a sterling silver ring strip and all consumables such as sandpaper, solder and chemicals. Extra metals are available for purchase in the studio.

Kids aged 12 (or so) are welcome to attend the class, but any person under the age of 16 must be accompanied by adults.

events.name: A Grand Tour
events.venue: St James Church, 71 Woburn Road, Lower Hutt
events.description:

Including the melody made famous as Stranger in Paradise, Borodin’s "Polovtsian Dances" also have much lively playing for the wind and brass sections. Following "Rhapsodies" based on folk tunes by Holst and Liszt, we feature French composer Bizet's dramatic "L’Arlésienne Suite no 2". The concert concludes with Sibelius’ much loved “Finlandia” .

Conductor Mark Carter

events.name: Levansa Trio (piano trio)
events.venue: St Andrews on the Terrace, 30 The Terrace, Wellington
events.description:
The Levansa trio played for us in 2022. They are Andrew Beer (violin), Lev Sivkov (cello) and Sarah Watkins (piano). Andrew is Concertmaster for the Auckland Philharmonia but frequently plays chamber music also. Lev is a concerto soloist, recitalist and chamber musician based in Switzerland. A laureate of numerous competitions, he won the Naumburg Competition in New York in 2015. Sarah was a founding member of NZTrio and is a frequent chamber music performer. She has been Classical Artist of the Year along with Andrew Beer.

Rebecca Clarke, Piano Trio (1921)
Salina Fisher, Kintsugi
Bohuslav Martinu, Piano Trio No. 1 H.193
Camille Saint-Saens, Piano Trio No. 2 in E minor Op 92

events.description:
Escape the chill and ignite your creativity at our exclusive Winter Warmers candle making workshop, hosted in partnership with the beloved The Botanist in Lyall Bay!

Join Wellington Candle Co. for a truly unique and premium experience designed for friends, dates, or anyone looking to cozy up this winter with a touch of handcrafted luxury.

What to Expect at this Premium Experience:

Craft Your Signature Scent:
Dive into the meditative art of candle making! You'll learn the secrets behind selecting and blending premium fragrance oils to create a soothing aroma that's uniquely yours.

Your Handcrafted Masterpiece:
Guided by Wellington Candle Co., you'll pour your very own 250g wood-wick candle using high-quality soy wax, all housed in a beautiful, large white glass jar with an elegant wooden lid.

The Botanist's Delights:
While your wax cools and sets (the perfect time for a break!), indulge in a delightful array of gourmet platters and small plates expertly prepared by The Botanist.

Bubbles or Brews:
Your ticket includes one complimentary glass of bubbles or a refreshing non-alcoholic drink to enjoy as you create and mingle. Additional coffees or drinks can be purchased directly from The Botanist's cafe.

A Take-Home Treasure:
At the end of our relaxing 2-hour session, you'll proudly take home your finished, personalized candle, ready to infuse your space with warmth and your chosen winter-inspired scent.
____________________________
Important Details
*Spaces are strictly limited to 18 people to ensure a personalised and enjoyable experience for all.
*Bookings are essential and available exclusively through EventFinda. Secure your spot early to avoid disappointment!
*Dietary Requirements: Please ensure you note any dietary requirements when booking your ticket (email wlgcandleco@gmail.com), and The Botanist team will do their best to accommodate.
*Child Attendance: While we welcome all ages, please note that this workshop involves hot wax and fragrance oils. Children must be directly supervised by a responsible adult throughout the session to ensure their safety and guide them through the process.
_____________________________
Workshop Terms & Conditions (Agreement Upon Booking):
By booking your ticket for this workshop, you acknowledge and agree to the following terms and conditions

Safety & Participation:
*Participants will be learning and working with heated wax and fragrance oils. You agree to follow all safety methods and instructions provided by Wellington Candle Co. staff.
*Photography & Videography Consent: Wellington Candle Co. reserves the right to use photos and videos taken during the event for publicity materials and social media. By booking, you grant permission for your likeness to be used in our marketing materials without further consent or compensation.
*Waiver of Liability: Your participation is solely at your own risk and liability. You understand that candle making involves certain inherent risks (e.g., hot wax, dyes, equipment). You hereby waive, release, and discharge any and all rights and claims against Wellington Candle Co. and its staff for any personal injury, property damage, or other claims arising from your participation in the workshop or incidents on the premises (including, but not limited to, slips and falls, or burns). Every effort will be made by Wellington Candle Co. to ensure your safety.
_____________________________
Gather your friends, treat yourselves to an afternoon of creative bliss, and leave with a candle that embodies the comfort and warmth of winter.

DON'T MISS OUT – book your tickets today and let's get making!

events.id: vegetable.machine.animal 'Guest' Album Tour, w/ Indigogue Browne-Common Ground, Featherston, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: vegetable.machine.animal 'Guest' Album Tour, w/ Indigogue Browne
events.venue: Common Ground, Featherston, Wellington
events.description:
vegetable.machine.animal - 'Guest' album release gig
featuring
vegetable.machine.animal
indigogue browne

vegetable.machine.animal
A live conversation between plants, fungi, machines, and human musicians
What would it sound like if we could interact musically with plants and fungi—if humans stopped to listen and respond?
vegetable.machine.animal is an interspecies improvisational trio exploring this question through a hybrid sonic language of biosignals, modular synthesis, and live drums.
Led by drummer Kieran Monaghan, the project transforms living data from plants and fungi into voltage, translated into sound via modular synthesizer. Monaghan responds in real time, creating a feedback loop between human, organism, and machine.

Their debut album, GUEST, was recorded during the 2024 Sonic Artist Residency (Creative New Zealand / NZSM / Toi Pōneke) and emerged through open-ended, intuitive sessions. A diverse group of collaborators was invited to join the process, including Kedron Parker, Nico Buhne, Bill Wood, Ruby Solly, Indigique Brown, David Long, Andrew Faleatua, Andy Wright, Gemma Thompson, Timothy Morel, Mo H. Zareei, Tae Kyung Seo, Issac Smith, and Chrissie Butler.
Rather than guiding the music, contributors were invited to follow it—adding their voices to a living, shifting ecology of sound. The result is an album that is rhythmic, irregular, immersive, and alive.

GUEST is co-released by Audio Foundation Records (Tāmaki Makaurau) and skirted Records (Te Whanganui-a-Tara).

KIERAN MONAGHAN
Kieran Monaghan is a self-taught multi-instrumentalist, writer, recording artist and sound bogan based in Te Whanganui-A-Tara. He is a prolific creative and organiser, with an irrepressible DIY ethic, known for his experimental and innovative approach to performance and sound making. Used to drum with mr sterile Assembly

indigogue browne
guitar, detritus, synth, violin, vocals

events.id: Writers on Mondays: Making and Mending-Te Marae, Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Writers on Mondays: Making and Mending
events.venue: Te Marae, Te Papa Tongarewa, 55 Cable Street, Wellington
events.description:
MAKING AND MENDING: CADENCE CHUNG, GREGORY KAN, JIAQIAO LIU, AND NINA MINGYA POWLES
A poet’s toolbox is filled with techniques to help them kick-start or rebuild a poem, but sometimes the tried and true tricks aren’t enough. How can poets engage with other forms of art and artmaking to challenge and reinvent how poetry is written? New Zealand Poet Laureate Chris Tse talks with Cadence Chung (Mad Diva), Gregory Kan (Clay Eaters), Jiaqiao Liu (Dear Alter), and Nina Mingya Powles (In the Hollow of the Wave) about how their creative pursuits and interests outside poetry shape and inform their latest collections.

Writers on Mondays is presented with the Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa, Circa Theatre and Phantom Billstickers National Poetry Day, and is supported by the Letteri Family.

events.id: Building a More Secure Future in a Changing Climate: How the UK Connects Climate, Growth and Security-33 Bunny Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Building a More Secure Future in a Changing Climate: How the UK Connects Climate, Growth and Security
events.venue: 33 Bunny Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
NZIIA Wellington Branch is delighted to welcome members and guests to an upcoming event "Building a More Resilient Future in a Changing Climate: How the UK Connects Climate, Growth and Security"

This event will bring together the Deputy British High Commissioner to New Zealand John Pearson, and the Chief Operating Officer of Octopus Energy NZ, Margaret Cooney for a fascinating event on how the UK approaches the nexus between climate change, security and economic growth.
John Pearson will cover his personal experiences with these issues throughout his career and the UK's modern approach to these global challenges. He will cover how the UK has put climate, nature, and clean energy at the core of domestic and international policy priorities and integrated it into key strategies like the recently released industrial strategy and security strategy. This will outline the journey the UK has been on to more than halves its emissions since 1990, while significantly growing the economy and outlining the path ahead.
Margaret Cooney will discuss her thoughts on clean energy transition, technology and security and talk about what Octopus Energy has done in the UK and their goals in New Zealand. Octopus Energy is a global clean energy tech business headquartered in Great Britain, driving the affordable, green energy system of the future across 18 countries with cutting edge energy products now provided to 7.7 million households globally.
Following short keynotes from John Pearson and Margaret Cooney there will be fireside chat and opportunity for Q&A from the audience.

At the conclusion of the Q&A there will be a networking reception for all attendees kindly sponsored by the British High Commission.

EVENT DETAILS

Date/Time: Tuesday 29 July, 5:30-7:45pm

Venue: RHLT1, Pipitea Campus, Victoria University of Wellington

Doors Open: 5:05pm Q&A will be open to attendees.




TERMS AND CONDITIONS

-Registrations are required to attend this event. No walk ups allowed. Non members can attend by paying the registration fee.

-Should you have not renewed your NZIIA  membership please do so prior to registering for this event.

-One ticket per person. Each ticket must contain your full first and surname, email address and phone number that matches your ID. 

-If, after registering, you are unable to attend the event please have the courtesy to cancel your ticket to ensure other people are able to attend. A waitlist will operate.

-In keeping with NZIIA practice, unauthorised recording of this event (either audio or video) is not permitted. Members and guests are reminded to adhere to the NZIIA Code of Conduct.


BIOGRAPHIES OF OUR SPEAKERS

Deputy British High Commissioner to New Zealand
John Pearson
In the early 2000’s John was the first in the UK to publish on the climate security nexus and helped to inform the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) at the time. Since then he’s integrated a sustainability focus into his work as a diplomat from helping to protect the Amazon while posted in Brazil, leading the UK’s South East Asia climate network, to supporting Laos’s transition to renewables while Ambassador there.

Chief Operating Officer (Country Head), Octopus Energy NZ
Margaret Cooney

Margaret Cooney is the Chief Operating Officer of Octopus Energy New Zealand, a role she's held since June 2020. She spearheads the company's New Zealand operations, focusing on energy sector innovation. Margaret previously led Powershop New Zealand and has held various roles in energy and technology companies in the UK, US, and New Zealand. With deep expertise in energy market regulation and innovation, she also contributes to an Electricity Authority advisory group. Margaret is dedicated to using technology for more affordable and sustainable energy and fostering a competitive New Zealand energy market. She holds Law and Economics degrees from the University of Canterbury and also studied at the University of California, Berkeley.

events.id: Habits Mastery Series: Mindset Reset - Rewire Your Thinking for Growth-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Habits Mastery Series: Mindset Reset - Rewire Your Thinking for Growth
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.description:
Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars

Feel stuck in the same patterns, even when you're trying to change?
It’s not a lack of motivation. It’s not a lack of willpower.
It’s a mindset that doesn't serve your purpose.

Join us for the next workshop in our Habits Mastery Series:

In this interactive 1-hour workshop, you’ll learn:

How your beliefs shape your habits and outcomes

The difference between a fixed and growth mindset

How to shift your internal dialogue and self-image

Tools to break limiting beliefs and unlock your potential

“Whether you think you can, or you think you can’t — you’re right.”
— Henry Ford

Walk away with practical tools, inspiring insights, and the motivation to think bigger about your life.

Meet your host, Nava

Nava’s natural interest in studying physics blossomed into metaphysics when she arrived in the land of the long white cloud. Originally from Germany, Nava was travelling on a quest to find purpose and answers to the mysteries of life. Did she find anything on this quest? Yes! After four exciting years of inquiry, practice, and being immersed in the wonders of bhakti yoga, she is still fully inspired by what she has discovered. Mesmerized by the depth and broad-mindedness that a yoga lifestyle offers, Nava is keen to share with you that wisdom and love, along with her experiences on the road of life. Nava is also an expert vegan chef who specializes in European cuisine and baking, and she is busy spreading that kind of love around Bhakti Lounge too!

events.id: Ceremonial Cacao, psychedelics, and neuroplasticity - exploring shamanic practices of Peru - Kapiti-Coastlands Shopping Centre New Tenancy Building MTB 4/Tenancy 4, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Ceremonial Cacao, psychedelics, and neuroplasticity - exploring shamanic practices of Peru - Kapiti
events.venue: Coastlands Shopping Centre New Tenancy Building MTB 4/Tenancy 4, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand
events.description:
Join us for an immersive workshop  that bridges ancient indigenous traditions with cutting-edge neuroscience to explore the powerful intersection of cacao, psychedelics, and spiritual transformation.
In this workshop, you will discover the rich history and sacred significance of cacao in indigenous cultures, focusing on its use in ancient Peru. Learn about the temples, tribes, tools, and symbols associated with cacao, as well as its role in shamanic rituals. We will delve into the cosmovision that links cacao with psychedelic plant medicines and how these ancient practices are integrated with modern scientific understanding.
Key Highlights:
-The Sacred Role of Cacao: Explore the origins of cacao in the ancient temple of Montegrande and Chavín de Huántar, Peru, key sites of shamanic initiation dating back over 7000 years. Shamans used ceremonial cacao to connect with the divine and combined it with San Pedro cactus to induce visionary experiences.
-Cacao & Neuroscience: Understand how ceremonial cacao influences brain chemistry and supports spiritual awakening and neuroplasticity. We'll discuss the latest neuroscience research on cacao’s ability to facilitate transformational change and rewiring of the brain.
-Cacao Personality Mapping: Through biochemical mapping, we have developed a "Cacao Personality Map" to help you tailor your cacao experience to your personal needs, whether for healing, insight, or emotional clarity.
-Integrating Tradition & Modern Science: Learn how ancient practices are validated and enhanced through contemporary neuroscience, and discover how cacao can be a tool for deep inner work and to enhance both mental and physical health.

If you’re passionate about cacao and curious about its transformative potential, this workshop  will expand your understanding and deepen your connection with this sacred plant. Whether you’re a cacao lover or a seeker on a spiritual path, this experience will open your mind to the possibilities cacao holds for healing, awakening, and change.
Date: Tuesday 29th Jul 2025, 6.30 - 8.30 pm NZST
Location: Commonsense Kapiti - Coastlands
Tickets: Book online from $5-15 (ultra early bird - late pre-sales)
Extras: Get 10% off all Seleno Health products after the event and a free sample cup of a creamy ceremonial cacao elixir during the workshop.
Presenter:
Dr Corin Storkey (PhD – Med Chem) has over 20 years of academic and research experience, specialising in understanding how plant medicines interact with the brain and body. He holds a PhD in medicinal chemistry from the University of Melbourne. He has previously overcome chronic fatigue syndrome and promotes an integrative and holistic approach to managing chronic health conditions. He currently leads the New Zealand based Andean/Amazonian plant medicine research program that studies ancestral plants and substantiates their traditions through biochemical analysis.

events.id: L'Dor V'Dor 2025 - “SEARCHING FOR IDENTITY”-80 Webb Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: L'Dor V'Dor 2025 - “SEARCHING FOR IDENTITY”
events.venue: 80 Webb Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
“SEARCHING FOR IDENTITY”
By Claire Bruell
Design & Production by Mike Reganon
"This is your history, these are your stories, my gift to you." These are the last words in Claire Bruell's four-book series to future generations - her "five beautiful grandchildren", Simon, Sofia, Lily, Nate, and Isaac.
But more than a gift to her grandchildren, these books spell out the trauma Jews have faced over millennia and, through her resolute and gently probing of the Bruell and Briess family trees over four generations, she exemplifies the lives of so many. Jews around the world will identify with the tragedies and joys, the uplifting and the horror, the sheer delight and abject gloom.
Carefully moulded over four books, Claire describes these stages and reveals the lives of her ancestors as they grow and achieve success, have wonderful families, meet catastrophe, are split asunder, murdered by Nazis, and finally regather the remnants to rebuild - a story so familiar to Jews who have only sought peaceful coexistence for centuries.
Claire will describe aspects of the process of creating that content from age 32 through to today, and with Mike, will speak about some of the features of working together and the exquisite joy of laying it all out on paper.
Claire Bruell
Claire is a historian particularly interested in 19th-century Europe and the Holocaust. Her interests span history, genealogy, reading, collecting curios and ex libris, and from time to time she speaks and writes on many of these subjects. She has been a Justice of the Peace for 30 years and the coordinator of an oral history project in Auckland for almost as long. Her days are focused on family and community.
Mike Reganon
Mike is a retired teacher, journalist, editor, designer, and publisher. He has dabbled in pottery, sculpture, printing, oil painting, and renovating the family home, a lifetime occupation. Today, he continues his clay creations by joining a local pottery group and has begun learning Yiddish using Duolingo. As those skills improve, he hopes to find others keen to practice the mamaloshen, but right now he’s farshmakht.
Important Update
To ensure the continued delivery of our high-quality speaker series, we've transitioned to a paid model. Your support is crucial in maintaining the excellence of our events and speakers. Unlock invaluable insights at our upcoming L'Dor V'Dor single session for just $10*. If you are a Holocaust Centre member, you’ll enjoy an exclusive 30% discount, paying only $7*. 
*GST & booking fee are additional. 
To check your membership status, contact operations@holocaustcentre.org.nz or sign up HERE.

events.name: Herman’s Hermits
events.venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
English rock and pop group Herman’s Hermits formed in 1963. Still going strong 62 years later, the band heads to Wellington’s St James Theatre in 2025. Known for jaunty songs and often tongue-in-cheek vocal style, Herman’s Hermits had many transatlantic hits. With catchy tunes like Mrs Brown, You Got a Lovely Daughter, Henry the VIII, No Milk Today, and There’s a Kind of Hush, you’ll have plenty to tap along to. 
Herman’s Hermits was one of the ‘British Invasion’ bands that followed the success of The Beatles in the 1960s and 70s. They hit the American pop charts 22 times with songs that became rock’n’roll anthems all over the world. The Wellington Show promises to be as energetic and lively as they were six decades ago.

events.name: Power Up: Navigating the Powerchair Landscape (Palmerston North)
events.venue: 748 Rangitikei Line Palmerston North, Manawatū-Whanganui Region 4475
events.description:
Powerchair Academy Palmerston North - Venue to be announced
_____________________________________________________________________________________________
Overview:
This training session will provide an in-depth look at the Quickie power wheelchair range, covering key features, clinical applications, and available adjustments to ensure future-proofing. Participants will explore alternative drive controls, including chin, head, and specialty switching, with hands-on opportunities. The session will also focus on outdoor mobility options, highlighting the Magic Mobility portfolio and clinical decision-making for product selection. Practical demonstrations, including the Q700-Up standing power wheelchair, will enhance learning and engagement.
About our Presenters:
Steve's Bio:
Product Consultant & Power Chair Specialist - Medifab
Steve’s career in the mobility industry began at 18, after forming a deep appreciation for wheelchair users from a young age. With over 30 years of experience, Steve first honed his skills as a technician, repairing and understanding the inner workings of power chairs. He later transitioned into sales and training, where he now helps therapists and advisors deliver tailored solutions.
Steve is driven by a passion to improve the lives of those with mobility challenges, sharing his expertise with technicians, end-users, and clinicians alike. His dedication extends beyond his work, having volunteered in Samoa to assist with wheelchair set-ups for those with limited resources.
Amy's Bio:
Clinical Director - Sunrise Medical
Based in Sydney, Australia, Amy develops and delivers national and international training programmes on Assistive Technology, focusing on enhancing inclusion, health, and well-being for individuals with physical disabilities. She also plays a key role in product improvement and development at Sunrise Medical Australia.
With a passion for innovation, Amy is dedicated to finding practical solutions that create meaningful change, even in challenging environments. She was instrumental in establishing Australia’s chapter of GoBabyGo, a charity promoting early mobility for young children.
Amy is an experienced speaker who has lectured extensively on seating and mobility, wound management, and spinal cord injury rehabilitation. She has also travelled to developing countries, sharing knowledge and learning from medical communities worldwide.

events.name: Bizezi Business Course Porirua 2025
events.venue: 3 Wi Neera Drive, Elsdon, Porirua 5022, New Zealand
events.description:
What is a Bizezi Business Course?
A Bizezi Business Course is a FREE to attend 3-Day intensive, designed to help you make real progress quickly with your start-up idea or a business. We will spend every day with you working with you on your business to help you with whatever you need to get going. Come along on the first day and see what it's all about. 
The SPARK of an idea is often where the business journey starts and yet to become a viable business the SPARK has to be tested. Then like building a brick wall, the business needs strong foundations and they have to be laid one brick at a time. The Bizezi 3-day SPARK programme starts with ideation and yet over the three days the business owner will build an understanding of the business jigsaw and landscape and especially their next steps.
It doesn't matter if your passion is baking cakes, flying drones, art, crafts, dog walking, supporting the community or writing blogs; we can show you how to make money doing it!

This is going to be the best darn business course you will have ever been on.
What Can You Expect?
This course will be 3-Days of learning skills. Here are few outcomes.
Validating the business * Accelerate your planning * Clarity on the business idea * Confidence in the business 
Forecasting future steps * Knowing your market size * Identifying risks * Allocating resources 
Knowing your competition * Identify potential customers * Determine the market size
Re-learn what you think you know about starting a business.
The 3-Day Spark Programme is Free for all Porirua residents, business owners and anyone who wants to start a business in Porirua, supported by Porirua City Council.
A HUGE THANK YOU to our partners:

events.id: Annual Women's Debate 2025: Parity in Politics-33 Bunny Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Annual Women's Debate 2025: Parity in Politics
events.venue: 33 Bunny Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
With local elections fast approaching this October 2025, what is being done to achieve a #GenderEqualNZ within our political systems?
In the 2022 local government elections, only 38% of candidates were women. Despite this being an increase from previous years, significant structural and cultural barriers persist for women seeking to enter and remain in politics.
From issues around childcare to gender-based violence to stereotypes in the media, women experience hostility at all levels of the political sphere. Several women in local government across the country spoke with Breakfast in April, sharing the hateful comments they’ve received online, with abuse and violent threats often spilling into the real world.
So how do we encourage more women into political leadership, and what needs to be done to keep them there?
The Wellington Branch of National Council of Women New Zealand, in collaboration with Graduate Women Wellington and Zonta Club of Wellington, are hosting The Annual Women’s Debate 2025 to discuss this question.
The event will be hosted by award-winning journalist and broadcaster for RNZ, Susie Ferguson. She'll be joined by a stellar line-up of women:
Susan Freeman-Greene, Chief Executive of Local Government New Zealand
Tory Whanau, Mayor of Wellington City
Afnan Al-Rubayee, senior public servant and community leader
Rebecca Matthews, Wellington City Councillor
This year’s Annual Women’s Debate will focus on the experiences of women from across the political spectrum and the gendered obstacles they have faced in politics. Furthermore, the debate will explore what is being done to address barriers to women’s political leadership, and how women representatives can empower a #GenderEqualNZ.
Light refreshments will be available from 5:30pm before the debate starts at 6:00pm.

events.id: Ceremonial Cacao, psychedelics, and neuroplasticity - exploring shamanic practices of Peru-147 Tory Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Ceremonial Cacao, psychedelics, and neuroplasticity - exploring shamanic practices of Peru
events.venue: 147 Tory Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Join us for an immersive workshop  that bridges ancient indigenous traditions with cutting-edge neuroscience to explore the powerful intersection of cacao, psychedelics, and spiritual transformation.
In this workshop, you will discover the rich history and sacred significance of cacao in indigenous cultures, focusing on its use in ancient Peru. Learn about the temples, tribes, tools, and symbols associated with cacao, as well as its role in shamanic rituals. We will delve into the cosmovision that links cacao with psychedelic plant medicines and how these ancient practices are integrated with modern scientific understanding.
Key Highlights:
-The Sacred Role of Cacao: Explore the origins of cacao in the ancient temple of Montegrande and Chavín de Huántar, Peru, key sites of shamanic initiation dating back over 7000 years. Shamans used ceremonial cacao to connect with the divine and combined it with San Pedro cactus to induce visionary experiences.
-Cacao & Neuroscience: Understand how ceremonial cacao influences brain chemistry and supports spiritual awakening and neuroplasticity. We'll discuss the latest neuroscience research on cacao’s ability to facilitate transformational change and rewiring of the brain.
-Cacao Personality Mapping: Through biochemical mapping, we have developed a "Cacao Personality Map" to help you tailor your cacao experience to your personal needs, whether for healing, insight, or emotional clarity.
-Integrating Tradition & Modern Science: Learn how ancient practices are validated and enhanced through contemporary neuroscience, and discover how cacao can be a tool for deep inner work and to enhance both mental and physical health.

If you’re passionate about cacao and curious about its transformative potential, this workshop  will expand your understanding and deepen your connection with this sacred plant. Whether you’re a cacao lover or a seeker on a spiritual path, this experience will open your mind to the possibilities cacao holds for healing, awakening, and change.
Date: Wed 30th Jul 2025, 7:00 - 9.00 pm NZST
Location: Commonsense Wellington, 147 Tory Street
Tickets: Book online from $5-15 (ultra early bird - late pre-sales)
Extras: Get 10% off all Seleno Health products after the event and a free sample cup of a creamy ceremonial cacao elixir during the workshop.
Presenter:
Dr Corin Storkey (PhD – Med Chem) has over 20 years of academic and research experience, specialising in understanding how plant medicines interact with the brain and body. He holds a PhD in medicinal chemistry from the University of Melbourne. He has previously overcome chronic fatigue syndrome and promotes an integrative and holistic approach to managing chronic health conditions. He currently leads the New Zealand based Andean/Amazonian plant medicine research program that studies ancestral plants and substantiates their traditions through biochemical analysis.

events.venue: Awhi Yoga and Wellbeing Centre, 15 Johnston St., Wellington
events.description:
AWHI Yoga and Wellbeing’s accredited 200hr YTT program is a comprehensive and thorough journey into becoming a 200 hr certified Yoga Teacher. We are the only vinyasa yoga teacher training in the world that blends Te Ao Māori and ancient yoga wisdoms, offering a uniquely 'Aotearoa' experience while retaining universal relevance for teaching and practicing yoga in any part of the world.

Our training is suitable for individuals interested in becoming a yoga teacher, or those looking to take a personal journey towards deepening your own practice and knowledge. Either way, we guarantee a transformative and life-changing experience that will deepen your relationship to yoga, others, Aotearoa and your self.

Our uniquely Aotearoa Teacher Training explores the beautiful marriage between ancient Yoga and Te Ao Māori teachings over five separate modules during our three months together. Our course follows the Māori hauora/wellbeing model of Te Whare Tapa Whā, which takes the same holistic view of health taken by traditional Yoga. As we work through each pillar we start tapping into something way greater than ourselves, enabling us to connect with our purpose in life and how we might share this in service to the world!

A $1,000 deposit reserves your spot.

events.id: Garden Planting Design-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Garden Planting Design
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Garden Planting Design
Spent a fortune on plants and still not achieved the dream? Can’t work out why some plants thrive and others barely survive? Ready to make exciting changes but no idea where to start and not much gardening background? This interactive and fun course will answer all your queries and give you confidence to create the garden you want with the right plants to achieve it. Style of garden, colour, plant palette – we’ll cover it all – and more.

Time permitting, we will look at photos of your gardens as “personal case studies” to help you get the most from the course.
After completing the course, you will have created a detailed hand drawn plant design that will be your blue print for the next steps… planting up!
 
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: 
•Identify the style of your dream garden and learn what plants will best achieve this and guarantee success
• Identify and work with the site and climate conditions of your garden/outdoor areas to be developed; modify plant choices if necessary
• Accurately draw your detailed planting design on paper and to scale.
• Understand the role of colour and different plants in the garden and incorporate it into your design
• Learn how to improve your soil to guarantee success
• Use your final design to create a “shopping list” of plants
• Calculate anticipated expenditure / prepare a budget (to also include soil improving items)
 
Please note that this course DOES NOT include:
 
Hardscaping design. This is available in a separate course.
 
• Planting up your garden
• Recommending suppliers, service providers and retailers, although knowledge and experiences of the tutor and peers will be shared appropriately
• Pruning practices or plant disease management
• Organic methods of practice, although knowledge and experiences of the tutor and peers will be shared appropriately
• In depth coverage of specific plant groups eg roses, vegetables
Please bring some scrap paper, a notebook, pens, pencils and an eraser.
Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

events.id: The Overthinking Mind: Finding Peace in Mental Chaos-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The Overthinking Mind: Finding Peace in Mental Chaos
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.description:
The Overthinking Mind: Finding Peace in Mental Chaos
Transform the exhausting cycle of mental loops, rumination, and decision paralysis into mental clarity and peace.

This 60-minute workshop will give you practical tools to break the cycle. You'll discover why your brain fixates on worry, how to interrupt rumination before it spirals, and master simple techniques that create instant mental clarity. Walk away with a proven system based on FasterEFT for transforming your overthinking patterns into inner peace, so you can finally quiet the noise and reclaim control of your mind.

Plus, your ticket includes a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert—because taking care of your mind is best supported by feeding your body well.

Meet Krishnaloka, your host

Introducing Krishnaloka, who is driven to help others overcome their issues within their mind and pyschology. As a mind technician trained in eutaptics (Faster EFT), she employs the fastest and most powerful method to create lasting change by addressing the root causes of issues rather than just the symptoms. Her warm and caring nature makes every interaction with her both comforting and transformative.

events.id: Yoga Nidra: Moon Bathing-Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Yoga Nidra: Moon Bathing
events.venue: Bhakti Lounge Wellington, 1st Floor, 175 Vivian Street, Wellington
events.description:
Yoga Nidra: Moon Bathing
Slow down, settle in, and let the soft glow of the moon guide you inward.

This calming evening will centre around the deeply restorative practice of Yoga Nidra—a guided meditation designed to bring your body into a state of deep rest while your awareness gently drifts between waking and dreaming. Known to activate the parasympathetic nervous system and reduce stress, Yoga Nidra supports emotional balance, mental clarity, and a profound sense of ease.

This moon-themed session invites you to tune into the gentle, reflective energy of the lunar cycle—a time for slowing down, softening, and simply being.

After the practice, we’ll be sharing a nourishing plant-based dinner together. It’s included in your ticket and is a lovely way to gently transition back, connect, and enjoy wholesome food in good company.

Meet Karuna, your host
Trained as a primary school teacher, she also has a background in psychology and Spanish. But her heart is in connecting with others and she always brings a lively and warm energy to the space.

Spaces are limited and tend to fill quickly.

events.id: Dungeons and Decades: Time Is Just A Number-BATS Theatre, 1 Kent Tce, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Dungeons and Decades: Time Is Just A Number
events.venue: BATS Theatre, 1 Kent Tce, Wellington
events.description:
Stop the clocks - you won’t want to miss this adventure through time!

Wellington-based Dungeons and Dragons podcast Last In Initiative is back, and this time not even the clock can contain us.

Mark it in your calendars, get the date right, and be at BATS for three timeless tales, guaranteed to take you on a comedy-packed, action-filled romp across time, space, and most importantly, the 80’s.

Join our players as they spark a Fantasy French Revolution in 1789, rob a speeding train in 1886, and get minimum wage jobs at an arcade in 1982.

Each night brings new adventure, new challenges, and most importantly, a new decade.

So join our four time travellers as they stumble their way across all of the 80s.

Or at least three of them.

This show follows the success of 'Dungeons and Delinquents: Be Gay Do Crime' and 'Dungeons and Da Vinci: The One With Art', shows that had TTRPG nerds and novices alike laughing along.

Now 'Dungeons and Decades' promises to be a game equally full of hijinks, and with time puns so consistent you can set your watch by them.

events.id: Raising Great Kids In An Overindulgent World-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Raising Great Kids In An Overindulgent World
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.description:
Parenting today delivers unprecedented challenges – are you wondering what went wrong and somehow ended up living with a child you don’t recognise as should be belonging to you? Get a new perspective, an easy-to-understand model to follow and tools to help you to raise likeable and respectful children in an age of over-indulgence.

This workshop will be a confronting one that will expose you to the risks that children face in this modern overindulgent world. Many have become used to being the constant centre of attention and are unable to delay gratification and aren’t competent in everyday skills.

They have few self-care skills and skills relating to others, can’t take personal responsibility and don’t know what is enough or what is “normal” for others – these children end up having a difficult time of it in life and you will too.

You’ll take away new insight and knowledge plus strategies that you can apply that very night to help your child to be a responsible, likeable and respectful person.

By the end of the session, you’ll be able to:
- Reflect on the current context parents are faced with today
- Find the relevant research
- Practise the parenting tools and discuss the model
- Know where to go to get support

Aimed at parents, grandparents and caregivers of children of all ages.

Presented by Madeleine Taylor.

events.id: Te Manu Tāiko - Māori Student Experience Day Pukeahu 2025-Wallace Street Wellington, Wellington 6021-Event Brite
events.name: Te Manu Tāiko - Māori Student Experience Day Pukeahu 2025
events.venue: Wallace Street Wellington, Wellington 6021
events.description:
Nau mai ki a Te Manu Tāiko – A Wānanga for Future Māori Leaders
Join us for a series of inspiring workshops led by some of Massey University’s leading creatives, thinkers, and doers. Through hands-on activities and thought-provoking kōrero, you’ll explore themes of cultural identity, leadership, and what it means to thrive in education as Māori.
This wānanga is designed for senior Māori secondary students who are thinking about university and want a real taste of what that journey could look like. You’ll get to connect with other like-minded tauira from across the motu, meet current Māori students and staff, and experience the unique support available to help you succeed at Massey.
Come explore the spaces, stories, and opportunities waiting for you — and start building the future you want, grounded in who you are.
Register: 9:00am
Mihi whakatau starts at 9:30am
We will also host student panels and tours across the campus after our workshops
Day finishes at 2:30pm

Friday 1st August 2025
Please select 1 workshop from the following:
Creative Expression through Indigenous Knowledge. Explore Indigenous knowledge through art in this hands-on workshop grounded in Mātauranga Toi Māori. You’ll create a small artwork inspired by one of three themes: Mātauranga Toi Māori, Te Rau Karamu marae, or Puke Ariki — each offering a unique connection to culture, place, and story.
Sounds of the Land: Taonga Pūoro & Technology in Harmony. Join Associate Join Associate Professor Horomona Horo (Ngāpuhi, Ngāti Porou, Taranaki) for an inspiring journey into the world of taonga pūoro — the traditional musical instruments of Aotearoa — and their deep connection to whenua.
Pikorua in 3D: Design, Create, Connect. In this workshop, you’ll bring together mātauranga Māori, tech, and sustainability to create something meaningful. You’ll start by designing your own infinity swirl — the Pikorua — using beginner-friendly 3D software. Then, using a pre-printed version made from recycled plastic, you’ll learn how to remove support structures, sand it down, and tie on the aho (cord).
Shoot & Go: No-Edit Film Challenge! Keen to try filmmaking but not sure where to start? In this hands-on wānanga, you'll get a quick bootcamp on using a Canon cinema camera, then head out in a small rōpū to plan and shoot your own short film — with a twist. Every cut has to be made in-camera. No retakes. No editing. Just solid mahi and sharp storytelling.
Lead, Support, and Stay Prepared. Join Hinemoa Katene for an interactive introduction to emergency response through Coordinated Incident Management System (CIMS) training. This hands-on workshop empowers rangatahi Māori to build confidence, leadership, and practical skills to support whānau and iwi in times of natural disaster. Learn how to work together to strengthen community preparedness and be ready when it matters most.
Unleash your imagination through storytelling.Storytelling is a powerful way to express and share ideas and explore new worlds. Whether it’s through writing, speaking, or creating, every story matters. Join award-winning writer Whiti Hereaka in a practical workshop to hone your storytelling.
Find Your Voice, Shape Your Future.Communication is at the heart of connection – whether you're telling a story, sharing an idea, or working with others. In this engaging workshop, you will explore the many ways communication can lead to exciting paths in media, tech, leadership, the arts, and more. Build confidence, spark creativity, and discover where your voice can take you with award winning playwright Elspeth Tilley.
Discover the Art in Science. You'll learn how to reveal the hidden beauty of rocks through a polarised microscope. By examining thin sections of rock, students will uncover stunning, colourful mineral patterns – nature’s own artwork revealed through science. Perfect for curious minds and budding geologists!
Create a Character. Whether you’re into games, movies or animation, this is your chance to bring characters, creatures and environments to life. We’ll lean into Māori wood carving and create your own detailed 3D sculpture. Work step-by-step, shaping in ZBrush and adding realistic textures and colour in Substance Painter. No prior tech knowledge necessary.
Photography. Exploring Cyanotypes and Alternative Photographic Processes Join a senior Māori Photography student and a Photography lecturer in a hands-on workshop to explore the creative world of cyanotypes, one of the earliest forms of photography.
Spatial Design. Explore Spatial Design and its role in shaping the spaces we engage every day. Guided by tikanga and processes of kōrerorero, hui, and wānanga, we’ll examine how design can elevate our stories of people and place.
Industrial Design. Explore the types of processes used by Industrial Designers and see the huge range of possibilities in the 3D Workshop.
Understanding Us: A Dive into Psychology.
Explore how and why we think, feel, and act the way we do through the lens of psychology. This workshop introduces Indigenous Māori psychologies and clinical psychology — two powerful areas that help us understand both ourselves and others. Learn about Massey’s Centre for Indigenous Psychologies and discover how psychology can support wellbeing and create real change.


We’ll provide lunch, please bring your own drink bottle. Wear something comfortable so you can move easily and get a bit messy.
Any questions please e-mail Barbara Scott at B.Scott2@massey.ac.nz

We’re looking forward to hosting you.
Ngā manaakitanga

Whether you're just starting out with new business ideas or have years of experience under your belt, all are welcome! Empower Her provides a safe space where you can share your business with others, connect with like-minded women in business, and prioritise collaboration over competition.
Our groups value the power of connection, and we believe that together, we can achieve more than we ever could alone. That's why we're committed to fostering a supportive community that empowers each member to reach their full potential. Our groups are focused on connection, inspiring stories, celebrating each other's successes and sharing our vulnerable moments.
Join our free community
The Inner Circle
Follow us on Instagram
Empower Her Co-Founders Victoria and Charlotte are highly passionate and dedicated to empowering female leaders in the business world. By joining Empower Her, you will not only expand your professional network but also gain access to a supportive community of like-minded individuals who are committed to helping each other succeed.Find out more about us and check up our upcoming events on our website.

events.id: EVolocity Arduino Workshop - Wellington 2025-Trentham, Upper Hutt 5018, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: EVolocity Arduino Workshop - Wellington 2025
events.venue: Trentham, Upper Hutt 5018, New Zealand
events.description:
This workshop is for EVolocity students or those interested in our program for Years 7 - 13. 
Explore electronics & programming and learn how to build a dashboard for your EV.

Our Arduino programming experts will take you through a step-by-step tutorial on building and programming your Arduino-based system monitor for your own electric vehicle. Our Tech Team have been hard at work developing new Arduino workshop content and hardware, which is intended to be much more concise, and more useful to teams who are wanting to get a foot in the door with programming and data-related electronics. For Open Class teams, you must monitor the temperature of lithium batteries as per the rules, and everyone will leave the Arduino workshop with a working temperature monitoring system. This workshop is essential for those using lithium batteries.
WHAT WE WILL COVER
• Understand what an Arduino is and how it works
• Learn how to use an Arduino safely, and how to program your Arduino using code you've written
• Begin making a dashboard for your electric vehicle to provide performance data
• Along the way, you will learn valuable programming constructs such as variables, conditionals, loops etc
If this is new to you, you won't be alone! No experience is necessary.
ARDUINO KIT
If you are attending the workshop, you will need to purchase a kit. The kits will be provided at the workshop and you'll be sent an invoice following the event. Kits are $45+GST. If you aren’t intending on coming along to the workshop but would like to purchase a kit, please let us know.
WHAT TO BRING
There is a chance that the University computers may have driver issues, so as a back up, students are to bring their own computers. The programming software is free, and please ensure this is installed and tested in advance. THE REQUIRED SOFTWARE DOES NOT RUN ON CHROMEBOOKS. Please download Arduino IDE 2 (the one at the top of the page), and ensure you are using a Windows, Mac, or Linux computer. There may be some devices available on the day for those who do not have a device. You can download the Arduino Guidebook and Example Sketches here. The booklet steps you through the connections and programming, and the example sketches are what you will work from during the workshop.
Please bring a snack and a drink bottle.
Location
Upper Hutt College, Engineering Workshop Room T2, Theory Room T6.
Parking
Free parking available on site.
Contact
School Co-Ordinator / Annabelle Batchelor / 027 4100 633 / annabelle@evolocity.co.nz

Wellington, get ready! It’s been a minute!

Fresh off a sold-out show in Auckland, Niko Ne Zna returns to the capital for a night of explosive Balkan brass at Vogelmorn Hall.

events.id: Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents: Callum Passells-Bedlam And Squalor, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents: Callum Passells
events.venue: Bedlam And Squalor, Wellington
events.description:
The seventh concert in our series is a new suite of music by Tāmaki Makaurau composer, performer, and educator; Callum Passells.

For the Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Callum brings new music for his ensemble LCR, an ensemble which features three identical saxophone trios (sax, bass, and drums) that play with and against each other in a kaleidoscopic and often explosive fashion. The new pieces commissioned for this series continue to stretch at the fabric of jazz and improvised forms, and are inspired by Morton Feldman, Lennie Tristano, Henry Threadgill and Sly Stone.

Callum has been deeply involved in the New Zealand jazz and improvised music scene for over a decade, and is a busy freelancer in the wider music community in Auckland. He has performed with Aldous Harding, Hans Pucket, the Exploding Rainbow Orchestra, the Auckland Philharmonia Orchestra, among many others. In 2021, Callum was commissioned to compose a large-scale work 'Solid Spirit, Liquid Body' for the Wellington Jazz Festival. He is currently completing a Master of Music degree at the University of Auckland, where he also teaches saxophone.

The Jazz Orchestra Composer Series showcases original music for large jazz ensemble by New Zealand composers. Concerts take place every 1st and 3rd Friday of the month, from May to October, from 7pm. Tickets are $15 from Humanitix, door sales $20.

The programme highlights the versatility of the classical saxophone through a range of chamber works for trumpet, piano, violin, bass trombone, flute, and saxophone. Curated by Tessa, the concert features some of her favourite repertoire and presents the saxophone in a fresh and dynamic context.
All proceeds will support Tessa’s upcoming move to the Netherlands, where she will begin a Master of Music at Codarts, Rotterdam, studying under renowned saxophonist Femke IJlstra.

events.id: Yoga Nidra-Awhi Yoga and Wellbeing Centre, 15 Johnston St., Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Yoga Nidra
events.venue: Awhi Yoga and Wellbeing Centre, 15 Johnston St., Wellington
events.description:
Join us on the first Friday of every month at to AWHI yourself with a 90-minute Yoga Nidra. Unwind from the stresses of the week and the month in a state of relaxation. Yoga Nidra, often referred to as "yogic sleep," is a deeply restorative practice that promotes physical relaxation, mental clarity, and emotional balance. It's the perfect way to rejuvenate your mind, body, and soul: your hinengaro, tinana and wairua.

Yoga Nidra is a powerful technique that directly works to heal your mind by removing samskaras - untying knots and mental impressions. This practice of learning to relax consciously is well regarded as an antidote for stress, anxiety, poor sleep amongst other health benefits.

What to Expect:
- A 90-minute guided Yoga Nidra Meditation led by one of our experienced instructors
- A comfortable space to lie down (mats, blankets, bolsters & cushions provided)
- A supportive community of fellow meditation enthusiasts
- Complementary herbal tea before/after the session;
- An opportunity to journal your experience, if desired
- A chance to destress and cultivate inner calm

Yoga Nidra is for everyone and no prior experience is required - everyone is welcome to experience the profound benefits of Yoga Nidra with us.

Wear comfortable clothes, and bring an open mind, a journal and eye mask if you have one (not required).

So, mark your calendar for the first Friday of each month and treat yourself to an evening of deep relaxation and mindfulness.

Let's come together and discover the transformative power of Yoga Nidra Meditation. See you there!

events.id: Altared States: Electronic Soundscapes In A Divine Place-Old St Paul's, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: Altared States: Electronic Soundscapes In A Divine Place
events.venue: Old St Paul's, Wellington
events.description:
Wellington’s iconic Old St Paul’s (OSP) will play host to a transcendent new series in August, partnering with the Pyramid Club to present Altared States, a unique electronic music experience. Set beneath the exquisite stained-glass windows of one of Te Whanganui-a-Tara’s most exquisite landmarks, this series promises an immersive sonic experience that invites audiences to explore sound in a deeply personal and transformative way.

Altared States is inspired by Brian Sweeney’s New York-founded Ambient Church, an initiative dedicated to collaborating with artists to create transformative audio performances in architecturally significant spaces. This series will immerse attendees in soundscapes that transcend the ordinary, offering a chance to disconnect for a moment from the modern world.

Each of the evenings will bring a different electronic vibe, conjured by some of Wellington’s most innovative artists. The series lineup includes:

August 1: Ludus
August 8: Stephen Gallagher with David Long and Jules Desmond
August 15: Oghum
August 22: Dream Chambers

Set within the chancel at the altar of the venue, each artist will perform a 60-minute immersive sound experience that redefines ritual in a contemporary light.

Tickets are available now, with limited capacity of 50 for each show of this intimate series.

About the Artists

Ludus

is the captivating musical venture curated by Emma Bernard. Her creative inspiration spans across the worlds of electronic music, audio engineering, sound design, and the written word. Bernard’s artistic journey explores the deep connection between soundscapes and the natural world, with a focus on evoking emotional responses to the environments we inhabit. She is also co-founder of the Pōneke-based collective Tonic.

Stephen Gallagher

is an Emmy award-winning composer and music editor who has worked on an extensive range of projects, from global blockbusters to television and contemporary dance. Most recently, he completed the score for The Lord of the Rings: The War of the Rohirrim, directed by Kenji Kamiyama. Gallagher’s work spans collaborations with Peter Jackson, Brian Eno, Ed Sheeran, Nick Cave, and many more.

David Long

is a composer, performer, founding member of The Mutton Birds, and member of easy listening noise band, Teeth. His career has spanned over 40 years and seen him work on numerous projects to commercial and critical acclaim. In his own words he likes to “mash shit up”, creating orchestral scores that utilise “not only classical instruments but all sorts of things”.

Jules Desmond

is an experimental musician from Wellington who has played in bands including Letterbox Lambs, 1/3 Octave Band, Bachelor of Architecture and Black Boned Angel.

Oghum

is the interstellar duo of Nell Thomas (Orchestra of Spheres, Cookie Brooklyn and the Crumbs) and Jonny Marks (All Seeing Hand, Mean Bones), performing on Synthi AKS, theremin and other assorted items. Oghum blends electronic sounds from times past with an array of acoustic and found sounds, using nuanced improvisation to create detailed and tangible sonic environments, invoking memory and transporting the listener through narrow gaps into wide open otherworldly spaces.

Jess Chambers

is a composer, musician, and educator currently based in Aotearoa New Zealand, and working under the moniker Dream Chambers. From her beginnings as a folk singer to her current explorations in electronic music, she experiments with sound as a practice of attention: to a room, an outer world, an inner feeling. It’s in that space of beholding where transformation and connection occur, and Chambers is a master alchemist, likening that stretch of attention in music to growing a garden: “There’s a lot of searching, reaching and eventual blossoming in my music – it feels like coming up from underground, like a tulip bulb.”

About the Venue

Built in 1866, Old St Paul’s is a prime example of timber Gothic Revival architecture and one of Aotearoa’s most important historic places. Managed and operated by Heritage New Zealand Pouhere Taonga, it is a venue steeped in history and beauty.

The Pyramid Club, located on Taranaki Street, is an artist-run space dedicated to experimental music and sonic arts, providing a home for innovative sound exploration.

events.id: Friends of Karori Cemetery - Evening Tour (Aug 2025)-15 Rosehaugh Avenue, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Friends of Karori Cemetery - Evening Tour (Aug 2025)
events.venue: 15 Rosehaugh Avenue, Karori, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
events.description:
Evening Tour
Would you like to join us and explore the beauty of Karori Cemetery in the evening?
This tour is for anyone who would like to see the Cemetery through a different lens, as the landscape settles in from dusk to darkness. On this walk you'll be accompanied by two guides who will take you on a wander through some of the most magical parts of the cemetery, with a story or two of early Wellingtonians along the route. We might even spy a Ruru/Morepork or two! The tour does not have any scary themes. There are points on the tour where we may pause and turn off our torches to enjoy the landscape in the darkness.
The tour is of approximately 1.5 hours duration and starts and finishes at the Main Chapel on Rosehaugh Avenue, where there is plenty of easy parking.
Each attendee needs to bring their own torch that they can comfortably carry for the duration. No head torches please for the comfort of your fellow walkers.
The route mostly follows paved surfaces but there are some areas of unevenness. Surefootedness is required. This tour involves approximately 2km of walking, with some slow paced but uphill stints.
The tour is not suited for children under the age of 12 or unaccompanied minors. There are no toilets on the route.

Each tour is $10 per person (plus non-refundable booking fee).
Our tour has a maximum capacity of about 15 persons. If there are insufficient tickets remaining for your party, please email us at info@friendsofkaroricemetery.co.nz to check if we can accommodate you.
Note:
If we have to cancel a tour due to inclement weather or sickness, we will notify you on the day by 9am by email and on our Facebook page. The booking fee is non-refundable.
Please dress appropriately for the conditions. While we do our best to guide you on a safe walking route, during the winter months the ground can become slippery in places.
Some of our walks require a moderate degree of fitness and are not suited for those with limited mobility. Please read the tour descriptions carefully to check that they will be suitable for you.
We look forward to welcoming you to Karori Cemetery.

Not My Sister is a house music DJ born and raised in a little town in the north of Italy. Now based in Wellington, she started this project in 2024, and recently she has been lighting up dance floors across New Zealand, you may have already come across her sets at Twisted Frequency, Kiwiburn, Earthbeat, Cuba Dupa, Arkadien and other events across the country. Influenced by funk and disco, with a special focus on vocals and anything groovy, Not My Sister brings high energy and uplifting sets. Constantly developing as an artist, she always brings fun and passion to the dance floors. Expect a delightful fusion of melodic basslines, blending soulful, tech, garage, and deep house sounds.

--------

Mysterious, mercurial and multi-faceted. SorchaLula has as many shades to her music as she does to her personality. A dynamic producer/DJ, she flows from slinky sensuality, to fierce filth, to the uncompromising underground. Every set features her original tracks, many melting with honeyed vocals by singer Samuel (Cecilia’s Crop). In tune with what the body needs, she entwines beauty with bravery, sinuous melodies with hefty bass, lush peaks with decadent darkness.

She has played many top festivals around Aotearoa: Northern Bass, Shipwrecked Festival, Twisted Frequency, Aum Festival NYE, CubaDupa, Taniwha’s Den and more. She is highly rated by some of the biggest names in the scene for her taste, depth, and intuitive understanding of dancefloors. As founder of The Sensonauts she created events exploring the senses, music, dance, and music education with a focus on inclusivity.

--------

These two scallywags have the Welly wind in their sails and a groove in their hearts.

They're the duo behind the capital's much loved club night, Mi Casa Su Casa, now rockin' for over 15 years.

They've also had the pleasure of playing some of NZ's most legendary shindigs like Shipwrecked, Off The Radar, Kiwiburn, CubaDupa, Taniwha's Den and Rhythm & Vines.

With the people on the dancefloor their inspiration, they'll share a bounty of underground house to lift you up and bring you on a journey.

Learn the essential sewing skills you need to get you started in this one-day workshop. You'll take away your own lined bag and lots of ideas and inspirations for further projects.
