events.id: INTRO TO MUSICAL IMPROV | A POPROX IMPROV COURSE-61/69 Abel Smith Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: INTRO TO MUSICAL IMPROV | A POPROX IMPROV COURSE
events.venue: 61/69 Abel Smith Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Musical improv can be absolute magic. Whether it's a whole musical show, or single song that bursts out of an emotional scene, music adds so much to our improv.
This course for improvisers will give an introduction to musical improv. We'll cover basic song structures, how to get into a song from a scene, how to support a song through chorus work, and why and when we use music to add to our improv.
Participants should be confident in scene-work and have at least 2 years improv experience. This course will not teach you how to approach scenes and characters, so you should have a solid foundation which you can add to with this new toolbox of musical skills.
The course includes 6 workshops which will run 6:30pm to 8:30pm on Wednesdays from August 6th to September 10th. As it is an intro course, we do not anticipate a showcase for this course.
ABOUT THE TEACHERS
LIA KELLY is a theatre-maker and teacher based in Pōneke. She is an established director, actor, improviser and musician and has been a part of productions across the city over the last 10 years. She directed One Night Band which won 'Most Original Production' at the Wellington Theatre Awards 2023, and performs regularly as both a player and musician for POPROX.
ISAAC THOMAS has been an improviser and improv musician for a decade in Pōneke and Whakatū/Nelson. He's played with Body in Space, Playshop, Poprox and been musical director for musical improv powerhouse The Pāua Ballads. He has worked with almost every major improv company around the city accompanying them through improvised piano, guitar and vocals.
THE STANDY-BY LIST
PopRox firmly believes that improv is for everyone, especially when it comes to sharing skills and knowledge. So we're offering "the stand-by list" for all our workshops in 2025. We'll giveaway any spots remaining a few days before the first workshop of the course, on a first-come-first-serve basis. No need to provide a reason, no questions asked. If the entry fee is a barrier for you to come along, then simply email poproximprov@gmail.com and we'll pop you on the SBL. Everyone on the list will be notified whether there was a place available for them 3 days before the first workshop.

events.id: Shostakovich Unpacked | NZSQ + Antipodes Quartet-Prefab Hall, 14 Jessie St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Shostakovich Unpacked | NZSQ + Antipodes Quartet
events.venue: Prefab Hall, 14 Jessie St, Wellington
events.description:
Introducing Shostakovich: Unpacked. A four-part concert series presented by New Zealand String Quartet and friends to commemorate the 50th anniversary of Shostakovich’s death.
Across four night-time gatherings, the NZSQ will take to the stage with Orchestra Wellington, Antipodes Quartet, Ghost Trio, and pianist Jian Liu to explore the raw emotional power of one of the 20th century’s most troubled, yet defiant, musical voices.
Each concert features a specially curated selection of the chamber music of Shostakovich, paired with the unique voices of Aotearoa composers. From duets, to quartets, to a full chamber orchestra, we're getting up close to the celebrated chamber music and lasting legacy of Dimitri Shostakovich, 50 years after his death.
We invite you to join us on the journey of “Shostakovich: UNPACKED”, as together we explore and question what this powerful music meant in the time Shostakovich wrote it, but also how vitally important the composer’s artistic voice still is today.
Concert Two: Wednesday 6 August, 6:30pm, NZSQ x Antipodes Quartet
Artists onstage: NZSQ / Antipodes Quartet
Shostakovich: 6th and 7th String Quartets, String Octet
Unpacked: The music of Gao Ping
Spotlight: Be part of Aotearoa’s musical history, as the first chapter of the newly formed Antipodes Quartet unfolds in their Wellington debut. Created as part of a visionary new partnership between NZSQ, Chamber Music New Zealand, and the Adam Chamber Music Festival, the next generation of leading chamber musicians step forward; two string quartets artistically colliding, joining forces to perform Shostakovich’s gripping octet.
Tickets: $15 - $55, or get a season pass to all four concerts for $180 per person
Season pass discount will be automatically applied at checkout when you have one 'Season Pass' ticket per person, per concert date in your cart.
In order:
Wednesday 9 July, 6:30pm & 8:30pm, NZSQ + Orchestra Wellington
Wednesday 6 August, 6:30pm, NZSQ + Antipodes Quartet
Wednesday 1 October, 6:30pm, NZSQ + Ghost Trio
Tuesday 25 November, 6:30pm, NZSQ + Jian Liu

events.description:
Canadian punk-rock outfit PUP are returning down under for the first time since 2022. Headlining cities in Australia and New Zealand this August, the Toronto-based band will be celebrating the release of their fifth studio album Who Will Look After The Dogs, out 5 May 2025.

Set to play crowd favourites from their catalogue of anthems including PUP (2014), The Dream Is Over (2016), Morbid Stuff (2019) and THE UNRAVELING OF PUPTHEBAND (2022), they’ll also be performing new gems from their forthcoming album Who Will Look After The Dogs. Praised by Pitchfork for their “supremely hooky” sound, PUP’s energetic live shows continue to turn industry heads, with the Washington Post applauding their “raucous sets filled with singalong anthems”.

Set to amplify Australian and New Zealand stages this August, PUP are ready to bring their radically lovable sound to fans down under.

 Don’t miss PUP live in Australia and New Zealand this August!


San Fran holds a Supervised License, meaning minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue. Minors are of course not allowed to purchase alcohol under any circumstance.

Since his 2016 debut, Dope Lemon has cultivated a reputation for creating dreamy, laid-back grooves with introspective lyricism. Now the Australian singer-songwriter is going on tour. He’s traveling to Wellington to share his latest album, ‘Golden Wolf’. 
Dope Lemon is the moniker of Angus Stone. His music has struck a chord with audiences across the globe. His four previous albums have amassed over 700 million streams online. events.id: CPD: Mastering Masterspec Specifications PARAPARAUMU | ⭐ 20 CPD Points-Otaihanga Road, Otaihanga 5036, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: CPD: Mastering Masterspec Specifications PARAPARAUMU | ⭐ 20 CPD Points
events.venue: Otaihanga Road, Otaihanga 5036, New Zealand
events.description:
⭐ CPD Points: 20
Description
This CPD course, titled "Mastering Masterspec Specifications," is designed to provide specifiers with comprehensive training on effectively utilising the Masterspec platform for specification writing. Participants will learn the ins and outs of navigating the Masterspec platform, setting up their specifications, managing user accounts, and optimising the use of various features such as Office Masters, MasterKey, and mDocs. The course covers essential topics ranging from basic specification setup to advanced specification management techniques, ensuring participants gain practical skills to streamline their specification writing process.
Designed by specifiers for specifiers
This course is designed for specifiers, including architects, designers, engineers, and other professionals involved in the construction industry, who are responsible for creating specifications for building projects. Whether you are new to the Masterspec platform or looking to enhance your proficiency in specification writing, this course provides valuable insights and practical skills to optimise your workflow and maximise the benefits of using Masterspec for specification management.
Why should specifiers take this course
Specifiers should take this course to enhance their proficiency in specification writing and maximise the benefits offered by the Masterspec platform. By mastering the tools and functionalities covered in this course, specifiers can:
Improve Efficiency: Learn how to navigate the Masterspec website and utilise its features effectively, saving time and effort in specification writing tasks.
Ensure Accuracy: Gain insights into best practices for setting up specifications, assigning roles, and managing user accounts to maintain data accuracy and consistency.
Enhance Collaboration: Understand how to collaborate with team members, assign roles, and share specifications seamlessly within the organization, promoting teamwork and productivity.
Stay Updated: Stay abreast of the latest features and updates on the Masterspec platform, ensuring specifiers are equipped with the knowledge to leverage new tools for enhanced specification writing.
Optimise Workflow: Discover advanced techniques for managing specifications, utilising Office Masters, and integrating with drawing sets using MasterKey, leading to streamlined workflow and project efficiency.
Ensure Compliance: Learn about NZCIC guidelines and best practices for adding, editing, and exporting guidelines to ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations.
Boost Professional Development: Acquire valuable skills and knowledge that contribute to professional growth and advancement in the field of specification writing, enhancing career prospects and opportunities.

events.id: The Girls Uninterrupted - Matinee-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: The Girls Uninterrupted - Matinee
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.description:
Meet the women behind The Girls Uninterrupted and Kiwi Yarns — bold, brilliant, and refreshingly real. Brodie, Gracie, and Caitlin each bring their own spark, sass, and storytelling to the mic, making a vibrant blend of laughs, heart, and unfiltered conversation. With backgrounds spanning journalism, broadcasting, and even nursing, these three besties are as relatable as they are remarkable — and they’re not afraid to say exactly what you’re thinking.

Brodie is 17-million-miles-an-hour, and if you were looking up “shy, introverted wallflower”, you would not find her anywhere near it. She is an award-winning journalist and podcaster who has had a successful, exciting career as a broadcaster in New Zealand for 18 years. She loves to run slightly uncomfortable long distances, has a real passion for gin and has been single for 923 years. She was once a champion surf lifesaver and spent a few years in the New Zealand Army. There’s never a dull moment with this independent media powerhouse.

Gracie is a wee pocket rocket originally hailing from the mighty Waikato. Currently living in Auckland, with her husband Ali and beautiful boys Frank and Otis, she has an extensive career in journalism and New Zealand media industries. She loves fitness, fashion, animals, and cooking. Once an accomplished equestrian who represented New Zealand overseas, Gracie is also extremely passionate about fashion and the arts and doesn’t need an excuse to get dolled up for any occasion. Her drink of choice? A dirty martini, extra olives.

Caitlin Marett is a small-town girl who, after ten years in radio, decided to leave her job as executive producer of ZM’s Fletch, Vaughan and Megan to pursue her dream of helping people by becoming a nurse. She’s obsessed with rosé, watching Friends on repeat and always finds herself in inexplicably weird situations. Caitlin would love a husband (she has a WONDERFUL boyfriend) and loves love so much that she became a marriage celebrant, which doesn’t help with her ability to cry at everything. She tries to live ethically and wants to be a vegan but can’t stop eating cheese. Just your average millennial who’s a basic bitch with a big heart.

events.id: Women of Pōneke August 2025 Event-70 Molesworth Street, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Women of Pōneke August 2025 Event
events.venue: 70 Molesworth Street, Thorndon, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Welcome Meg Williams: living with creativity, awe and imagination

We’re thrilled to officially introduce Meg Williams, CEO of World of WearableArt, as our speaker for the next Women of Pōneke signature event on the 7th of August at The National Library.

Meg is an internationally acclaimed leader in creativity and live events. Over two decades she has worked with artists from around the world and brought major festivals and events to audiences in Aotearoa New Zealand, Australia and the U.K.

This is an extra special time for us to hear from Meg as WOW celebrates 20 years in Pōneke. The uplifting 2025 WOW Show: RISE, is set in an imaginary city illuminated with the creative spirit, and offers us the chance to “ignite what lies within”.

Join us to hear Meg share how she has discovered the power of awe including:
• Goosebump moments from her life in the arts and at WOW
• The power of creativity in leadership and wellbeing
• How we can awaken wonder in our own lives and the communities we walk in

Meg will inspire your imagination and consider how to unleash your passions, whatever they may be and however hidden they may feel.
✨Tickets are now live — come break the winter blues with a night of imagination, inspiration and connection.
Get your tickets now! 
Numbers are limited due to space, so we recommend you get in and quick! We are limited to 180 only. 
We will be serving wine, beer and amazing non-alcoholic drinks, inclusive in the ticket price. Platters will also be shared throughout the evening. 
So grab your ticket now and share with at least one amazing woman (and/or ally) in your life.
To cover our costs, we are charging for this event. We know that things are tough at the moment for many, so if this is a barrier for you to attend, please contact us and we will do everything to support you to attend. 
Help a woman in need
If you wish to support someone else who may have a financial barrier, please buy one of the "Buy-One, Give-One" tickets, so we can support more of the amazing women of Pōneke to attend.
Get in quick!
Tickets for previous events have sold out fast. For this event we are capped at 180 people attending and we will be updating our social media channels on the progress of the ticket sales, so get your tickets quick.  
Accessibility
The National Library is fully accessible. If you are not able to use the steps on Molesworth Street, you will be able to access the venue via the lift off Aitken Street. There will be staff at the door to be able to support and guide you to the venue space.
A bit about us 
Me.We.Pōneke is our signature quarterly event designed to inspire, connect and raise the voices of our wonderful community of Wellington women, and people who identify as women. 
We believe that magic happens when women come together. We’ve seen it. We’ve felt it. And we want to create more of it with regular events that are open, welcoming, supportive and empowering for the women of Wellington.
Come along, bring a friend and join us as we continue to raise the voices of Wellington women and invite you all to be part of Me We Pōneke.
You can join our mailing list from our brand new website, thanks to our amazing partner Springload. Check it out here and make sure you sign up to our mailing list: https://www.womenofponeke.org....
We are also on Insta! Follow us here: https://www.instagram.com/wome…

events.name: Strengths & Superpowers
events.venue: Level 22, NTT Tower 157 Lambton Quay Wellington, Wellington Region 6011
events.description:
Strengths & Superpowers
Personal branding isn’t showing off - it’s taking ownership over how you’re perceived. Join a Masterclass in making yours standout among the rest.
Welcome to the second conversation in our Women in Business series: four events that bring you important conversations led by Women in Business and heard by everyone. In partnership with Forsyth Barr, this bar-setting series is bringing hard-hitting topics into the conversational spotlight.
This conversation is led by two experts who are empowering other women, and will focus on an often-overlooked asset: personal branding. Whether your sights are set on a project or a promotion, this powerful tool can put you on the radar for the opportunities you want.
Why be part of this conversation?
When you control your narrative, you can ensure that it's accurate, compelling, and unique. Join our interactive session to uncover and learn how to convey the unique value you bring to the table. It isn't about crafting a fake persona, it's about making sure your superpowers get noticed.
You’ll get expert insights into:
Strengths: Understand and use your strengths for impact.
Superpower: Take control of what you want to be known for.
Story: Quick ways to naturally share your value.
Who’s the speaker?
Natalie Ferguson & Kristen Luman are the founders of Powrsuit - a career accelerator for every woman that takes professional development out of to-do lists and into weekly routines. With over 700 members across NZ, Australia, North America and Singapore, Powrsuit's research-backed approach delivers a tangible return on investment. After six months, 82% of members increase self-leadership skills, and 28% take a tangible step forward in their careers.
This interactive workshop is a must-attend for anyone who wants to maximise their visibility and value, regardless of job title.
**All attendees will go into the draw to win a annual Powrsuit membership**
What’s in-store:
5:15-5:30pm – Arrival/networking
5:30-6:15pm – Powrsuit mini-masterclass
6:15-6:30pm – Q&A
6:30-7:30pm – Networking with drinks & canapes
This event is part of the Women in Business chapter from our “Join the Conversation” series - 4 events that spotlight important topics through conversation, led by the amazing women driving change within them.
Attend other events in the series:
17 July: Making money in the mess - How every woman can financially thrive in messy economic times
20 August: 3 Gals, One Beehive – live! - Hear three leading women take a week in politics, and turn it into the unfiltered commentary that you wish you’d hear on the 6 o’clock news.
18 September: Impactful Leadership - What do horses, mules and the All Blacks have in common? Hear a true expert break-down what really works when it comes to impactful leadership.

events.id: Immersive Yoga: We Are Nature-175 Vivian Street #Level 1 Wellington, Wellington 6011-Event Brite
events.name: Immersive Yoga: We Are Nature
events.venue: 175 Vivian Street #Level 1 Wellington, Wellington 6011
events.description:
Immersive Yoga: We Are Nature
A one-of-a-kind yoga experience designed to awaken the senses, stir reflection, and bring you into deeper connection — followed by a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert.
Take this moment to become grounded in your true nature through embodied movement. This practice is your invitation to appreciate and develop a deeper connection with the Earth — to slow down, to notice the changing landscapes and seasons around you, and to find them within you. It’s a chance to remember that we are part of this world, shaped by the same rhythms, held by the same ground.
We speak of “getting into nature” as something we have to do — yet Earth-based traditions have always seen the plant and all beings as interconnected and sacred, humans as one with the Earth itself.
This is more than a yoga class — it’s an immersive experience designed to bring you back into that sense of belonging.
As you move through gentle hatha yoga, you’ll be surrounded by breathtaking visuals of our earthly home, designed and projected by Andy from Hype Entertainment. The space will come alive with images of nature from sunset to sunrise — each scene offering a distinct atmosphere to reflect and move with. A curated soundscape and subtle aromatherapy will support your journey, drawing you deeper into the moment.
Let us weave the scared back in, to weave nature back into the centre of our everyday lives. Let us find our way back through nature, to our true nature and selves.
Event followed by a plant-based dinner and dessert, all included in your ticket!
Meet Your Host: Nicola
With over 20 years of teaching experience and a deep connection to yoga philosophy, Nicola’s gentle guidance will lead you on a journey of self-discovery. Her classes are a blend of warmth and wisdom, helping you explore both your body and your spirit. As a teacher, she embraces the essence of yoga in every aspect of her life, creating a space where you can experience not only physical movement but a true connection to your inner self.

events.id: Traditional Chinese Medicine: How to Eat Wisely-175 Vivian Street #Level 1 Wellington, Wellington 6011-Event Brite
events.name: Traditional Chinese Medicine: How to Eat Wisely
events.venue: 175 Vivian Street #Level 1 Wellington, Wellington 6011
events.description:
Traditional Chinese Medicine: How to Eat Wisely
Discover the ancient wisdom of food, energy, and balance in this insightful session with Dr. Jinfeng — plus enjoy a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert, included with your ticket.
Many people believe they’re eating healthily, yet still experience fatigue, inflammation, and discomfort. Why is that?
From a Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM) perspective, health isn’t just about what you eat — it’s also about when you eat, the energetic nature of the food, and how well it suits your unique body type. In this workshop, you’ll explore food as medicine and gain insight into how to eat in a way that restores vitality, supports digestion, and balances your energy naturally.
What you’ll learn– The energetic qualities of different foods– How to identify which foods suit your constitution best– The ideal times to eat during the day and why timing matters– How TCM views food as fuel for both physical health and life force
Whether you're curious about Eastern approaches to wellness or looking for practical tools to support your health, this workshop will offer a fresh and meaningful perspective on your relationship with food.
Event followed by a plant-based dinner and dessert, all included in your ticket!
Meet Your Host: Jinfeng
As a scholarly well-being practitioner with a long history of family heritage (great grandfather and father), Dr. Jinfeng has been practicing Taoist Qigong and Buddhism Great Awakening Zen Meditation to sharpen her own sense and boost her own physical vitality.

events.id: 2025 Peter Turner Lecture in Photography - Anne Noble-55 Cable Street Wellington, Wellington Region 6011-Event Brite
events.name: 2025 Peter Turner Lecture in Photography - Anne Noble
events.venue: 55 Cable Street Wellington, Wellington Region 6011
events.description:
Photography – The Art of Paying Attention
In this lecture Anne Noble will discuss modes of collaborative practice across a series of projects that spans her work with bees as well as current projects concerning the environmental degradation of our waterways. In 2023 Anne Noble was commissioned by Ngāi Tahu to create an archive of images that would reveal the deteriorating state of freshwater across South Island waterways and the resulting impact on mahinga kai customs and practices. These photographs supported the Ngāi Tahu Statement of Claim heard recently in the High Court in Ōtautahi Christchurch, seeking recognition of Rangatiratanga (authority) over wai māori (fresh water) within Ngāi Tahu takiwā. An exhibition, drawing on the archive and created collaboratively is currently showing in Ōtepoti, at the Dunedin Public Art Gallery.
Free entry, however bookings are advised. Doors open at 6.15pm, Lecture at 6.30pm. Lecture will finish at 8pm, please join us for refreshments afterwards.
Anne Noble has been at the forefront of photographic practice in New Zealand since the early 1980s, creating bodies of work that mark sustained engagement with particular places, sites, histories, species and more recently the environmental degradation of land and water. Her images are known for their beauty, complexity and conceptual rigour and for their persistent inquiry into the ways photography impacts our perception, understanding and relationship to the natural world. Anne Noble is Professor Emerita of Fine Arts (Photography) at Massey University, Wellington and is the recipient of numerous awards including the 31st Higashikawa Photography Award (2015), an Arts Foundation Laureate Award (2009) and US National Science Foundation Artists and Writers Award (2008). She has exhibited widely both nationally and internationally and her work is held in collections throughout the world.
This year's lecture is one of a number of events celebrating the 50th anniversary of the Photography programme at Te Kunenga ki Pūrehuroa Massey University.
The Peter Turner Memorial Lecture was established in 2008, in the memory of the late Peter Turner historian, curator and former editor of Creative Camera magazine who came from the UK to live in NZ in 1981. His contributions to the medium of photography during his time in New Zealand spanned curatorial work, writing, reviewing and teaching. He is remembered for his passion for the medium, support of photographers and their work and his special love of practices he termed lyric, transcendent or poetic documentary photography. Founded on reflections on this legacy the annual Peter Turner Lecture is conceived as a means to broaden discussions about the social and cultural value of the medium of photography today – as an expanded field inclusive of a broad range of lens based media and approaches.
In association with the Peter Turner Lecture a fund has been established by the Massey University Foundation to support the Peter Turner Scholarship that was launched in association with the lecture and each year provides a postgraduate student scholarship for a student engaging with social and cultural issues through the medium of photography in its broadest sense.
The Peter Turner Fund has been established by the Massey University Foundation to grow the support this scholarship can offer young photographers aspiring for a career the lens based arts.

events.id: Nicholas Baucke-Maunsell Quintet-The Cavern Club, 22 Allen St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Nicholas Baucke-Maunsell Quintet
events.venue: The Cavern Club, 22 Allen St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
The Nicholas Baucke-Maunsell Quintet is thrilled to be performing at the WJC!

Led by saxophonist Nicholas Baucke-Maunsell, the group features Henry Sherris on trumpet —
reuniting after a five-year break during which Henry honed his craft in New York. The two first
played together as teenagers in the Young Musicians Program under the mentorship of the
legendary Rodger Fox, and now return to the stage for this special performance.

Joining them are Callum Allardice on guitar, Seth Boy on bass, and Abe Baillie on drums — an
exceptional rhythm section known for their deep musical connection and expressive interplay.

The quintet will perform a dynamic mix of original jazz compositions. Each piece reflects
moments from Nicholas’s recent journey — from touring internationally with the Rodger Fox Big
Band to day-to-day insights gained through his work as a teacher. The set will also feature
compositions by Henry, offering reflections on his time living and studying in New York.

This concert marks a meaningful farewell before Nicholas heads to Amsterdam to begin the
next chapter of his musical journey. Don’t miss the chance to experience this heartfelt
performance live.

events.id: The Girls Uninterrupted-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: The Girls Uninterrupted
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.description:
Meet the women behind The Girls Uninterrupted and Kiwi Yarns — bold, brilliant, and refreshingly real. Brodie, Gracie, and Caitlin each bring their own spark, sass, and storytelling to the mic, making a vibrant blend of laughs, heart, and unfiltered conversation. With backgrounds spanning journalism, broadcasting, and even nursing, these three besties are as relatable as they are remarkable — and they’re not afraid to say exactly what you’re thinking.

Brodie is 17-million-miles-an-hour, and if you were looking up “shy, introverted wallflower”, you would not find her anywhere near it. She is an award-winning journalist and podcaster who has had a successful, exciting career as a broadcaster in New Zealand for 18 years. She loves to run slightly uncomfortable long distances, has a real passion for gin and has been single for 923 years. She was once a champion surf lifesaver and spent a few years in the New Zealand Army. There’s never a dull moment with this independent media powerhouse.

Gracie is a wee pocket rocket originally hailing from the mighty Waikato. Currently living in Auckland, with her husband Ali and beautiful boys Frank and Otis, she has an extensive career in journalism and New Zealand media industries. She loves fitness, fashion, animals, and cooking. Once an accomplished equestrian who represented New Zealand overseas, Gracie is also extremely passionate about fashion and the arts and doesn’t need an excuse to get dolled up for any occasion. Her drink of choice? A dirty martini, extra olives.

Caitlin Marett is a small-town girl who, after ten years in radio, decided to leave her job as executive producer of ZM’s Fletch, Vaughan and Megan to pursue her dream of helping people by becoming a nurse. She’s obsessed with rosé, watching Friends on repeat and always finds herself in inexplicably weird situations. Caitlin would love a husband (she has a WONDERFUL boyfriend) and loves love so much that she became a marriage celebrant, which doesn’t help with her ability to cry at everything. She tries to live ethically and wants to be a vegan but can’t stop eating cheese. Just your average millennial who’s a basic bitch with a big heart.

events.id: Ringlets 'The Lord Is My German Shepherd (Time for Walkies)' Album Release Tour-Meow, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: Ringlets 'The Lord Is My German Shepherd (Time for Walkies)' Album Release Tour
events.venue: Meow, Wellington
events.description:
To celebrate the release of their sophomore album ‘The Lord Is My German Shepherd (Time for Walkies)’ released via Flying Nun & Leather Jacket Records on June 27th, Tāmaki Makaurau post-punks Ringlets are embarking on a nationwide tour of Aotearoa this August.

Emerging from Aotearoa’s musical ether in 2021; Ringlets have carved out space with their distinct blend of delicate wit, grit and evident sonic technicality. Since the release of their self-titled debut in 2023, the quartet have become a notorious live-act - supporting heavy-hitting internationals such as UK indie-rockers Sorry, seminal punk force The Damned, as well as stand-out festival performances at The Others Way, Newtown Festival & Junk Fest.

August 2025 marks the band’s first headline shows since 2023, with performances in Ōhinehou, Ōtepoti, Te Whanganui-a-Tara and Tāmaki Makaurau this August to celebrate the album.

The Lord Is My German Shepherd (Time for Walkies) is Ringlets’ shimmering follow-up to the 2023 debut and a vibrant expression of their singular song craft - the record conjures mystic visions; takes raucous, unkempt yet solely committed turns, twists, and tiptoes delicately between the absurd and the divine.

Friday 1 August - Wunderbar, Ōhinehou
Saturday 2 August - Secret Show, Ōtepoti
Friday 8 August - Meow, Te Whanganui a-Tara
Saturday 9 August - Whammy Bar, Tāmaki Makaurau

TICKETS ON SALE NOW FROM RINGLETS.CO.NZ

events.id: It's in the Ballot - WCC - Friday 8th August Production Day Pass -In-studio-11 Ganges Road Wellington, Wellington 6035-Event Brite
events.name: It's in the Ballot - WCC - Friday 8th August Production Day Pass -In-studio
events.venue: 11 Ganges Road Wellington, Wellington 6035
events.description:
Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative. We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.
This means you can send the weblink of the YouTube Video of your electorate show to your friends and whanau to encourage them to watch the show before they cast their votes.
Voting papers are sent to voters on Tuesday 9th September 2025 and must be delivered into a voting dropbox by 12pm Saturday 11th October 2025

events.name: The Bitter Brothers
events.venue: Vogelmorn Upstairs, Wellington
events.description:
The Bitter Brothers are coming home! After winding our way around the North Island in Holly Jean’s Estima, trailer in tow, from club to club in a jam-packed tour promoting our recent debut album, Daddy Was An Outlaw, we are very excited to bring it all back home and close off our tour full circle with a big party at the Voglemorn Upstairs! We have some old favorites, some new numbers lined up for you all, and some very special surprise quests who you won’t want to miss.

And if you haven’t heard about us by now, The Bitter Brothers are a five-piece, Wellington based, southern gothic, old-time, alt-folk, alt-country musical experience. They have banjos, accordions, violins, various guitars and voices, upright basses, drums, percussions, delightfully unexpected arrangements, tempos, and smile-inducing harmonies. The Bitter Brothers bring it all and invite you along for the ride!

events.id: Cringeworthy: The 90's-Circa Theatre, 1 Taranaki St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Cringeworthy: The 90's
events.venue: Circa Theatre, 1 Taranaki St, Wellington
events.description:
Cringeworthy – 90s!
A high-octane explosion of ‘90s nostalgia!

Written and devised by Andrea Sanders
Produced by Beatgirl Productions
Starring Andrea Sanders, Devon Neiman, Jared Pallesen and Emma Katene

Following the success of Cringeworthy ’60s, ’70s and ’80s, this show pays homage to NZ music and culture in the last decade of the 20th century. Expect a ‘rad’ mix of local and international hits delivered with snappy dance moves, scintillating vocals and a generous dollop of cheesy comedy.

The 90s was a decade bursting with diverse musical genres, from boy bands and girl groups to MMMBop and hip hop, the swing revival (Mambo No. 5), country (Achy Breaky Heart), The Macarena and re-releases of iconic hits such as To Sir With Love, Silly Love Songs, Unchained Melody and Get Down on It (can you dig it??).

On the local scene, legends such as Crowded House, Dave Dobbyn, The Exponents, Margaret Urlich, Supergroove, True Bliss, Ardijah, South Side of Bombay and The Chills gave us heavenly pop hits that have become Kiwi classics.

In some ‘fly’ outfits, Cringeworthy – the ’90s packages the hits of the decade (including Can’t Touch This, Weather With You, Love Shack and How Bizarre) with some unforgettable fashion trends including flannel shirts, baggy jeans, tracksuits and chokers. These energetic styles are woven together with a witty narrative reflecting the lifestyle, news events and culture of the time – smelling like Teen Spirit!

What’s the time Mr Wolf? Time to grab your ticket to ride this retro rollercoaster! Nostalgia invites you to relive a decade that still resonates today. Get ready to party like its 1999!

Reviews:
“A fantabulous blast from the past, high energy, fun and a belly full of laughs”
“A unique blend of uplifting vocals, brilliant choreography and personality personified!”

events.id: Padi Rescue Diver Course-New Zealand Sea Adventures, 9 Marina View, Porirua - Mana-Event Finder
events.name: Padi Rescue Diver Course
events.venue: New Zealand Sea Adventures, 9 Marina View, Porirua - Mana
events.description:
CHALLENGING And REWARDING - The BEST Dive Course You Will EVER Take…
These words probably best describe the PADI Rescue Diver course. Building upon what you’ve already learned during your diving to date, this course expands your knowledge and prepares you to deal with any problems you may encounter, on and under the water.

The Rescue Diver course is the perfect opportunity for you to develop your personal self-rescue dive skills, help tired divers, administer first aid and rescue distressed divers, under the guidance of your PADI Instructor.

During the online theory you’ll learn how to think like a rescue diver and preview skills you’ll practice with your PADI Instructor. After you have completed the Rescue Diver theory online, you come in and spend a weekend with us practicing the skills and concepts you learnt about, first in the pool then out in the ocean in progressively more challenging situations. We also take you through the Medic First Aid practical if you don’t already have a first aid and CPR certificate.

The Rescue Diver will start you looking differently at diving, being more aware of the divers around you as well your own safety and dive gear. It is a prerequisite for the Master Scuba Diver Rating (the most prestigious recreational rating) as well as the Divemaster program (the first step in the professional dive ratings). It is commonly viewed as the most important dive course people take.

PADI Rescue Diver Course Information:
Digital Theory – PADI Rescue Diver eLearning or tablet course (about 11 hours)
Full Weekend – Practical rescue skills and scenarios in the pool and open water

Prerequisites:
PADI Advanced Open Water Diver certification or Adventure Diver with Navigation (or qualifying certification from another agency)
12 Years of age or older

What To Bring:
Diver Medical | Participant Questionnaire (completed in the last 12 months). Other languages – click here
Your PADI Advanced Open Water Diver card or Adventure Diver with Navigation
Your eLearning completion form
First Aid & CPR certificate (can be taught in conjunction with the course)
Swimming costume and towel, plus your dive gear. Hire gear available as needed.

Costs:
Full Course Fee: $499 (book with a friend and get $20 off!)
Includes; PADI eLearning Course and Rescue Diver Quick Review & Practical Sections.
If you need a First Aid & CPR certificate, the Medic First Aid course, purchased with the Rescue Diver Course is only $150 (normally $185).

When:
Course times are 8.30am to approximately 4:30pm. Courses are normally once every 3 months through-out the year or by demand.
One-off mid-week courses by arrangement, conditions apply.

Learn how to create and use spreadsheets, as well as identify elements of a work book, enter and edit data, generate basic calculations and use built-in spreadsheet functions.

events.id: Acing The Interview-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Acing The Interview
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Acing The Interview
This course is free for NZ citizens and residents.  Please enrol online and bring photo ID when attending the workshop.
If you are not a NZ citizen or resident, a fee of $109 applies and you must phone the office on 04 385 8919 to register.
People have skills which they want to offer to employers, however, low confidence and anxiety combined with a lack of interview experience results in them not gaining employment.
'Acing The Interview' is a 3-module one day workshop that provides practical, cutting-edge tools and techniques to prepare participants to 'Ace the Interview'.
The 3 modules are:
1. Resourceful You - Think
2. Managing You - Feel
3. Acing the Interview - Do
Explore how to manage your thoughts under pressure and control your critical voice. Understand how to manage anxiety and stress. Demonstrate your interview skills and use body language and well-formed responses to create a powerful and positive first impression.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to:
-  Manage your thoughts and critical voice under pressure
-  Visualise and mentally rehearse for success
-  Recognise your emotional reactions and manage your emotions under pressure
-  Utilise techniques to manage anxiety
-  Demonstrate interview skills and deliver well-formed responses to questions
-  Understand the STAR model and other communication techniques and how and when to use them
Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

events.id: Jewellery Making – Silver Spell Rings-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Jewellery Making – Silver Spell Rings
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Jewellery Making - Silver Spell Rings
You’ll be able to make your own personal set of “spell-out” rings to show your unique personal brand to the world! Whether you want to spell a word, have an acronym or show some other aspect of your personality – these rings are a stylish way to do so. You’ll develop essential silversmithing skills such as soldering, shaping and polishing, and learn top tips for creating stunning jewellery on a budget.
Ideal for beginners, and a great gift idea for birthdays, graduations or anniversaries!
 There are many possibilities of what you can create, and here are just a few ideas: 
·         Begin your own family tradition of signet ring sets. 
·         Bring your best friends and make matching ‘B,Fs,4,ever’ ring sets.
·         Use our zodiac sign symbol punches to mark your Sun, Moon and Rising horoscope signs.
·         Use it for an acronym you choose – anything from YOLO to ADHD
Please bring pen and paper and your reading glasses (if you use these) and wear clothing and footwear suitable for a workshop environment. 
All materials provided, no hidden costs!
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to:
Design and create a set of up to 4 basic silver rings using fine jewellery making techniques
Use a jeweller's saw to cut sheet silver into simple shapes.
Use hammers and steel punches to imprint letters, symbols and textures into sheet silver
Use jeweller's files and sandpapers to refine silver forms
Use jewellery pliers to bend silver into ring forms
Use a jeweller's soldering torch to solder join your rings together 
Use polishing tools to shine and finish your silver jewellery creations 
Please wear closed-in footwear suitable for a workshop environment. bring a work apron if you have one or wear clothes you don’t mind getting a little grubby.  Remember to bring your reading glasses if a have them.

events.id: Do It Yourself Framing-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Do It Yourself Framing
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.description:
Bring along a painting and a suitable frame, either a cheapo from Briscoes or a good second hand frame. We will provide the tools and matt board.
It’s a practical course where you will learn to prepare the frame, cut with a knife, measure and cut a matt with the matt cutter.
You will walk away with your painting framed, ready to hang and some useful knowledge about framing ready for sale, exhibition standards, D rings, swing tags, acid free archival materials, tape, and how to hang a painting on the wall.

What’s included in this workshop:
- Demonstration of the steps to framing your work
- assembling the tools you need
- choosing and cleaning frames
- how to size and cut an acid free mat
- what sort of tapes to use for each task
- various fixings for hanging and D-rings
- replacing acid leaching materials with foam board
- cutting techniques
- making and attaching labels and swing tags
- how to photograph your art

Hands-on session where you will learn to cut card, cut a window in the matt board, present, secure, tape, screw in D-ring, tie knots etc

All materials will be provided including knives, metal ruler, cutting board, crescent board for the mat, mat cutter, tape, d-ring, string.

What to bring along:
- your artwork to frame
- a suitable frame for the artwork A4 or smaller
- enthusiasm!

Thirty-minute lunch - bring a packed lunch to have in our historic home or explore the local cafes in Te Aro.

events.id: Natural Texture Earrings and Pendants-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Natural Texture Earrings and Pendants
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.description:
A quick taster class that’s ideal as a weekend outing for friends, or as a treat for you! In three short hours, learn to craft an amazing pair of textured metal earrings - from scratch!

Over this taster class, you’ll be guided through the process of heating and texturing metal, cutting and shaping with traditional jewellery tools. After completing this class, you will have one pair of beautiful earrings to wear away or gift to someone special!

You will practice on smaller texture samples to work out what texture and what metal you want to go with, and then move on to creating your earrings in warm copper, yellow brass and sterling silver - with solid sterling silver earring hooks or posts.

Your class materials pack includes everything you need for the class to make a super cool pair of beautiful earrings. You are welcome to purchase extra materials for larger pieces at the studio.

We use quality pre-made sterling silver earring wires, or earring posts with silicone stud backs for these taster classes so that you can focus on making the main part of the earrings and know that your findings will be just perfect.

Kids aged 12 (or so) are welcome to attend the class, but an enrolled parent or caregiver must accompany anyone under the age of 16.

events.id: Sculpt the City: Explore Risk and Resilience in clay-115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Sculpt the City: Explore Risk and Resilience in clay
events.venue: 115 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Get hands-on with air-dry clay as we reimagine Wellington’s CBD at scale. In this collaborative workshop, we’ll explore how we think about natural hazard risk and resilience—through shape, texture, and place.
By treating the city as a model we can mold, you’ll gain new insights into scale, design, and the ways we interpret our shared environment. No experience is needed—just bring your curiosity, your observational eye, and a willingness to work with others.
The clay city model of the Wellington CBD you help create will be a central reference point throughout the Critical Signals series.
We suggest making a koha of around $5 to cover materials used in this event. 
About the host
Mairéad de Róiste is an Associate Professor at Te Herenga Waka Victoria University of Wellington, specialising in geospatial science. Her work uses maps, spatial data, and hands-on crafting methods to help people understand places, make decisions, and communicate complex ideas clearly. She is passionate about creative, accessible approaches to sharing and understanding geographic information. She also shares her work and that of her collaborators and students in the SpatialThink Lab on Instagram.
SpatialThink Lab: https://www.instagram.com/spatialthinklab/

events.id: Empower & Protect: A One-Day Self-Defense Course-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Empower & Protect: A One-Day Self-Defense Course
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Empower & Protect: A One-Day Self-Defense Course
This course is free for NZ citizens and residents (aged 16 years+).  Please enrol online and bring photo ID when attending the workshop.
If you are not a NZ citizen or resident, a fee of $199 applies and you must phone the office on 04 385 8919 to register.
This dynamic, hands-on course will teach you practical self-defense techniques to increase confidence, awareness, and personal safety. Under the guidance of Wellington’s top self-defense expert, you’ll learn:
Situational Awareness – Spot danger before it happens and make smart safety decisions.
De-escalation Tactics – Learn how to defuse conflicts and avoid physical confrontations.
Effective Self-Defense Moves – Master simple but powerful techniques to escape grabs, strikes, and holds.
Using Your Voice & Body Language – Understand how assertiveness and posture can deter threats.
Defending Against Common Threats – Learn what to do in real-life scenarios like public spaces, car parks, or at home.
This course is engaging, empowering, and packed with practical skills you can use immediately. Come ready to learn, move, and gain confidence in your ability to protect yourself and those around you.
Wear loose clothing and footwear so you can move about (such as active wear and runners) and that you are happy to sit on the floor in.  Also bring water and some snacks for the breaks.
[This is a physical activity that involves an element of risk. While all possible measures are taken to prevent accidents or injury, please note that participation is at your own risk].
You must be a NZ citizen or resident aged 16 or older, to register in this course for free and you must provide photo ID when you attend. 
Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

events.venue: 19 Makora Road, Otaihanga 5036, New Zealand
events.description:
Award-winning authors Jenny Pattrick and Mandy Hager explore the craft and challenges of writing stories set in the past—both the recent and more distant.

Whether delving into historical fiction or confronting contemporary histories, these accomplished writers discuss how they bring the past to life on the page.

Join chair Philippa Werry for an engaging conversation about research, inspiration, and the power of storytelling to illuminate the lives and events that shape us.

events.id: Colourful Torch-Fired Enamels - Taster-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Colourful Torch-Fired Enamels - Taster
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.description:
This exciting 3-hour class uses the Enamel technique to focus on beautiful enamels on copper and silver. It is a wonderful way to add colour to your work!

Create a simple yet beautifully textured pendant or earrings in metal, and learn how to add a pop of colour to your piece!

Beginners to metalwork can use pre-formed shapes, so they can focus on creating bright funky patterns. Those with some metalwork experience can take on a more advanced textured piece.

Kids aged 12 (or so) are welcome to attend the class, but an enrolled parent or caregiver must accompany any person under the age of 16.

events.id: Echoes of a Decade - 10th Anniversary Fundraising Concert-53 Hobson Street Wellington, Wellington Region 6011-Event Brite
events.name: Echoes of a Decade - 10th Anniversary Fundraising Concert
events.venue: 53 Hobson Street Wellington, Wellington Region 6011
events.description:
🎶 Relaxed Fundraising Concert Overview
SoundsWell Singers is a unique and inspiring neurological choir made up of people living with conditions such as Parkinson’s Disease, Huntington’s Disease, Aphasia (post-stroke), and early Dementia. Co-led by two NZ Registered Music Therapists with support from a Speech Language Therapist, the choir has a dual therapeutic focus—promoting both physical and emotional well-being through the joy of singing.
The group meets weekly in a warm, supportive, and social environment. No prior choir or singing experience is needed, and support people are always welcome.
At this special 10th anniversary concert, the choir will perform a mix of well-known songs, and many with their own unique spin.
Come along, show your support, and feel the transformative power of music and community.
🌟 Special Guest: Sophia Gittings
An exciting rising star in the opera world, Sophia is soon heading overseas to further her career. Don't miss this chance to hear her live!
🎟️ Raffle & Silent Auction
Take part in our fundraising raffle and silent auction. Every dollar raised goes directly toward supporting this life-changing choir.
♿ Accessibility
Our concert venue is fully accessible. If you require accessible parking or have any specific needs, please don’t hesitate to contact us; we’ll do our best to accommodate you.
💬 Voices Beyond the Music
Throughout the concert, choir members will share personal stories about their journeys with neurological conditions and how singing has impacted their lives. These heartfelt moments bring deeper meaning to the music and highlight the strength of this incredible community.
❤️ Why It Matters
For many members, it’s a rare opportunity to connect, express themselves, and find joy despite the daily challenges of Aphasia, Parkinson’s, Dementia, and other neurological conditions. Your support helps keep this essential programme running and growing.
🎤 Empower Voices, Change Lives
Join us for an unforgettable evening of song, courage, and community. Bring a friend, bid in the silent auction, grab a raffle ticket, and help us raise funds to ensure this choir continues to change lives—one voice at a time.

events.id: It's in the Ballot - Manawatu DC -Feilding General Ward-In-studio-84 Aorangi Street Feilding, Manawatū-Whanganui Region 4702-Event Brite
events.name: It's in the Ballot - Manawatu DC -Feilding General Ward-In-studio
events.venue: 84 Aorangi Street Feilding, Manawatū-Whanganui Region 4702
events.description:
Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative. We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.
This means you can send the weblink of the YouTube Video of your electorate show to your friends and whanau to encourage them to watch the show before they cast their votes.
Voting papers are sent to voters on Tuesday 9th September 2025 and must be delivered into a voting dropbox by 12pm Saturday 11th October 2025

events.id: Kāpiti Chorale presents: Wellington Composers-St Paul's Church, 1 Langdale Ave, Paraparaumu-Event Finder
events.name: Kāpiti Chorale presents: Wellington Composers
events.venue: St Paul's Church, 1 Langdale Ave, Paraparaumu
events.description:
This concert features music from right here in our region, and we believe these works could stand on any stage. We’re performing pieces by composers, arrangers, and lyricists from the wider Wellington area whose work deserves to be heard more often.

We begin with tributes to two influential figures we’ve lost: Jenny McLeod and lyricist Shirley Murray. Then we move into works by people we’ve sung with, worked with, and deeply admire. Rosemary Russell contributes three pieces. Jonathan Berkahn, who played organ at our last concert, has two featured works: a Nunc Dimittis and Magnificat.

Cadence Chung, recipient of our 2023 Kāpiti Chorale Performance Award, returns to sing with us, this time performing her own composition for voice, flute, and piano, as well as joining the choir for other pieces. We're glad to have her back.

Our director Eric Sidoti brings a new arrangement of a song by Six60, adding a fresh and familiar note to the evening.

We’ll close with Mass in E Minor by Thomas Nikora, another musician we’ve had the pleasure of working with. Thomas sang in the choir at a previous concert and has accompanied some of our rehearsals, and now we’re performing his Mass with the largest choir to present it to date. It’s a bold, expressive work that shows the depth and versatility of a composer equally at home performing, conducting, and writing music. We’re proud to be singing it.

Join us on Saturday 9 August at 4 PM at St Paul’s Church, Paraparaumu.
This concert starts one hour later than usual. Bring a friend, enjoy a winter afternoon of music, and help us fill the church. These are works we believe in, and we can’t wait to share them with you.

Music Director: Eric Sidoti
Assistant Music Director: Ann-Marie Stapp
Soprano Solo: Cadence Chung
Flute: Malu Jonas
Piano: Phillip O’Malley

Date: Saturday 9 August 2025
Time: 4:00 PM
Venue: St Paul’s Church, Kapiti Road, Paraparaumu

Printed tickets will soon be available from Moby Dickens’ (Paraparaumu Beach), Jenoa (Waikanae), and Books & Co (Ōtaki), or by emailing tickets@kapitichorale.org.nz or calling (021) 261 2749.

events.id: Niko Ne Zna Live at Vogelmorn Hall (Wellington)-13 Vennell Street, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Niko Ne Zna Live at Vogelmorn Hall (Wellington)
events.venue: 13 Vennell Street, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.description:
Wellington, get ready! It’s been a minute!
Fresh off a sold-out show in Auckland, Niko Ne Zna returns to the capital for a night of explosive Balkan brass at Vogelmorn Hall.
Expect bold brass, infectious rhythms, soaring vocals, and a dancefloor that won’t quit. This nine-piece powerhouse delivers their signature high-energy performance — featuring brand new songs in preparation for their upcoming third studio album, as well as all the hits you know and love.
Live Balkan brass music
Delicious food available
Cash bar featuring local beers from Kererū Brewing, as well as wine and spirits from the Balkans
A party like no other
With trumpets, saxophone, trombones, sousaphone, tapan (bass drum), snare drum, percussion, and vocals in multiple languages, Niko Ne Zna blends hypnotic melodies, driving rhythms, and theatrical flair into an unforgettable live experience. Whether on the street, in a club, or on a festival stage, their shows are part gig, part spectacle — all heart.
They’ve wowed crowds at WOMAD, featured in What We Do In The Shadows, and played to packed houses across New Zealand and Australia.
Come early, grab a bite, enjoy a Kererū brew, and be part of something special.
Doors at 6pm.
“It’s like being dropped into the hot and spicy lands of a faraway country.” — wellingtonlivemusic.com
“Straight to the dancefloor.” — Elsewhere
“Driving rhythms, an intoxicating effect.” — Taranaki Daily News
www.nikonezna.com

events.id: Homegrown Road Trip Tour 2025 | Wellington-69 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Homegrown Road Trip Tour 2025 | Wellington
events.venue: 69 Courtenay Place, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Some of today’s most exciting homegrown talents are heading on tour – Hori Shaw and Shane Walker, with support from Te Wehi, are heading to 10 Kiwi towns and cities this winter. 
The tour, the Homegrown Road Trip, will head to Gisborne, Whakatane, Tauranga, Kaitaia, Hamilton, Rotorua, Napier, Palmerston, New Plymouth and Wellington over four weekends in June, July and August. 
Hori Shaw, Shane Walker and Te Wehi are arguably three of the most popular Kiwi artists in music right now, with all three taking the top three spots on the Official Top 20 Aotearoa Singles Chart. Te Wehi’s cover of Allen Stone’s Unaware; Hori Shaw’s Back in My Arms; and Shane Walker’s Coasty Girl has charted at 1, 2 and 3.
Now, all three are joining forces for the Homegrown Road Trip. Tickets go on sale at 6pm on Thursday, May 8 and are expected to sell out. AfterPay and Zip Pay are both available!
Homegrown Road Trip is Hori Shaw’s first headline tour in NZ, and with hearty supporters all around Aotearoa, these shows are all highly anticipated. 
Hori Shaw has been a major part of New Zealand’s music scene since he released Country Roads in 2023 and his success has continued with further hits Back in My Arms; Shawfyah; and One Day, all released last year. Back in My Arms is arguably his biggest release so far, securing a spot on NZ’s Official Top 40 Singles chart, and a number one spot on the Official Top 20 Aotearoa Singles chart.  
Shane Walker and Te Wehi are also making their mark, also securing spots on NZ’s Official Top 40 Singles chart – Shane Walker with Coasty Girl and Te Wehi with Unaware. These releases have also reached the number one spot on the Official Top 20 Aotearoa Singles chart.  
Since releasing FX*K You Too, Shane Walker has been cementing his place as a powerhouse in today’s music. Coasty Girl has dominated airwaves and his subsequent single Waimā Girl is also making its way up the charts right now.
Te Wehi’s cover of Unaware has been hugely popular and on April 4 it reached number one on the Official Top 20 Aotearoa Singles chart, where it remained for the rest of the month.  
Homegrown Road Trip is a highly anticipated tour – so get in quick to secure tickets. Tickets won’t last long.
Tour dates:
Thursday, June 26: Gisborne – Sugar Bar.
Friday, June 27: Whakatāne – Boiler Room.
Saturday, June 28: Tauranga – Rusty’s.
Thursday, July 3: Kaitaia – Awanui Hotel.
Friday, July 4: Auckland – Darby St Station.
Saturday, July 5: Hamilton – The Factory.
Thursday, July 31: Rotorua – Social Club.
Friday, August 1: Napier – Cabana Bar.
Saturday, August 2: Palmerston North – Royal Hotel.
Friday, August 8: New Plymouth – Crowded House
Saturday, August 9: Wellington – The Grand

events.id: The Carol Bean Band-Hilltop, 17 Upland Road, Kelburn, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The Carol Bean Band
events.venue: Hilltop, 17 Upland Road, Kelburn, Wellington
events.description:
Gate opens 6.30pm Music Starts 7pm Saturday 9 August 2025
The Carol Bean Band play a mix of jazzy blues with a heavy helping of original songs and stylish instrumentation.  Carol Bean – vocals and guitar, Costa Botes – guitar(s), George Packard – upright bass, and Andrew Grayson – drums. 
English-born, California-raised, Carol was influenced by the West Coast music of the 60s and the blues of Mississippi John Hurt, Mance Lipscomb, Lightnin’ Hopkins, and Doc Watson. At LA’s Ash Grove and McCabe’s Music Store she was taught her picking style from a young Ry Cooder who encouraged her to buy the Martin guitar she still plays today. Carol has fronted several bands in New Zealand and recorded 3 studio albums, all on Spotify. She continues to perform at the Wellington Roomfulla Blues Club and with the Kelburn Viaduct Municipal Ensemble Jug Band.
"Carol’s singing is versatile, vibrant, and delivers an earthy quality to her songs." Tom Villano, LA
"… when the mood drops she reveals a more intimate, reflective side…." Graham Reid
"The first three songs of Next Bus Out perfectly set the album up for the interesting  journey that is to come." Nick Bollinger.
Costa is a veteran independent filmmaker with several award winning short films and feature length documentaries to his credit, including the notorious ‘mock doc’ Forgotten Silver, which he made with Peter Jackson. For the last two decades he has created a run of films celebrating individuals who are quirky, creative, passionate, and above all, persistent (Struggle No More, The Last Dogs of Winter, Act of Kindness, Angie, When The Cows Come Home).  These films have included studies of musicians (Paddy Burgin's Wooden Box Band, Nigel Gavin’s Circus, and The Shot Band/ Hobnails @ The Paramount Theatre) because Costa has been a persistent closet musician himself. He has had stints with Chris and Eva Prowse, and Carol Bean's Mount Misery String Band. When he was younger, Costa wanted to move his fingers really fast. Now he just tries to put them in the right place, song by song, and man - does he ever. “Tasty”, “Amazing”, “Great playing”.
See Costa Botes | NZ On Screen & Costa Botes Lone Pine Films (vimeo.com)
George is a professional musician and tutor on Whitireia Polytechnic’s Music Programme, trained classically on the cello. George’s first improvisational experiences were playing ukulele along with the Rolling Stones, John Mayall and The Band (in his bedroom).  With little market for improvisational ukulele he took up the double bass.
George enjoys playing in bands that push the envelope and give expression to the human soul. He has played extensively in many Wellington groups (including currently with the Rag Poets band), appearing a number of times for the Wellington International Festival of the Arts, undertaking national tours for Chamber Music New Zealand, and backing overseas artists in New Zealand. His playing ranges from classical to jazz, to Latin, to ethnic fusion to Americana and country. He believes - at a fundamental level - that music is about human beings making sense of the world and themselves, and about helping heal the world.
Andrew is also the drummer for the band Ghostplane (Beneath the Sleepy Lagoon; Panther Valley Country Club (Arch Hill Records), which includes Phoenix Foundation members). Not only has he joined our team, but his passion is surfing - so let's say he's the youngest and the fittest.
Not for profit, supporting our dedicated musicians. Suggested donation $30
Come along and enjoy this gig in our special space, up close and personal.
Teas, Coffee and Snacks provided. You're welcome to bring anything you'd like to eat or drink.
Parking available in the Coupon zones of Upland Rd & Glasgow St free after 6pm weekdays, and free all through the weekends. The Wilson Carpark at the top of the Cable Car charges 24/7.

Cable Management brings you Unfolding, our debut gig where we couldn’t be more happy to share the sounds that move us—techno for your mind and body. Expect evolving BPMs, genre hybrids, and a night that explores deep into the dark, hypnotic and underground.

It all started because we wanted to hear Eli Høff live—one of Aotearoa’s most exciting producers of deep, intricate and compelling techno, built for altered states. Plus ikona happens to be dropping his latest EP soon and it all just came together.

We’re all about crisp, full-bodied sound, so we’ve teamed up with the legendary Tub’s Audio to deliver, backed by crystalline visuals from Vision Chips and Catalyst.
$12 presale via undertheradar / $20 on the door

Moon, Newtown
Sat 9th August
9 PM – 2 AM

Lineup:
nani
jandalz
inner pulse
eli hoff (live)
ikona (live)

And no—we’re not actually great at cable management. Maybe the next one will be called Untangling..

events.name: The Pines Market
events.venue: The Pines, 50 The Esplanade, Houghton Bay, Wellington
events.description:
Wellington’s must-attend winter event is back — The Pines Market returns to Houghton Bay!

This Winter, join us at the stunning Pines venue, perched above the coastline, for a market experience like no other. Soak in breathtaking ocean views, enjoy a warm and welcoming vibe, and explore an eclectic mix of local art, handcrafted goods, lush plants, and one-of-a-kind treasures — all lovingly created by Wellington’s most talented makers and artists.

Whether you're hunting for a unique gift, wanting to treat yourself, or just looking for a great day out, The Pines Market is your winter wonderland of creativity and community spirit.

Expect:
* Handcrafted jewellery
* Unique art & design pieces
* Beautiful plants & seedlings
* Thoughtfully made crafts & homeware
* Plenty of surprises around every corner!

Most stalls accept EFTPOS, but bringing some cash is a good idea too!

This isn't just a market — it’s a destination. Come for the shopping, stay for the atmosphere, and leave inspired.

Don’t miss The Pines Market — the ultimate winter gathering for lovers of all things local, creative, and beautiful. We’ll see you there!

events.id: The Voice That Mobilises Readers - Creative Writing Workshop-Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: The Voice That Mobilises Readers - Creative Writing Workshop
events.venue: Inverlochy Art School, 3 Inverlochy Place, Wellington
events.description:
A story runs through it -What is the voice that mobilises readers?

Research explains why certain forms of storytelling are especially effective at leaving readers with the desire to act on ideas. If you want readers to walk with you into issues that are important to you, this is your chance to find out how.

Marilyn will share some evidence regarding effective voice and content, along with suggestions to apply the research. You’ll read a few samples and have time to jot down and discuss your own starting points. Finally, there will be time to talk through some strategies to help you prepare for the facts of issue-based speech in this time.

This information applies to memoir, fictional stories, and many other forms of communication that aim to galvanise an audience. The principles are beneficial regardless of your experience, because all communication is based on finding a voice.

events.id: Twisted Rings for Winter-Workspace Ōtaki, 6 Hewson Crescent, Ōtaki-Event Finder
events.name: Twisted Rings for Winter
events.venue: Workspace Ōtaki, 6 Hewson Crescent, Ōtaki
events.description:
Craft an elegant twisted silver ring from solid silver!

Learn to soften and twist wire to create the twist you want, then how to form it up into a ring that fits you. Learn to use the jeweller's torch to solder then clean up and polish the ring to a beautiful finish.

This 3-hour class is ideal for beginners, groups of friends and visitors to the city.

An excellent, fun class if you have already taken one of our Stacking Rings or Textured Earrings classes and fancy adding to your jewellery collection.

Included in the class fee are copper and brass for practising on, sterling silver bar to create your twist ring and all consumables such as sandpaper, solder and chemicals. Extra metals are available for purchase in the studio.

Kids aged 12 (or so) are welcome to attend the class, but any person under the age of 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.

events.id: Winter Natural Textured Rings - August-Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Winter Natural Textured Rings - August
events.venue: Workspace Studios Ltd, 65 Abel Smith St, Wellington
events.description:
Make your own personalised ring - a gift for yourself or someone special! :-)

Learn the basic technique first in copper or brass, and then craft your final piece in silver!

Over this taster class, you’ll be guided through the process of heating and texturing metal, cutting and shaping with traditional jewellery tools. Use feathers, leaves, or fabrics to create a unique texture for a beautiful ring!

Learn to measure your finger, cut metal to length and texture it without rolling mill, hammers and punches. Then use a jewellers torch, sandpaper and polishing, and your beautiful new ring will be ready to wear.

This 3-hour class is ideal for beginners, groups of friends and visitors to the city.

Included in the class fee are copper and brass for practising on, a sterling silver ring strip and all consumables such as sandpaper, solder and chemicals. Extra metals are available for purchase in the studio.

Kids aged 12 (or so) are welcome to attend the class, but any person under the age of 16 must be accompanied by adults.

events.venue: 19 Makora Road, Otaihanga 5036, New Zealand
events.description:
Everyone has a story worth telling — including you. In this interactive workshop, you'll explore simple, engaging ways to begin writing your life story.
Whether you're looking to record memories for your family, reflect on your journey, or eventually publish a memoir, Gigi Fenster will help you take the first step. No writing experience required — just bring your memories and a willingness to explore.

Limited places – secure your spot now!

events.name: Being in Print: Publishing Perspectives
events.venue: 289 Mazengarb Road, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand
events.description:
A panel discussing indie, professional and self publishing. Traditionally published YA fantasy author Katharine J. Adams, self-published romance writer Leanna Morgan and indie-author Anne Ingram chat about their experiences in the publishing industry.

Learn why they chose to pursue their specific publishing pathway and the pros and cons of each.

Participants will gain insight to the different modes of the publishing industry – traditional, independent, self-publishing – and have the opportunity to ask questions.

Our thanks to NZSA Wellington Branch for sponsoring this event.

Limited tickets - book now to secure your seat!

events.name: Queer Rangatahi Ruri Rongoā
events.venue: Weka Road, Raumati Beach 5032, New Zealand
events.description:
Ruri' is one word for a 'short love ditty, poem or jingle'. Rongoā is most often understood as being healing or medicinal. Ruri Rongoā is about being together, about connection with each other and in this case, having some fun with language itself.

At this session we'll spend time reading poems by awesome queer rangatahi, then we will write a couple ourselves -- one on our own, and one together as a group.
Suitable for ages 15-20.

Limited places - get your ticket now!

events.id: It's in the Ballot - Horizons RC–Raki Māori Constituency-In-studio-84 Aorangi Street Feilding, Manawatū-Whanganui Region 4702-Event Brite
events.name: It's in the Ballot - Horizons RC–Raki Māori Constituency-In-studio
events.venue: 84 Aorangi Street Feilding, Manawatū-Whanganui Region 4702
events.description:
Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative. We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.
This means you can send the weblink of the YouTube Video of your electorate show to your friends and whanau to encourage them to watch the show before they cast their votes.
Voting papers are sent to voters on Tuesday 9th September 2025 and must be delivered into a voting dropbox by 12pm Saturday 11th October 2025

events.id: Bailamos Bachata! Latin Dance Party-Southern Cross Garden Bar Restaurant, 39 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington-Event Finder
events.name: Bailamos Bachata! Latin Dance Party
events.venue: Southern Cross Garden Bar Restaurant, 39 Abel Smith St, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
(Please note: the event is free but it can only continue if we support the Southern Cross by buying food or drinks)

Wellington’s favourite monthly Bachata Latin dance party!

Join us for an awesome mix of bachata, focusing on the best sensual tracks and remixes, along with salsa and a smattering of kizomba and zouk. We welcome everyone, from the absolute beginner to the most experienced dancer. We’re all about the joy of social dancing together.

And what makes a free party with great people even better? A free beginners’ bachata lesson with some of Wellington‘s best Latin dance teachers. If you’ve never danced bachata, Latin dance or even any other dance style before then this is the perfect lesson for you. We will have you dancing like a pro in no time!

Bailamos Bachata is hosted free of charge by the Southern Cross. They love the atmosphere we bring but we also need to support them in return. We’re asking everyone attending to purchase soft drinks, food or alcohol from the bar. It’s vital we show our gratitude.

1800-1830 social
1830-1900 free lesson
1900-2100 social

What is bachata?
- Bachata is a popular and fun Latin couples dance. It started in the Dominican Republic, then travelled to Europe and the rest of the world. It now includes a wide range of music styles and dance influences and is still changing and evolving.

I haven’t danced before, is that a problem?
- Not at all! That’s exactly what the lesson is for – everyone has to start somewhere and we’re a very welcoming crowd for beginners.

Is bachata a difficult dance to learn?
- Its origins as a party/community dance mean the basics can be learnt quite quickly, so you’ll be enjoying yourself in no time.

Who are the capital bachata collective?
- We are the combined Wellington dance schools and people teaching bachata and we really want to share this dance with everyone. We love bachata, we love our community and we want to share it with you
