events.name: Shaun Kirk - New Zealand Tour 2025
events.venue: The Petone Depot, Lower Hutt, Wellington
events.description:
Hailing from the music-filled streets of Melbourne, Australia, Shaun Kirk is an award-winning blues and soul troubadour recognized for his exceptional talent as a born entertainer. His unique talent has not only earned him many accolades but also much praise from fellow artists, such as three-time Grammy Award Winner Fantastic Negrito, who has declared his show as One of the best one-man shows he’s ever seen!

Kirk's vocals exude a gritty, soulful depth that seems to transcend far beyond his years, with critics continually acclaiming him as one of the finest blues voices Australia has ever heard (Buzz Mag). Complementing his vocal artistry, Kirk's vintage guitar tones and raw grooves pay tribute to the timeless influences that have shaped his musical journey, resulting in a distinctive sound fast becoming his own.

Shaun’s musical journey has taken him to stages all over the world, where he's not only performed but consistently sold out shows, leaving audiences enthralled by his magnetic presence. From iconic festival stages like Bluesfest Byron Bay, where he's become a familiar name, to sharing the billing with legends like Robert Plant of Led Zeppelin, John Mayer, Paolo Nutini, John Butler Trio, and The Teskey Brothers; Kirk's artistic prowess is in esteemed company. Moreover, he's also had the honour of opening for household names such as blues maestro Joe Bonamassa, soul sensation Allen Stone, and the indomitable Beth Hart; further solidifying his place in the landscape of contemporary music. This remarkable journey is a testament to Kirk's unmatched talent and ability to connect with audiences across genres and generations.

WHAT THE PRESS ARE SAYING ABOUT SHAUN KIRK...

“It’s rare to see someone bring down the house as an opener, but Australia’s Shaun Kirk did exactly that. He connected with the crowd immediately”
– Soundcheck Entertainment, Canada

“One of the most explosive acts Australia has to offer”
– Mixdown Magazine

“Simply astounding. Definitely a must for any blues lover.”
Tsunami/Forte Magazine

My faith in this generation’s music has been restored.
- Dearhead Press

events.id: Kevin Bloody Wilson — Aussie Icon Tour-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Kevin Bloody Wilson — Aussie Icon Tour
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
The bawdy comedy of Australian Kevin Bloody Wilson has been delighting and shocking audiences since the 70s. Now the outrageously funny (and outrageous) comedian is back. Kevin Bloody Wilson — Aussie Icon Tour is set to roll into The Opera House in September. He’ll perform a selection of his funniest songs, and irreverent stories — all infused with his wickedly rude sense of humour. 
Kevin’s journey to politically incorrect stardom started in 1977. He began by changing the words to other people’s songs, eventually writing some songs himself. At the time people were still being arrested for using some four-letter words in public. Audiences initially ostracised him for his rude and crude performances. Now, over 45 years later, the reverse applies. He has 350 million TikTok views, 4 million album sales, and 6 million tickets sold around the world. The 78-year-old shows no signs of slowing down. “There is just too much political correctness to incorrect!” he says.

events.id: ECD Emotional Change Strategy Practitioner Course - Central Wellington - 11th September-Level, 11/15 Willeston Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: ECD Emotional Change Strategy Practitioner Course - Central Wellington - 11th September
events.venue: Level, 11/15 Willeston Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
ECD Emotional Strategy Development 1 Day Certification Course

Become a Certified Emotional Culture Deck Change Practitioner
Apply The ECD to manage change effectively by harnessing the collective emotions of your people and teams.
This course is essential for change leaders and managers looking to focus on navigating the emotional side of change within their organisations. The Emotional Change Strategy Course equips participants with the tools and knowledge to better lead and land change with empathy, compassion, and emotional intelligence. The course is designed to be highly interactive and hands-on, allowing leaders to practice and apply what they learn in a tactile learning environment.
This hands-on 1 day workshop is designed for immediate application, ensuring that you can translate insights into action as soon as you return to your team or clients. 
What to expect
Active learning through interactive activities and group discussions.
Learning how to use and embed our ready-made Emotional Culture Deck Change Tools
Exploration of personal and team responses to change.
Development of effective, co-creative change strategies.
Understanding the power of rituals in managing change.
“Change is emotional. It is the heart, not the mind, that accepts change. Emotions matter more than models of change; we must seek to understand the emotions of the people within those models..Today is all about play and learning by doing! So before I tell you more, let’s play.” - Jeremy Dean (founder Riders & Elephants and creator of the ECD)

What's included in this course?
Enrol in the ECD Emotional Change Strategy Course and unlock a wealth of resources:
ECD Emotional Change Toolkit - Valued at $330 NZD: Get this toolkit, filled with a selection of physical and online resources tailored for immediate impact. Its comprehensive nature is designed to extend your learning and application of the course content.
Your Own Emotional Culture Deck - Valued at $160 NZD: Receive your personal ECD, an essential tool for applying course principles in real-world settings, adding even more value to your toolkit.
Exclusive 60-Minute Group Coaching Call: Enhance your course experience with a group coaching call, scheduled eight weeks post-course. Hosted via Zoom, this session provides an opportunity to solidify your learning, address any questions, and ensure you're applying your new skills effectively. Whether you attend live or watch the replay later, this call is a key step in your continued development.
Continued Learning Discount: Enjoy a 50% discount on your future purchases of The Emotional Culture Deck, a testament to our commitment to your ongoing development.
ECD Emotional Change Strategy Certificate of Practice: A formal acknowledgement of your dedication to enhancing your Emotional Culture Deck skills. This certificate serves as a testament to your commitment to emotional leadership and amplifying human conversations about what really matters in the workplace
90-Day All Access Pass to our Online Elephant Rider Community: By enrolling, you gain 90 days of access to online ECD resources, expertise, and continued support, all designed to flip the traditional approach to Change Strategy development

Your Emotional Change Toolkit:
As part of the Course, you gain access to a change toolkit, designed to enrich your learning and application of change mastery. Here's what's included, providing you with comprehensive resources valued at a total of 330 NZD:
ECD Personal Change Conversation Guide: Facilitate meaningful conversations around personal change, empowering you and your team to navigate transitions with greater awareness and alignment.
ECD Know Yourself Through Change Handbook: A reflective tool that guides you in understanding your own responses to change, fostering personal growth and resilience.
ECD Change Leadership Canvas & Workshop Plan: Strategise and execute change leadership with a structured approach, enhancing your ability to lead effectively during transitional times.
ECD Exploring Team Change Canvas & Workshop Plan: Collaboratively explore and address team dynamics during change, fostering a supportive and adaptive team environment.
ECD Change Rituals Canvas: Introduce and establish meaningful rituals that support and acknowledge change processes, reinforcing a culture of continuous adaptation and cohesion.
Bonus: ECD Transitions Handbook: Dive deeper into managing transitions with this additional resource, offering further strategies and insights to complement your change toolkit.
These resources are not just theoretical; they're practical, actionable tools that you will learn to apply during the course, ensuring you can implement what you've learned immediately and effectively within your teams or consulting practices.
Is The ECD Emotional Change Strategy Course Right for You?
This Course is carefully designed not only for in-house change leaders but also for external change agents who are passionate about driving meaningful progress. It is ideal for:
Change Managers: Who are looking for innovative ways to lead transformation initiatives with empathy and insight.
Organisation Development Managers: Who aim to shape adaptable, resilient organisational cultures.
HR Professionals: Who support and guide employees through the human aspects of organisational changes.
Coaches and Consultants: Who help organisations navigate through change with bespoke solutions.
Project Leaders: Who oversee transitions and want to ensure they are carried out with emotional intelligence.
Team Leads and Supervisors: Who manage day-to-day team dynamics and want to lead with a deeper understanding of emotional drivers.
Strategic Planners: Involved in crafting the long-term direction of their organisations and understanding the emotional implications of change.
Whether you're guiding a team internally or advising organisations externally, the Emotional Change Strategy Course will equip you with the ECD tools and skills to facilitate change with empathy and humanity.
Your ECD journey towards starts here.
As soon as you successfully complete your Course, you qualify as a certified ECD Change Practitioner and proudly earn your Elephant Rider Badge. This marks your commitment to crafting emotional cultures and connects you with our global community, The Emotional Culture Community, ready to support your growth.
What is the Emotional Culture Deck?

The Emotional Culture Deck (ECD) is the number one game in the world for better workplace culture designed and created by Jeremy Dean of riders&elephants.
The ECD is currently used by over 400,000 people in over 55+ countries, it is a uniquely powerful way to create human conversations about what really matters in the workplace. 
The game facilitates face-to-face human conversations about what matters. It nudges vulnerability. Builds empathy. Creates connections and fosters trust within teams.
It's the ultimate card game toolkit for more successful and human workplaces.
Click here to learn more about The ECD and watch the origin story video below of the founder of riders&elephants sharing the story behind the game.
Join Lotty and learn how to use the Emotional Culture Deck as part of navigating and managing change 
Learn from one of the worlds most experienced Emotional Culture Deck Consultants and Facilitators - Lotty Roberts
Lotty Roberts is an Emotional Culture Coach, Consultant and Facilitator. Since completing the ECD Masterclass Course in 2018, Lotty has become one of the most experienced Emotional Culture Deck consultants in the world and the first to ever become a Master Level Certified ECD Consultant. Lotty has delivered over 200 Emotional Culture Deck client workshops, as well as dozens of 1:2:1's, helping teams of all sizes, in a variety of industries create more healthy and high performing cultures. 
Lotty is also a regular on the speaking circuit delivering talks and presentations on all aspects of emotional culture including change, leadership and resilience.
Lotty's speciality and passion is all about helping leaders, teams and cultures to thrive, flourish and flow in a fast paced world, through the power of mindfulness and embracing emotions.
Lotty is the founder of her business, ‘MiND.U’, where she is devoted to helping companies and individuals build the emotional capability, resilience and wisdom to navigate the ever changing, complex and dynamic world we find ourselves in.
Will refreshments be provided during the workshop?
Coffee, tea, water and some light snacks will be available during the morning tea break but you will need to bring or buy your own lunch.
What's the refund and cancellation policy?
Unfortunately, ECD Certified Consultants don’t offer refunds for this workshop experience. 
However, you may send someone else in your place to this workshop if you cannot attend for any reason.
You must notify your Workshop host that you will not attend the workshop and the name of the person that will attend in your spot.
If you cannot attend the workshop, and no one attends in your place, the workshop organiser will post your ECD Emotional Leadership Development Workshop Kit to you (Value 490 NZD) – so you don’t miss out completely.
If the Workshop Host cancels this workshop, you will be transferred to the next available workshop. You can contact the Workshop host for a refund if you cannot attend the revised workshop date.

Much-loved podcaster, TV star, and chronic over-sharer is returning to the stage. Abbie Chatfield is bringing her raw and unfiltered self to The Opera House for a one-off show. 
In 2023, Abbie thrilled Australian fans and critics with The Trauma Dump Tour. They commended the star for mounting the most relatable live show of the year. Publication The West Australian said her “vulnerability and hilarious insight” made for an unforgettable outing. Expect more of this when she brings the tour to New Zealand in September. 
Abbie rose to fame as a contestant in ‘The Bachelor Australia’. She has also starred in other reality shows and is a radio and television host. With over 478k Instagram followers and more than 445k on TikTok, Abbie has become a prominent social media personality. She’s well-known for her political activism, which she discusses on her podcast, ‘It’s A Lot with Abbie Chatfield’.

events.id: NZ Opera — The Monster in the Maze-St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: NZ Opera — The Monster in the Maze
events.venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
In an exciting and unusual twist to operatic tradition, New Zealand Opera is producing a show where amateurs sing on stage with professionals. ‘The Monster in the Maze’ retells the myth of the minotaur. The groundbreaking work is community-focused and community-driven. In the performance, community singers and instrumentalists stand shoulder-to-shoulder with their professional counterparts.
When King Minos defeats the Athenians, he decides to punish them by destroying their hope for the future. Every year, the king compels the conquered Athenians to send him their youth. He gives them to the minotaur, a terrible beast at the centre of his island’s maze. The youth are not willing to accept their fate. The story is about resistance, justice, and finding power in collectivism.
‘The Monster in the Maze’ has been praised by audiences, participants, and reviewers worldwide. Its Aotearoa debut season is directed by Anapela Polataivao. Anapela is known for directing the feature movie ‘Red, White & Brass’ (2023), and live theatre piece ‘Wild Dogs Under My Skirt’.

events.id: Pōneke Leader Learning & Doing Day (Sep 2025)-2/57 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Pōneke Leader Learning & Doing Day (Sep 2025)
events.venue: 2/57 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Often, the best folk to learn from (and commiserate with) are other leaders. But since we're so busy in the doing, we don't often have the time or ability to take a full day off from work to dedicate to learning new things.... and sometimes conferences can be hit and miss on content.
Last year we created a Leader Learning & Doing Day, where you can come and co-work in the same space as a bunch of other founders and leaders, and also go to mini unconference sessions during the day that are set by you. You share/learn/discuss the things that matter to you most - with other folk that are going through it. We had sessions ranging from how to use AI in your org, founder transitions, and even a photographer taking new head shots for folk. 
The price of the ticket covers a koha to the venue and for some coffee/snacks. You can choose to come to all the sessions, or just one or two of them, and you'll have access to coffee and wifi throughout the day. 

Below is our plan for the day:
9:30am - Arrival & coffee
9:45am - Welcome, Introduction round & Agenda Setting
10:30am - Session 1
11:30am - Session 2
12:30pm - Lunch
1:30pm - Session 3
2:30pm - Farewell/head out for a drink (or home - you choose!)
Co-hosts
Anna Guenther - helps Kiwi fund the things they care about. Co-founder of PledgeMe and Cheese Cartel, co-instigator of Women Who Get Sh*t Done Unconference
Ash Holwell -  creates spaces enabling care and connection towards a socially and sustainably just world. Co-founder of oneonesix, oneonethree and two/fiftyseven they believe deeply that safe places are fundamental to thriving communities, therefore everyone should have access to them.

events.id: Homicidal Pacifist- Dust Off Your Guillotines-12 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Homicidal Pacifist- Dust Off Your Guillotines
events.venue: 12 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Three haunted sock puppets leading government. Shit-for-brains liberals peddling ‘both sides’ fucknuggetry as the people march for peace and their governments pour gasoline on fire. And wt actual f is a ‘lesser’ evil? Sameena Zehra is back to explore whether it's time to dust off your guillotines (even for a pacifist, it’s definitely time) with dark comedy & delicious storytelling that will make you gasp and guffaw as you channel your inner homicidal pacifist to pen a culling list of your own.
Following a sold out season at NZ International Comedy Festival earlier this year, Sameena is bringing this show back for one night only during TAHI festival as part of TAHI Encores season.
Content Notes
This show is accessible to Blind or Low Vision folks without audio description.
The venue is fully accessible. 
No loud noises or flashing lights. I will occasionally raise my voice, but will avoid shouting.
Adult, political, and other confrontational content (see title). 
Also... coarse language, because... lalochezia (look it up).
Some direct chat with the audience- however, if you avert your eyes or shake your head, I will not speak directly to you.
Queer friendly.
Sameena Zehra is an award winning comedian, storyteller, actor, writer, director and blues singer/songwriter. She is a political satirist, an intersectional feminist, and a humanist. Her humour is dark and her mind is absurd, equally at home exploring the individual experiences of daily life and the larger issues of the world we live in, creating work that is rooted in the human condition, in holding power to account, and in bringing people together in spaces that are tender and robust. She has performed her solo shows all over the world, including Edinburgh Fringe, Melbourne International Comedy Festival, Brighton Fringe, Adelaide Fringe, The Nordic Fringes, and New Zealand Fringe, where she was nominated for 'Best In Fringe' 2016, and won 'Outstanding Performer' in 2017. Before moving to Aotearoa New Zealand in 2019, Sameena lived and worked in the UK where she has performed at the National Theatre, and has toured internationally with the Royal Shakespeare Company. She performed the critically acclaimed season of her show 'Tea with Terrorists' at Circa Theatre in Te Whanganui-a-Tara, (which was nominated in the ‘Outstanding Performer’  and ‘Best Director’ categories at the Wellington Theatre Awards) before touring it at festivals around Aotearoa.
Here's things people have said about shows Sameena has made...don't take them too seriously, it's just individuals, with individual opinions. You might have different ones (but you'll have to come to the show to find out)
‘Astonishing, and frequently violent... ’ The Independent, UK (That's a particularly good one)
‘Outstanding...a master storyteller’ Rip It Up, Adelaide
'Funny, fiery, brave and true.’ Herald, Scotland
‘Humour in every strand’
‘Left wanting the next chapter’ The Latest, Brighton
‘...an intimate atmosphere with all the warmth, energy and enthusiasm of a full house at the Apollo’
‘Fluency, intensity and vivacity... ’The Age, Melbourne
‘...combines warmth with political passion.’ Scotsgay
‘... smart and sharp... a breath of fresh air... ’ Nicholas Holm, The Post, NZ
‘ ... the wittiest and sassiest lady I’ve ever had the pleasure of watching. Move over Kitty Flanagan.’ Buzzcut, Perth
(Honestly, this one's a bit over the top- Kitty Flanagan is amazing and absolutely not moving over for anyone)

events.id: FUTUNA LECTURE SERIES 2025 WELLINGTON- TUESDAY 16TH SEPTEMBER-34 Mulgrave Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: FUTUNA LECTURE SERIES 2025 WELLINGTON- TUESDAY 16TH SEPTEMBER
events.venue: 34 Mulgrave Street, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
FUTUNA LECTURE SERIES 2025
The Futuna Lecture Series commenced in 2011 and has been one of the main annual events on the NZ Architectural calendar for the last 14 years. It is the Futuna Chapel Trust’s major fundraiser each year and attracts a large audience of architects, architectural designers, technicians, architecture and design students and interested members of the public. The Trust exists solely on koha/donations as well as financial support from selected sponsors and donors.
Our sponsors, Dulux NZ, APL, Plytech, Warren Trust and the Auckland, Christchurch and Wellington NZIA branches have continued their support for the Futuna Lecture Series 2025.
This year the Trust welcomes three new sponsors being Roofing Industries Limited, AGP and Big River Panels. The additional support of these new sponsors is very much appreciated and ensures that the Futuna Chapel Trust can continue to attract speakers to NZ of a similar calibre to that of the 2025 Futuna Lecture, Francis Kéré.
The Trust takes this opportunity to thank Metalcraft Roofing for their support of the Futuna Lecture Series from 2012 - 2024.
The Trust looks forward to welcoming architects, designers, graduates, students and interested members of the public to attend this event and support the Trust in its work and well as that of the Kéré Foundation.
The Trust will donate 20% of the ticket income to the Kéré Foundation to support the work of Francis Kéré in Gando, Burkina Faso.
The Futuna Trust is a charitable organisation and all funds raised from the Futuna Lecture Series go towards the ongoing care, maintenance and operation of Futuna Chapel and also to support various initiatives undertaken by the Trust.  Please register using the ticket types of $10, $15, $25 or $30 GST inclusive.  Booking fees are in addition to the ticket prices.
BOOKINGS ARE ESSENTIAL TO ATTEND THIS EVENT
There will be 15 Design CPD points available for NZ registered architects attending the event. Please include your NZRAB registration number when purchasing Architect tickets

events.id: STEAMS School BLENHEIM Term 3 2025-Mayfield, Blenheim 7201, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: STEAMS School BLENHEIM Term 3 2025
events.venue: Mayfield, Blenheim 7201, New Zealand
events.description:
STEAMS is an integrated approach to learning topics of Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, Maths, and Society that fosters critical thinking, problem solving, communication and collaboration. Its aim is to teach real world skills through engaging methods whilst allowing individuals to be creative. This involves immersing tamariki into projects and activities that develop innovation and champion curiosity. STEAMS is not ‘play based learning’ but focused learning through an integrated hands-on approach allowing children to take risks and explore their own curiosity in a subject without time barriers.
At the Ministry of Inspiration we offer STEAMS learning each term for Year 1-8 students. Once a week students will attend a class at Waterlea Racecourse, Blenheim on TUESDAY or THURSDAY. STEAMS Jr (ages 7-9) start at 9am and finish at 2:45pm on TUESDAY. Little STEAMerS operates from 12-3 on TUESDAY. STEAMS Sr (ages 10-13) operates on THURSDAY from 9am to 245 pm. We qualify as an off-site learning programme which enables schools to record the students as “learning offsite” rather than absent for that day.
Inquiry, collaboration, and an emphasis on process-based learning are at the heart of the STEAM approach. Each term the classes will have a focus which drives the learning and our amazing teachers create opportunities to help each student develop their understanding, improve their skills and gain knowledge in a range of topics.
Students who participate in STEAM learning:
· think outside the box
· feel safe to express innovative and creative ideas
· feel comfortable doing hands-on learning
· take ownership over their learning
· work collaboratively with others
· understand the ways that science, maths, the arts, and technology work together
· become increasingly curious about the world around them and feel empowered to change it for the better.
When does it meet, and where?
The school is held during school terms.
STEAMS Jr (ages 7-9) TUESDAY, 9-245.
STEAMS Sr (ages 10-13) THURSDAY, 9-245
Little STEAMerS (ages 5-6) TUESDAY 12-3.
Location:  Waterlea Racecourse, enter off of Linton St.
How much does it cost?
The students come for a paid three-week trial-as a new student you pay for that through Humanitix.
If both family and teacher feel there is a good fit for the child in the class, they continue for the rest of the term. You are then invoiced for the full term less the amount paid for the Trial.
Payment is by term, with a cost of $63 per day plus GST. We have a limited number of scholarships available that are awarded on a term by term basis for those with financial need for 25% off. 
Little STEAMerS is $25 per day plus GST.
Will my child’s school mind that they miss a day per week?
You will need to inform the child’s school that he or she will be at STEAMS School one day per week. To date we have not encountered any issues around accommodating a child’s participation in STEAMS School, and many of the region’s schools are very supportive of the programme. Once enrolled, you are encouraged to inform the teacher and office staff that your child should be marked present for the day they attend STEAMS School, as they will be attending an academic school as opposed to being absent due to illness or other reasons.

events.id: Mental Health First Aid Aotearoa-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Mental Health First Aid Aotearoa
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Mental Health First Aid Aotearoa
Mental Health First Aid is an evidence-based workshop which gives people the skills and confidence to have supportive conversations with their whānau, co-workers and community and help guide them to professional help if needed.
You will learn to recognise common mental health challenges, how to provide initial help to someone experiencing a mental health challenge using a practical, evidence-based action plan, and how to respond in a crisis situation. During the workshop you will have the opportunity to practice new skills in a safe environment.
NOTE: This course is subsidised with funding from the Tertiary Education Commission (TEC) and you must provide photo ID when you attend your first session, if applicable.
Mental health challenges covered in the course include:
Depression
Anxiety
Psychosis
Substance use problems
Mental Health Crisis Covered:
Suicidal thoughts and behaviours
Non- Suicidal self-injury
Panic attack
Traumatic events
Severe effects from Alcohol or other substance use
Aggressive behaviours
People who attend Mental Health First Aid training can complete a short online assessment to be accredited as a Mental Health First Aider. You must attend the full two days to be able to do the online assessment for accreditation. The accreditation is valid for three years.
If you choose not to be accredited, you will receive a certificate of participation if you attend the full course. You will also receive a workbook as part of your course fee.
A condition of enrolment is that you must provide photo ID when you attend.

events.id: Messie-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Messie
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.description:
AUCKLAND, NEW ZEALAND (Jul 1, 2025) – Wellington-based DJ phenomenon MESSIE, aka Tessa Hills has today announced two All Night Long DJ sets across Pōneke and Tāmaki Makaurau. Gaining international attention after opening for one of the United Kingdom’s most coveted DJs Fred again.. and remixing his song ‘places to be’ which now has over 2.6M listens on Spotify alone, MESSIE is quickly becoming one of the most exciting new names to watch in New Zealand.
Audiences will be able to enjoy MESSIE’s high-energy, electrifying set for literally the entire night - with these two shows running until the early hours of the morning. Saturday, September 13th will see her take over Auckland’s Studio the Venue, before heading to Wellington’s San Fran the following Saturday, September 20th.
Tickets for MESSIE’s All Night Long tour in Auckland and Wellington will be available to purchase by the General Public on Friday 4th July at 12:00pm.
My Live Nation members will also be able to secure tickets during the presale which commences Wednesday 2nd July from 11:00am until Friday 4th July at 11:00am. Fans can register for access at livenation.co.nz.
MESSIE is taking Aotearoa’s electronic dance music scene to filthy new levels. As a former drummer, her passion for drumming was the pipeline for her falling in love with genres like Garage, Breakbeat, and Jungle. She has since expanded her sound and it’s safe to say each set will keep you guessing what will come next as she effortlessly merges genres such as Baile Funk, Ghetto Tech, Jersey Club, Juke, Afro beat inspired drums, Techno and many more global club soundscapes that encompass her high energy DJ sets. MESSIE’s sets are guaranteed to be bootleg heavy with something for everyone as she draws from her own music taste of rap and grime, to early 2000’s singalongs, girl-boss anthems and queer music culture in the form of edits you’d never expect.
Alongside her headline tour around Aotearoa in mid 2024, MESSIE has now brought her fresh, high-energy club music internationally to Glastonbury, Reading & Leeds, R&V, Beyond The Valley, Wildlands, Love Saves The Day, Gemfest & Outro Festival. With slots at Pohoda Festival, Hidden Festival, Motion, Truck Festival, AIASOUND and All Points East locked in for the second half of 2025, there is no slowing her down.
MESSIE
ALL NIGHT LONG TOUR Presented by Live Nation
STUDIO THE VENUE, AUCKLAND
SATURDAY, 13 SEPTEMBER
SAN FRAN, WELLINGTON
SATURDAY, 20 SEPTEMBER
TICKETS ON SALE FRIDAY, 4 JULY, 12PM (LOCAL)
Live Nation Presale: Wednesday 2 July 11:00am - Friday 4 July 11:00am Artist Presale: Wednesday 2 July 11:00am - Friday 4 July 11:00am
For complete tour & ticket information, visit: livenation.co.nz

events.id: Brant Bjork Trio: Wellington-Valhalla, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: Brant Bjork Trio: Wellington
events.venue: Valhalla, Wellington
events.description:
Brant Bjork has spent over a quarter of a century at the heart of California’s desert rock scene. From cutting his teeth as the drummer and songwriter for Kyuss’s legendary early albums to carrying the torch for fuzz-driven rock with Fu Manchu from 1994 to 2001, Bjork’s impact is undeniable. Over the past two decades, he has produced albums for other artists, launched numerous side projects, built an extensive solo career as a singer, guitarist, and bandleader, and founded his own record label. His story is one of relentless, boundary-pushing creativity.

In 2024, Bjork re-formed the Brant Bjork Trio, teaming up with Michael Amster (Nebula, Mondo Generator) on drums and longtime friend—and desert rock pioneer—Mario Lalli on bass.

In 2025, the trio heads to New Zealand for three exclusive shows celebrating their latest album, Once Upon a Time in the Desert. This is a rare chance to catch a true icon of desert rock live—an experience not to be missed.

Joining them on all three dates are Australian rockers Full Tone Generator. Born on the beaches of Australia by Andy Fernando and brought to life in the Californian desert, Full Tone Generator brings the heat with a powerful blend of riff-heavy rock and raw energy.

Secure your tickets today!

events.id: Te ORA Hui-ā-Tau & Scientific Conference 2025-41 Te Rauparaha Street, Ōtaki 5512, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Te ORA Hui-ā-Tau & Scientific Conference 2025
events.venue: 41 Te Rauparaha Street, Ōtaki 5512, New Zealand
events.description:
Nau mai, haere mai.

Te ORA invites our members, whānau, partners, and supporters to come together for Hui-ā-Tau 2025, held at Te Wānanga o Raukawa in Ōtaki, a place of cultural strength, learning, and connection.

Hokia ki ō maunga kia pūrea e koe ngā hau a Tāwhirimātea
Return to your mountain to be cleansed by the winds of Tāwhirimātea

As Māori Medical Practitioners we are often exposed to unique pressures and responsibilities not only within our workplace, but also within our whānau and the communities we serve. For that reason, an important way of remaining grounded is to return to our maunga, our awa, and whenua to be refuelled and replenished for the mahi ahead of us.

Over four days, we’ll reflect on our progress, celebrate our people, and explore what it means to thrive as Māori in medicine. This gathering is an opportunity to socialise, connect, learn, and contribute to the future of Māori health in an uplifting space.

The programme includes:
Te Rā Tūhura: A careers expo for tauira and aspiring Māori health professionals
Annual General Meeting (financial members only) & Wānanga
Scientific Conference (2 days): Keynotes, abstract presentations, and panel discussions
Te ORA Awards Dinner: A night to celebrate leadership, service, and achievement across our community
Please Note:
An Awards Dinner ticket is included for the following registration types:
– Full Conference Registration (all member types)
– PGY1/PGY2 Junior Doctors
– Tauira (Students)
– Non-Members
– Sponsors
If you are bringing whānau or guests to the Awards Dinner, their tickets will need to be purchased separately.
Tamariki Programme
We’re working to create a safe and engaging tamariki programme during Hui-ā-Tau 2025, depending on interest and age ranges.
If you're planning to bring tamariki, please complete the tamariki registration for each individual so we can understand numbers, ages, and needs. This will help us finalise the programme and ensure appropriate support is in place.
Details will be confirmed closer to the event.
Accommodation On-Site at Te Wānanga o Raukawa
We have a limited number of on-site beds available at Te Wānanga o Raukawa.

If you're interested in staying on-site during Hui-ā-Tau, please let us know at checkout. Spaces are limited and will be allocated based on interest and availability.
Important – Support for Tauira
Tauira who require support with travel to Hui-ā-Tau must complete their registration no later than Thursday 29 August 2025.
After this date, Te ORA will not be able to guarantee support for travel.

Whether you’re a student, doctor, or supporter, this is your invitation to be part of Te ORA's biggest event of the year.

events.description:
Costuming Austen's Characters (Rescheduled May Event)
Following on from our panel discussion with the writers and directors of local Austen productions we welcome costumier Meredith Dooley who worked on dressing the actors for all those productions.
Meredith Dooley is a Wellington born and bred actor, director and costumier. She completed a BA in Theatre and Film at Victoria University of Wellington in the early 1990s, and then trained in acting and directing in London. In 2018-19 she gained a Diploma in Costume Construction at Toi Whakaari New Zealand Drama School and spent the next two Covid-affected years working on theatre, film and television productions such as Wellington Paranormal, Mr Corman, WOW, and Wellington Opera's Don Giovanni.
Meredith has returned to the office and over the last few years has created costumes for Stagecraft's Pride & Prejudice and Persuasion, and KAT Theatre's Sense and Sensibility, amongst others. Early in 2024 she dipped her toes back into professional theatre, working with cabaret star Meow Meow during the NZ Festival of the Arts.

No. Everyone is welcome.

events.id: Folk Bitch Trio-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Folk Bitch Trio
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.description:
Folk Bitch Trio Debut headline show in Te Whanganui-a-Tara/Wellington
Melbourne’s alluring Folk Bitch Trio have announced their debut album release tour of New Zealand, playing headline shows in Auckland, Wellington & Christchurch.

Now Would Be A Good Time, the debut album by Folk Bitch Trio, tells vivid, visceral stories. Their music sounds familiar, and it’s built on a foundation of the music they’ve loved throughout their lives–gnarled Americana, classic rock, piquant, clear-eyed balladry. But the songs are modern, youthful, singing acutely through dissociative daydreams and galling breakups, sexual fantasies and media overload, all the petty resentments and minor humiliations of being in your early twenties in the 2020s.

Heide Peverelle (they/them), Jeanie Pilkington (she/her) and Gracie Sinclair (she/her) have known each other since high school, and first started singing together five years ago. Peverelle recalls sending Pilkington a heartbroken—in their words “bad”—song they had written called “Edie”; Pilkington remembers the song differently. “I felt so inspired that my teenage peer had written something so honest and original,” she recalls. It wasn’t long before she messaged Peverelle and Sinclair, asking if they’d be interested in starting a “folk bitch trio.”  As soon as they started singing together, their connection deepened, and “the chemistry of being inspired by each other was evident from the get-go,” says Sinclair.  

Listening to Folk Bitch Trio, it’s clear that this is a band of three distinct points of view, with contrasting and complementary backgrounds and visions. Pilkington grew up with two musician parents and brings formative memories of watching them perform, of listening to Gillian Welch and Lucinda Williams, and of her own imagined path as a career musician. Peverelle spends their spare time making art and furniture; those hobbies, as well as their love of pop music old and new, articulate a love for the tactile, the home-grown and the hand-made. Sinclair is the self-proclaimed jester of the group, but her taste skews dark, gothic, baroque and dramatic, expressed as a love of opera and ballet as well as musicians as wide-ranging as Patti Smith, Nirvana and Tchaikovsky.

Folk music has a bad habit of being presented as a deathly serious concern. It’s the music you cry to, it’s overly sacred, it’s solemnly considered by critic-historians. But Folk Bitch Trio have a shared sense of humour that is embedded deep in their music and that sets it alight, safe from the self-serious traps of the genre. Now Would Be A Good Time is funny and darkly ironic in the manner of writers like Mary Gaitskill or Otessa Moshfegh. On “Gods A Different Sword” they crack that “My body keeps the score/But if you tell me that you need it/I can get up off my floor,” a nod to the clichéd, over-referenced millennial self-help book, as they wryly sing about sex within earshot of housemates, and wring sexual innuendo from physics terminology.


San Fran holds a Supervised License, meaning minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue. Minors are of course not allowed to purchase alcohol under any circumstance.

Auckland based Albi and the Wolves set fire to stages and fill hearts with hope with their energetic and relatable alternative indie folk songs. Proud albino frontman Albi (Chris Dent), Pascal Roggen and Michael Young have crafted a stage show brimming with energy yet with pauses for reflection. events.id: 5Rhythms workshop with Natalie Poole - Archaeology: Uncovering the Bones-98 The Parade, Paekākāriki 5034, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: 5Rhythms workshop with Natalie Poole - Archaeology: Uncovering the Bones
events.venue: 98 The Parade, Paekākāriki 5034, New Zealand
events.description:
A full 5Rhythms® weekend workshop in Paekākāriki, Wellington, New Zealand
Join us for a deep dive into the skeletal landscape of the body—where form and movement provoke the memory of our animal, and mineral cells/selves.
In this weekend immersion, we’ll uncover the bones—exploring the structure, strength, support, and vitality that arise when we embody our bony architecture. Through the 5Rhythms map, we’ll trace, align, and articulate the inner scaffolding that grounds our shapes, holds us upright, and upon which we can align our sense of self.
This workshop invites you to:
Bring awareness to your bones as carriers of clarity and direction
Realign and re-pattern deep underpinnings, discovering new sources of strength, softness, and ease
Experience how skeletal embodiment can deepen your dance practice and connections to community, and life beyond the dance floor
Together, we’ll take our bones into the dance—and our dance into the bones.
Natalie Poole is a certified 5Rhythms teacher (Waves & Heartbeat levels), a Dance-Movement Therapist, and a Somatic Educator trained in Body-Mind Centering®. Her approach weaves embodied storytelling, deep listening, and transformative movement.
All willing movers are welcome.

events.id: Elvis: An American Trilogy-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Elvis: An American Trilogy
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
What’s better than one Elvis Presley? Three Elvis Presleys. You’ll be all shook up when you experience ʻElvis: An American Trilogy’ at The Opera House. The show takes you on a spellbinding journey through three song eras of one of the most famous singers ever. First up: the sound of the 1950s. Louis Brown will capture the audience with the rockabilly sound and signature dance moves of Elvis’ early career. Arron Walker then takes the mic and recreates the role of Elvis in his movie years in the 1960s.  This period incorporates the singer’s famous straight-out-of-the-army look and the black-leather look. Finally, Steve Michaels pays homage to ‘Aloha from Hawaii’ — a famous 1973 concert broadcast across Asia and Oceania. All three performers create a magical atmosphere as befits ‘The King’. 
The sound, the moves, and the charm of Elvis Presley are lovingly recreated. Go and see it. It’s now or never.

events.id: Developing your Solution Focused Approach, NZCCA Wellington PD Day-106 Mana Esplanade, Paremata, Wellington 5026, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Developing your Solution Focused Approach, NZCCA Wellington PD Day
events.venue: 106 Mana Esplanade, Paremata, Wellington 5026, New Zealand
events.description:
The Solution Focused Approach is currently a leading method in leadership, coaching, education, and counselling throughout the world. The principles of the Solution Focused approach are simple to understand and easily mastered with practice - it has been likened to learning a language. From this workshop, people will gain skills and knowledge that can be immediately applied to their context or environment. At the heart of Solution focused practice is the belief that change is possible in people’s lives, and change is happening all the time. When a client is asked to notice change it amplifies it makes a difference to the client. It is a great pleasure and honour to walk with clients during this process.
 In the Solution Focused workshop, you will:
+ Learn the art or be refreshed in the Solution Focused approach
+ Develop a Solution Focused mindset to ask questions with hope
+ Draw on the wealth of Bible resources for hope
+ Apply with particular attention to people living with Grief and Loss, Trauma and Couples (my favourite issues)
+ Apply questions to help others find confidence, resources and move forward
+ Focus on solutions rather than the problem/s
+ Practice the skills needed to apply the Solution Focused approach
+ Share your strengths and resources in a Solution Focused way
+ Facilitate a Solution Focused conversation with individuals or groups
+ Hear some of the latest developments in the Solution Focused world
+ Have opportunities to ask questions and discuss with others
 Come on a hope-filled journey of change, joy, and possibility. 
1/2 price for students!
  Bio
Matt Cameron lives in Timaru, NZ and is a counsellor, Solution Focused trainer, teacher, and tennis referee. He also enjoys being a home handyman, building or fixing things. His Christian faith is important to him and he serves on a leadership team in his church. A NZCCA member, he also leads the Online Region. He has been married to his beautiful wife for 25 years and they have two boys in their early 20's. He enjoys various sports and has played competitive tennis, badminton, soccer, rugby and most recently fistball - being selected to play in the NZ Masters team (google "fistball" if you haven’t heard of it!).

DOORS 6:00 pm 
SHOW START 6:30 pm

Tim Freedman is the lead singer, songwriter and pianist of legendary Australian folk rock group The Whitlams. He will perform the best of his renowned nine album repertoire with pedal steel and electric guitarist Ollie Thorpe.

Since 2022 a reinvigorated Freedman has led The Whitlams in a resurgence, touring heavily and releasing two new albums “Sancho” (2022) and the Americana tinged “Kookaburra” (2024). Between band tours he has started performing smaller country towns in duo mode, and this piano/pedal steel configuration has developed delicate atmospherics to suit the poignant narratives in Freedman’s songs.

In September The Whitlams will performs three shows with the Melbourne Symphony Orchestra.


San Fran holds a Supervised License. Minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue.

events.id: Fur Real: Mastering the New Pet Rules for Stronger Tenancy Outcomes [Wellington]-Level 1/60 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Fur Real: Mastering the New Pet Rules for Stronger Tenancy Outcomes [Wellington]
events.venue: Level 1/60 Cambridge Terrace, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
A 3.5-hour strategic training for landlords and property managers
The law has changed.
The right to keep pets at rentals is no longer up for debate—it's here, and it’s coming into effect soon.
For landlords and property managers, that means one thing: it’s time to stop burying your head in the sand. The sooner you understand the new rules, adapt your strategy, and adjust your systems, the better your outcomes will be.
Join tenancy expert Sarina Gibbon for this dynamic and practical 3.5-hour workshop designed to give you clarity, control, and commercial confidence under the new pet tenancy laws. You’ll walk away knowing exactly how to protect your property, vet tenants and pets properly, draft enforceable clauses, and maximise business continuity—all while staying compliant.
🔑 What You’ll Learn:
What the new presumptive pet rights really mean for you
How to strategically structure tenancy agreements with fair and enforceable pet clauses
What reasonable grounds for refusing a pet look like in practice
What you can legally ask about a pet during the application process
How to vet pet-owning tenants and manage risk with confidence
The roles of pet bonds, landlord insurance, and the Tenancy Tribunal
How to balance your legal obligations with business expediency and long-term tenancy success

🧠 Workshop Includes:
✔ 3.5 hours of expert-led training
✔ Light morning tea
✔ Real-life scenarios and interactive activities
✔ Guest insights from insurance and proptech professionals
✔ Take-home clause templates, checklists, and Tribunal-prep tools

👩‍🏫 About Your Trainer
Sarina Gibbon is the Director of Tenancy Advisory Ltd, a boutique consultancy specialising in residential tenancy strategy. With a reputation as one of New Zealand’s most trusted tenancy experts, Sarina brings 15+ years of experience helping landlords, property managers, tenants, and community housing providers not just meet legal standards—but exceed them. Her training is known for being sharp, practical, and deeply focused on maximising outcomes and minimising stress.


🐾 Proudly Supported by Renti
We're thrilled to welcome Renti as our official content and marketing partner for the Fur Real workshop series! Renti will be joining us in person across all four locations to present practical, tech-powered strategies for navigating the new pet rules with ease. Attendees will also receive:
✅ A 3-month subscription waiver for agencies who sign up at the event
✅ Early access to Renti Academy and a one-month cancellation policy for trial sign-ups
✅ Bonus prize giveaways at each session
Renti’s smart tenancy tools are the perfect complement to the new pet provisions—come see them in action!
🐾 With Expert Support from Initio Insurance
We’re proud to partner with Initio, a leader in landlord insurance, to bring you expert guidance on navigating the insurance implications of pets in rentals. While Initio won’t be attending in person, they’re contributing:
📘 A free downloadable eBook on pet-related damage and insurance coverage
🎥 A BONUS video Q&A session answering common insurance questions
📋 A co-branded post-event checklist on pet-proofing your rental and protecting your investment
These resources will be made available exclusively to ticket holders—ensuring you walk away with long-term tools and practical know-how.

🎟️ Tickets
Discounted Early Bird Tickets On Sale Until 31 July 
Spaces are limited. Book early to secure your spot. 
✈️  Nationwide Training Sessions 
Not in Wellington? Sign up to our other sessions at Auckland, Christchurch or Dunedin.

If you’re a beginner, by the end of the course, you'll be able to:

If you already know some basics, you’ll be extended further to include:

• Gaining some basic knowledge on chord-scale relationship to start simple improvisations

events.name: Scottish Country Dancing
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Scottish Country Dancing
Why do Scottish Country Dancing? Great music and amazing ‘brain gym’ for body and mind! Scottish Country Dancing is a very social form of dancing, danced in "sets" usually with four "couples" - unlike Highland Dancing which is usually solo dancing. Have fun and meet new people, while getting fit!
It’s suitable for all levels of fitness, and is a great way of meeting and socialising with new people. Scottish country dancing is a common pastime for thousands of dancers in many countries, whether you’re in Japan, Germany, the US or Scotland itself.
Wear soft flat shoes and loose clothing and bring a bottle of water. No partner is needed – we change partners for every dance!
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to:
• Name and perform to beginner level the five major steps of Scottish Country Dancing
• Name and perform ten simple formations
• Participate in five simple Scottish Country dances, in strathspey (slow) and reel/jig (fast) tempo
• Clap rhythm to reel, jig and strathspey tempo
• Have the confidence and skills to join a club to progress your social dancing 
[This is a physical activity that involves an element of risk.  While all possible measures are taken to prevent accidents or injury, please note that participation is at your own risk].

events.id: Songwriting: How to Write Your Own Songs-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Songwriting: How to Write Your Own Songs
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Songwriting: How to Write Your Own Songs
The course is ideal for anyone who wants to write better songs - whether you’ve got a few songs under your belt or you’re a complete beginner. Take a song idea through to a finished song you can be proud of. Split into easy-to-follow steps, this course walks you through everything from finding titles to writing chord progressions and ensuring your lyrics and melodies fit together. You’ll share your creations with fellow songwriters and get personalised feedback. You’ll see exactly how to turn theory into practice and write your best songs yet.
This course includes:
-  Practical tips and techniques for songwriting
-  Ideas for making your songs stronger, more expressive and more appealing to your audience
-  How to overcome writer’s block, be an inspired and prolific songwriter who writes authentic songs
-  An opportunity to share your songs with fellow students, bounce off ideas and learn from one another
-  Learn how to structure a song effectively
-  The pillars of songwriting and how to use them
-  How to write better lyrics
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to:
-  Discover the exact steps to successfully write your own original songs; expanding a song from a verse and chorus, to a complete song while keeping your listeners engaged using transitions and dynamic contrasts between sections
-  Come up with ideas, write lyrics, melodies, chord progressions and instrumental grooves that have an emotional impact on you and your audience
-  Identify the structure of a great song, including how to combine melody, chords, lyrics and rhythm that create magic for your listeners
-  Possess the confidence and skills to find inspiration and get past common creative hurdles and blocks so you can develop an initial spark of creativity into a complete song
-  Stay inspired and find your authentic voice as a songwriter. r
Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. events.id: Energy Resilience and Affordability Conference-4 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Energy Resilience and Affordability Conference
events.venue: 4 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Ara Ake, in partnership with Community Energy Network and WISE Charitable Trust, is pleased to present the third annual Energy Resilience and Affordability Conference — formerly the Reducing Energy Hardship Conference.
About the conference
This two-day event brings together around 200 attendees to explore the state of energy hardship in Aotearoa, highlight key innovations, and share insights from iwi, communities, and organisations leading change on the ground.
The conference provides a unique platform for thought leaders, practitioners, policy makers, and innovators to connect and collaborate on building a more equitable, affordable, and resilient energy system.
2025 Theme: Regional solutions for equitable energy
New Zealand’s energy future must reflect the diversity of our people, places, and priorities. As we face rising climate, infrastructure, and cost-of-living pressures, regional approaches are becoming key to improving energy resilience—our ability to respond to and recover from disruptions—and affordability, particularly in rural and remote communities.
This year’s conference will explore how regional projects, partnerships and innovations can unlock sustainable, community-led energy solutions and promote energy equity across the motu.
What to expect
The 2025 conference will:
Explore the current roles and relationships between regional and national actors in delivering energy resilience and affordability
Highlight successful initiatives, including iwi-led and community-driven models
Recommend pathways for policy, investment, and coordination to support leadership and scale local impact

events.id: Calligratherapy - Beginners-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Calligratherapy - Beginners
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Calligratherapy - Beginners
Many of us live sedentary lifestyles, sitting for up to eight hours or more a day hunched over our keyboard - all the while rarely taking a proper breath! Even if we wanted to take a deep enriching breath into the lower lobes of our lungs, we are limited due to our posture. Often due to the stresses and strains of a busy work and life balance, our unconscious brain can develop a pattern of holding, irregular and shadow breaths.
Does this sound like your experience? 
Not being able to breathe properly is the key cause of many chronic respiratory diseases (Nestor, 2020)
Calligratherapy combines science journalist James Nestor's theory on proper breathing with the philosophy of ancient Chinese calligraphy to promote a state of optimal wellbeing.
Calligratherapy has been developed specifically for those who have never practiced calligraphy before and who are interested in deriving the benefits without having to learn the language or all the characters. It integrates the simple and intuitive act of inhaling and exhaling into calligraphy practice with Eastern philosophy behind it.
A range of different breathing exercises are embedded into each 90 minute session focusing on different calligraphy scripts.  Over the five weeks, you will develop and practice the awareness of healthy breathing, while learning new techniques of Chinese soft brush calligraphy covering five different scripts. 
All materials included in course fee.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to:
Start a new creative practice in Chinese soft brush calligraphy
Develop your own mindfulness strategy
Better manage everyday stress levels and access a calm, empowered and positive state of mind
Find ways to explore eastern philosophy and develop deeper connections with your spiritual self.

Scriptwriting
During this course, you will develop and build on your writing skills so you can confidently produce scripted narrative. You will learn how the basics of scriptwriting work, whether it be for stage or screen.
 Topics discussed and practised include the hero’s journey, script format, the differences between writing for film, theatre and television, creating dialogue, world building and more.
 We’ll take part in exercises, watch clips and have group discussions. In workshops, you’ll give and receive feedback, developing your scriptwriting skills through both. By the end of the course, you’ll be ready to finish your script, and take the next steps toward bringing it from page to stage (or screen!).
 Bring pen and paper.

- Analyse film, television, and theatre with a new lens for the way scripted stories work
- Develop character arcs and dynamics
- Create and build worlds
- Write effective dialogue and work with subtext
- Develop and implement a writing routine that works for your life
- Give and receive constructive feedback on your writing
- Have the confidence to put your work out into the world

events.name: Queen: It’s a Kinda Magic
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
The beloved rock anthem ‘Bohemian Rhapsody’ turns 50 in 2025. To celebrate the anniversary of the British band Queen’s famous song, a tribute act is touring and stopping in Wellington. The Opera House will pulsate to ‘Queen: It's a Kinda Magic’. The show will celebrate the legacy of Queen and its frontman Freddy Mercury. Think big sound, big screens, crazy lighting, and outlandish costumes. This is a real rock experience. 
Dominic Warren will take the lead performing lead vocals, guitar and piano. All songs are in Freddie’s original key. He’s also got the wit, charm, and bravado to pull off an homage to the ultimate rock vocalist. Get ready to mosh to ‘We Will Rock You,’ ‘We Are the Champions,’ ‘Radio Ga Ga,’ ‘I Want to Break Free,’ ‘Somebody to Love,’ ‘Don’t Stop Me Now,’ ‘Another One Bites the Dust,’ ‘A Kind of Magic,’ and of course, ‘Bohemian Rhapsody.’

events.id: Rob Beckett — Giraffe-St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Rob Beckett — Giraffe
events.venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
Since debuting as a stand-up comic in 2009, British funnyman Rob Beckett has built an impressive career. His new show Giraffe brings his brand of down-to-earth comedy to Wellington’s St James Theatre. From podcasts and radio to hosting, television, and voiceovers, Rob is a versatile comedian. New Zealand audiences might recognise him as one of the winners of the popular show ‘Taskmaster’, or the long-running ‘8 Out of 10 Cats’. He has many other UK television shows to his name including ‘Rob & Romesh Vs.’ and ‘Celebs Go Dating’. Now a father of two, he has focused his lens on the ups and downs of parenting and produces a smash-hit podcast ‘Parenting Hell’.
When asked about leaving his family to tour the other side of the world Rob is unfazed. “My wife thinks it’s going to be tough for me to be away from the family, and don’t get me wrong, I do love my children, but I also enjoy a lie-in and a hotel buffet breakfast. I think I’ll cope.”

events.id: Genealogy - Basics of ancestry.com DNA tests-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Genealogy - Basics of ancestry.com DNA tests
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Genealogy - Basics of ancestry.com DNA tests
Got your test results back and still wondering what a centiMorgan or a shared match is?  Find out what the size of your match means and the tools available to help you work out possible family relationships.
We'll start by looking at Clustering and how the Grouping tool on Ancestry.com can help with this.  We'll also look at the ThruLines and Common Ancestors tools to see how they can provide suggestions for knocking down brick walls in your research.
Also covered during this course are other websites you can upload your results to, how to manage other family member's DNA test results and other tools available when you get a bit more advanced - and just in case you need help in the future, we'll look at some of the places you could get this from.
Please note:  this course will only cover DNA tests taken through Ancestry.com  All computer courses are run in the school computer labs and you are required to use the school desktops for the duration of the course (you are not able to use your own laptop).  Some of the courses may require you to login onto the network. 
Bring a USB stick and your Ancestry.com login details.
 By the end of the course, you’ll be able to:
-  Understand the information provided by Ancestry.com about your DNA matches
-  Use the Grouping, ThruLines and Common Ancestors tools on Ancestry.com
-  Use the Shared CentiMorgan tool on DNAPainter.com
-  Understand where to find other tools
-  Understand the options for using other DNA websites
-  Understand where to get further help
 Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. events.id: the Jesus Lizard NZ Tour: San Fran, Wellington-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: the Jesus Lizard NZ Tour: San Fran, Wellington
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.description:
After initially calling it a day in 1999, the Jesus Lizard officially return full time to save us from the current state of musical mediocrity with their latest album, Rack. A blistering resurgence of the so-called ‘noise rock’ they helped define alongside contemporaries Big Black, Flipper, The Birthday Party, with their previous and most noted albums Head, Goat and Liar. For those of us who live in fear of the reunion album and subsequent tour, the Jesus Lizard thankfully display not only the same chaotic and dark nihilism of their earlier careers but also the maturity and seasoning of a band riding a wave of renewed and reinvigorated form. 

Once slated by famed engineer Steve Albini as “the greatest band I’ve ever seen’ the Jesus Lizard not only lived up to this lofty praise in their prime but continue to do so in their advancing years. David Yow still leads the charge as the maniacally possessed frontman entering crowds with reckless abandon and a stamina that much younger vocalists would kill for. The original rhythm section of David Wm Sims and Mac McNeilly further continue to prove why they were and are the best bass & drum combo since Jones and Bonham, anchoring the ship as Captain Yow and first mate Denison navigate the wild seas of their songs. And while he may not always feature (as he rightly should) on many modern music journalists ‘best guitarists lists’, Duane Denison could perhaps be the most innovative and idiosyncratic punk rock guitarist EVER. However, each member is a sum of their parts but combined they are as Albini also once said “the purest melding of the sublime and profane.”

Whether you are a longtime disciple of the Jesus Lizard, seeing them when last here in ‘98, or perhaps your fandom is more recent and have only seen videos of their legendary live performances, you will know that these shows are not to be missed.  

Saturday 11th October 2025 - The Tuning Fork, Auckland (All ages)
Sunday 12th October 2025 - San Fran, Wellington (R18 unless accompanied by your legal guardian)

Bio

In the jade-cultivating climes of online rock journalism, the angle of “band has new album,”  is about as interesting as watching Instagram reels of your brother-in-law’s recent  bathroom remodel. But when a band decides to follow up their last album from over 26 years ago? That’s high on testicular fortitude and as dumb as fidget spinners. Yet, when  that band is the Jesus Lizard, everything in your pathetic cultural dystopia suddenly falls  away and the air smells like Heaven… Their seventh studio album, Rack, produced by 
Paul Allen, and slated for release on September 13 via Ipecac Recordings, features 11  tracks of brisk guitar rock you haven’t heard since… the last time the Jesus Lizard took  over a stage in your town. The Jesus Lizard — vocalist David Yow, guitarist Duane 
Denison, bassist David Wm. Sims, and drummer Mac McNeilly — have returned with a  record teeming with the kind of madness needed to beat down today’s AOR mediocrity and piss-perfect pop drivel alike. 

Since their inception in Chicago in 1987, the Jesus Lizard has thrilled audiences all over  the planet. The impeccable rocket-thrust rhythm section of Sims and McNeilly was the  perfect launchpad for Denison’s jagged yet clean-toned riffing and Yow’s mercurial 
vocalizations manifesting as everything from panicked citizen, reality escapee or  wounded sea mammal. The Jesus Lizard’s fury carried on through six studio albums,  two live recordings and a brace of singles and EPs. 

On Rack, the Jesus Lizard have returned reconstituted, refreshed and positively  revving. No tepid, bland tracks to show how they’ve “matured” as songwriters. No inane  detours into unnecessary genre exercises. And definitely no weird moves into 
experimental realms that come off just as contrived and calculated as the top of the  Billboard Charts. The opening salvo “Hide & Seek” finds Yow singing/sprechstimming  his way with remarkable clarity as his bandmates shore him up with their patented 
acceleration. The noir vibes coming off of “What If?” is a startling direction for the band,  with Yow narrating the action, like he was looking at a random person in an airport  lounge and concocting an elaborate backstory about them. The sinister “Alexis Feels 
Sick” is inspired by Girls Against Boys/Soulside drummer Alexis Fleisig’s guarded  opinion of modern life that turns into a treatise of man’s inhumanity to man. “Moto(R)” is  playing out of the coolest car tailgating in the parking lot at one of those horrific radio
rock fests. And while we’re on the subject of forcing cool into uncool, “Falling Down”  reminds all of us in slightly under three-and-a-half minutes how marvelously badassed  the Jesus Lizard have always been, making our fists ball-up so tightly they look like the ends of chicken bones. 

The Jesus Lizard. They might not be young, but they will never, ever get fucking old.

San Fran holds a Supervised License, meaning minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue. Minors are of course not allowed to purchase alcohol under any circumstance.

events.id: Yoko–Zuna: A Live Tribute to KAYTRANADA tickets-Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand-Ticketek
events.name: Yoko–Zuna: A Live Tribute to KAYTRANADA tickets
events.venue: Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
This October, Aotearoa electronic/progressive hip-hop powerhouse Yoko-Zuna will make their long anticipated return to Pōneke, presenting the music of KAYTRANADA in the city's magnificent Meow NUI. Over the past decade Yoko-Zuna have firmly established themselves as one of the country’s most exciting live acts and a favourite on the festival circuit. Just back from a world tour with hip-hop multihyphenate CHAII, the four piece made up of Swap Gomez, J.Y Lee, Kenji Iwamitsu-Holdaway, & Frank Eliesa once again join forces to perform their live tribute to a genre-defying beat wizard.
Louis Kevin Celestin aka KAYTRANADA is a Haitian-Canadian record producer and DJ. He first made waves in 2010 with a steady stream of mixtapes, remixes, and original tracks released under the name Kaytradamus. By 2013, reintroducing himself as KAYTRANADA, he was turning heads across the global music scene. The momentum only grew—by 2014, he landed a deal with the influential label XL Recordings. In 2016, he dropped his debut studio album, 99.9%, which was met with widespread critical acclaim. 2019’s Bubba—a genre-blurring triumph earned him two Grammy Awards, including Best Dance/Electronic Album, solidifying his place as one of the most innovative voices in contemporary music.

events.name: Ryan Adams
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
Celebrating the 25th anniversary of his breakthrough debut album ‘Heartbreaker,’ multi-Grammy-nominated singer-songwriter Ryan Adams is set to embark on his ‘Heartbreaker’ tour. He will bring the album and more to audiences across Australia and New Zealand in October 2025. Known for his genre-defying sound, Ryan will deliver an intimate, acoustic set that showcases his expansive catalogue. 
Since its release in 2000, ‘Heartbreaker’ has become a cornerstone of Ryan Adams’ career, featuring tracks such as Oh My Sweet Carolina, Come Pick Me Up, and To Be Young (Is to Be Sad, Is to Be High). This tour offers a chance to experience these songs live.

events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Crochet - Christmas Special!
Join Monique in this half-day crochet workshop where you will learn how to crochet a range of little projects suitable for the holiday season.  Choose from stars, icicles, mini wreaths and Christmas jumpers, Christmas trees and a mini Santa hat!   There will be a booklet of patterns for you to take home, to enable you to complete in your own time the projects that you didn’t have time to make during the workshop.
  You will also learn how to crochet and decorate Christmas baubles!  While you might not finish all the patterns this day, the aim is to have a go at making as many as possible!
  You will need to know some basic crochet stitches such as single and double crochet. You’ll also need to have some understanding of how to read a pattern and work with diagrams, as taught in the beginners’ crochet course.
  Please bring yarn that you enjoy working with (cotton, acrylic or wool, 4ply or 8 ply) in a variety of colours (red, white and green, a neutral colour for the mouse, and glittery yarns are all good options for the Christmas projects) and a matching crochet hook. You’ll also need a pair of scissors and a darning needle.

The skills you will practice may be applied to presentations, interviews, appraisals, business meetings, networking, performing on stage and more. Prepare yourself to deliver your best self under pressure. Discover the art of being seen and heard.
 Learn how to banish stage fright and performance anxiety. Communicate from a place of confidence and energy. Hold the room and speak with authority. Come across authentically, with maximum personal impact.
In this masterclass we will work with the fundamental toolkit of each person’s body, breath, voice and mindset to increase communicative power, gravitas and influence. You will leave with the skills to master any kind of performance you need to give.
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to:
-  Understand how your physical, mental and vocal habits help you or hinder your effectiveness
-  Practice simple repeatable exercises that will transform your capacity to make a powerful entrance
-  Learn how to manage nerves, take up space and land your message with impact.

events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Harakeke (Flax Weaving) Workshop
Gain an introduction to the Māori art of flax weaving in an intensive one-day workshop, suitable for beginners and those with some experience.   
By the end of the workshop, you'll be able to:
•  Identify commonly-used types of harakeke
•  Describe how to harvest and prepare harakeke for use 
•  Describe the tikanga (the protocol) surrounding the use of harakeke and weaving 
•  Demonstrate some basic weaving techniques  
•  Construct and complete a small project 
Materials provided but please bring a 'bread and butter' knife and 8 spring-loaded clothes pegs. Tea and coffee provided but please bring your lunch.

events.id: Posture Perfection is Possible!-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Posture Perfection is Possible!
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Posture Perfection is Possible!
Are you a computer slouch, feeling stiff and tense at work? Do you find it difficult to maintain a good posture?  Does your posture cause back, neck or shoulder tension?  Would you like to enjoy more freedom in everyday activities?
Under the guidance of an experienced teacher, we'll explore movement in ways that help you reduce tense unhelpful habits.  Movement lessons are done on the floor or sitting on a chair and are based on the pioneering work of Israeli physicist and engineer Dr. Moshe Feldenkrais.
This workshop is suitable for all ages (over 16) and fitness levels.
By the end of the workshop, you'll be able to:
• Identify and reduce muscle tension
• Move with more lightness and freedom
• Improve your posture
• Describe some basic anatomy
• Have tools to use at home and at work
Bring two blankets (or a mat and a blanket) and wear loose, warm and comfortable clothing. Tea and coffee provided but bring your lunch. Please note that instructions are given verbally rather than by demonstration, so good hearing and understanding of English is required.
Feel free to contact the tutor, Sue Field on 027 466 7123, if you have any questions. 
Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

events.name: Comfy Concert 7 at The Long Hall - The Chamber Pot Pourri Ensemble performance for Arohanui Strings+
events.venue: 13 Maida Vale Road, Roseneath, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
🎵 Join us for an afternoon of beautiful music and community spirit! 🎵
Enjoy Beautiful Chamber Music with a View! Relax with a cuppa and a biscuit (koha appreciated!) while listening to expertly curated chamber music featuring Helene, Rolf, and top musicians at an intimate venue in one of Wellington’s most stunning locations.
Helene Pohl (violin) and Rolf Gjelsten (cello), as the Chamber Pot Pourri Ensemble, are getting together with friends to play a series of intimate concerts that support some of their favourite causes – Arohanui Strings+ included (www.arohanuistrings.org).
Comfy Concert No.7 with Simeon Broom (violin) and Nicholas Hancox (viola) on 18 October, 2025, playing:
JS Bach - Suite No. 3 in C Major for cello solo
Dmitri Shostakovich – Quartet No. 5
Dmitri Shostakovich – Quartet No. 2
🎻 (programmes and artists may change - but hopefully not!)
The Comfy Concert series 2
Building on the success of the first series of Comfy Concerts from April to June, Helen and Rolf have announced another four concerts to benefit Kaibosh (Saturday 20 September & Saturday 15 November) and Arohanui Strings+ (Saturday 20 August & Saturday 18 November). 
Thank you to Helene, Rolf and musicians of The Chamber Pot Pourri Ensemble, for generously donating time and talent in support Arohanui Strings+ and Kaibosh!
Learn more about these charities: arohanuistrings.org and kaibosh.org.nz
Location
The Long Hall overlooks Point Jerningham with views of Te Whanganui-a-Tara/Wellington Harbour. See the Google map location. You can park on Maida Vale Rd or on Roseneath School tennis court and follow the signs. Or on foot or bike, use the footpath up from Carlton Gore Road or from Maida Vale Road near Roseneath School.
BYO cushion is advised.
It's going to be a wonderful afternoon of fabulous music, while raising funds for two fabulous charities.
Rolf Gjelsten (cello), Helene Pohl (violin)
