events.venue: 2 Queens Drive, Hutt Central, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand
events.description:
PRESENTED BY NIGHTINGALE CONCERTS - JOIN US FOR AN EVENING OF LIVE MUSIC AT IT'S FINEST! 
The young virtuoso recently described as “the finest guitar player of this generation” has spent the past few years selling out shows all over the globe and will be bringing his dynamite live act back to New Zealand in 2025 for a series of intimate regional concerts!
Seated show
Family friendly  
Cheaper $15 tickets for under 18s because live music is for everyone!
October 18, 2025 @ The Little Theatre, Lower Hut
Doors open from 7:00pm / show starts at 7:30pm (8:50pm finish) 
Tickets are VERY limited. DON'T miss out!
WHAT THE PRESS SAY..
“The word Prodigy seems to entirely fall short of this soft-spoken young man’s skills, he coaxes sounds and melodies out of his instrument that literally drop jaws.”
The Calgary Herald, CANADA

“Today I saw the future of Folk – Festival goers flocking in the thousands towards the main stage to witness a young musical phenomenon from Australia dish out an absolute show-stopper.” The Firefly Column, USA

“Daniel Champagne is a crossroads. Fusing the strong traditions of Blues, Folk and other roots art with pop showmanship and admirable lyrical ability. I firmly believe that he will become an ambassador for roots music in a time where it desperately needs representation.” The Indie Blender, CANADA

“reinventing roots guitar” Rhythms Magazine, AUSTRALIA“Watching Daniel Champagne perform is a once in a lifetime experience. He is a true prodigy that plays like no one else could possibly play unless they spent at least two lifetimes studying the art.” BW Review, NEW ZEALAND

“Daniel Champagne exudes a natural ease on stage, as he sings poignant lyrics and beautifully crafted melodies that invariably whisk the heart up with grand romanticism. Coupled with an exhilarating guitar talent that transcends mere acoustic playing to replicate a whole band, Champagne is just magical” Themusic.com.au, AUSTRALIA

"You feel as if he just invented the instrument yesterday and was discovering its possibilities afresh” Ted Gioia (American jazz critic and music historian)

events.name: Freak Slug
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.description:
Manchester based musician Freak Slug - the project of Xenya Genovese - will be welcoming audiences in Pōneke Wellington and Tāmaki Makaurau Auckland into her dreamy indie-pop world this October.

 

LIVE NATION PRESALE: To access Live Nation presale tickets, create a free account. When presale begins, log in and click "Buy Tickets". No code needed.

 

ACCESSIBILITY: All accessible tickets need to be purchased directly by the ticketing agent’s accessible hotline or form. Have further accessible queries? Email us at accessibility.aunz@livenation.com.au.

events.id: Freak Slug | Wellington-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Freak Slug | Wellington
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.description:
TĀMAKI MAKAURAU AUCKLAND, NEW ZEALAND (Jul 9, 2025) – Manchester based musician Freak Slug - the project of Xenya Genovese - will be welcoming audiences in Pōneke Wellington and Tāmaki Makaurau Auckland into her dreamy indie-pop world this October. Freak Slug performs at San Fran on October 20th and The Tuning Fork on October 21st with her Big Candles tour. 

Tickets will be available to purchase by the General Public on Friday 11 July at 10:00am local time.

My Live Nation members will also be able to secure tickets during the presale which commences Thursday 10th July from 10:00am local time. Fans can register for access at livenation.co.nz. 

The name ‘Freak Slug’ encapsulates Xenya’s artistic world perversely and perfectly. Known for following the beat of her own drum, Xenya’s releases under the name Freak Slug so far include debut 2020 EP Videos and its viral hit Radio (23 million streams and counting), and follow-up EPs I’m In Love (2022) and Viva La Vulva (2023). Having shown listeners her more “summery, happy sound”, she then delivered a more grungy-feel with debut album I Blow Out Big Candles, furthermore pushing the diversity of her sound. 

Hugely influenced by ‘90s cult heroes including Ride, Mazzy Star and Stephen Malkmus, Freak Slug is all about hitting a mood. Everything that fuels her creative output is raw, authentic, sometimes weird, but always totally true self-expression. I Blow Out Big Candles is a strong statement of all of this and more. Down there, picking through the curious mix of sounds and feelings, from nostalgic, ‘90s-influenced and dreamy as well as eccentric and experimental, lives Freak Slug. The 10-track project gives listeners a taste of what they will be in for at her Aotearoa shows, a journey of both soft soulfulness and sonic songwriting, all laid out on the table. 

I Blow Out Big Candles is as fearless a record as Xenya herself and was met with features and reviews throughout some of the most prestigious radio and media platforms in the United Kingdom. With her 4 piece band, Freak Slug has performed at SXSW Austin – and was the most searched UK artist at the 2025 edition - alongside many other showcases and festivals. Earlier this year Freak Slug completed her Big Candles tour of the US, CA, UK and EU taking in 40 cities including sold out dates in LA, Chicago, Seattle, London, Paris and Amsterdam, she also has a busy summer of festivals festival with a headline slot on the alcove stage at Latitude.

events.venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
It’ll be easy like a Sunday morning to enjoy this group live. For the first time since 1977, Commodores return to New Zealand. Their Greatest Hits Tour is sure to thrill lovers of the Motown sound. Formed in 1968, Commodores have sold over 75 million records worldwide. It’s no wonder when you look at some of their famous songs. The concert is sure to include classic hits like Easy, Nightshift, Three Times a Lady, Brick House, Sail On, and many more. 
Commodores are one of the greatest Motown and R&B/funk artists of all time. For five decades, they have remained a force in the music industry. They have earned five number-one albums, 20 top-ten singles, and 15 top-ten albums. Get ready for a night of grooving when the legends come to Wellington.
Note: Ronald LaPread will not be appearing in this show.

events.id: Co:Lab 2025 - New Zealand's Lab Sector Forum-4 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Co:Lab 2025 - New Zealand's Lab Sector Forum
events.venue: 4 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
You're invited to New Zealand's Lab Sector Forum - Co:Lab 2025
Brought to you by the Awanui Group 

CoLab 2025 will bring together industry leaders, healthcare professionals, and experts to share strategies, case studies, and present interesting perspectives on the future of the roll of pathology laboratories in healthcare.

Co:Lab 2025 is delivered across two thought-provoking days with presentations from thought-leaders from both within and outside the sector. This event is designed to get the lab network together, face-to-face, so all our speakers are delivering presentations in-person.
This year's theme is Pathology in Partnership: Strengthening Collaboration Across Healthcare. With an increasing need for an interconnected health sector, the role of pathology laboratories extends beyond diagnostics - acting as a vital link between various healthcare disciplines.
This year, we will explore how enhanced partnerships and new and interesting collaborations can drive improved patient outcomes, from primary care to cutting-edge specialties. We’ll explore how laboratories could evolve to support integrated care models, leverage emerging technologies, and foster data-driven insights that empower clinicians and patients alike.
As usual, this forum offers plenty of opportunities for networking and discussion with the sector.
TICKETS

- Early Bird: $479 + GST get in early before the programme is announced to secure $90 off your ticket. Admission to all sessions, catering and the evening networking and dinner function.
- General: $569 + GST admission to all sessions, catering and the evening networking and dinner function.

events.id: Coal Miner’s Daughter-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Coal Miner’s Daughter
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
American country music singer and songwriter Loretta Lynn had a career spanning six decades. Her incredible life is celebrated in ‘Coal Miner’s Daughter’ at The Opera House in October. Audiences will be captivated by brilliant storytelling and performances. 
Follow Loretta Lynn’s life from her early days in the hills of Kentucky to a tempestuous marriage, and massive music-world success. During her career, she nurtured enduring bonds with country and western stars. Among her friends were artists Patsy Cline, Conway Twitty, Tammy Wynette, Dolly Parton, and Willie Nelson. The performance will include songs from many of these icons. Hear I Fall To Pieces, You Ain’t Woman Enough To Take My Man, Crazy, Walkin’ After Midnight, Stand By Your Man, After The Fire Is Gone, and more. 
Loretta Lynn was known for her bedazzled floor length gowns, and gravity-defying hair. Amber Joy Poulton, the singer playing her on stage, is sure to do her extravagant style justice. Joining her are Lizzie Moore (as Patsy Cline) and Denis Surmon (as Conway Twitty and Willie Nelson) along with band The Holy Men.

events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.description:
DOORS OPEN 7:00pm | SHOW START 8:00pm

Join Award winning Kiwi Comedian Paul Douglas for his latest hour “Could be keen!” Keen for what? Well anything really. He’s just gotta be a bit more cautious these days, hence the ‘Could’.
You don’t have to completely stop having fun as you get older, you just need to start being cautiously keen and Paul’s here to show you how it’s done. Come find out how Paul navigates life as someone who wants to live fast but can’t quite keep up.

As seen on 7 Days, Comedy Gala and Guy Mont Spelling Bee
“Just a dude with a microphone being incredibly funny” - Libel
“There are many ways to enjoy laughter and pleasure as a human, one of the easiest is watching Paul Douglas” - Dai Henwood 


San Fran holds a Supervised License. Minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue.

events.name: Stardew Valley — Symphony of Seasons
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
The role-playing video game Stardew Valley has amassed a huge following since its creation in 2016. Now you can hear the music from the soundtrack played live by an orchestra. ‘Stardew Valley — Symphony of Seasons’ is a musical journey through many of the cherished songs that populate the video game’s soundscape. While a 35-piece orchestra brings the music to life, a screen above the stage will play footage from the game. Fans will be treated to original content exclusive to this concert. 
Stardew Valley is a farm life simulation role-playing video game. Players take the role of a character who inherits their deceased grandfather’s dilapidated farm. Gamers watch their farm grow throughout the seasons and explore some of the valley’s locations. The music in the concert will transport you to some of those locations. Visit Pelican Town to the Skull Cavern, Ginger Island to Calico Desert, the Wizard’s Tower and more.

events.id: EMDRNZ Conference 2025-55 Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: EMDRNZ Conference 2025
events.venue: 55 Cable Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
EMDRNZ Conference 2024
Tuesday 28 October 2025 - Thursday 30 October 2025 | Wellington/Online
Prerequisite: completion of EMDR Basic Training Part 1

Conference Key Dates:
Consultants Day - Tuesday 28 October 2025 (this event is only available to Case Consultants and Consultants in Training)
Dr Roger Solomon's Workshop - EMDR Therapy Treatment for Grief and Mourning Transforming the Connection to the Deceased Loved One - Wednesday 29 October 2025
Conference Day - Thursday 30 October 2025, that will include Dr Roger Solomon’s key note address "The art of EMDR", including video examples.
Exclusive member rate is available to EMDRNZ and EMDRAA members as well as for those that are members of ISSTD attending the ISSTD Conference AND have completed part 1 of EMDR training.
This year EMDRNZ have dovetailed with the ISSTD (International Society for the Study of Trauma and Dissociation) Conference: Hidden in Plain Sight: The Identification and Treatment of Complex Trauma and Dissociation which will run straight after from Friday through Sunday, 31 October - 2 November. Featuring Plenary Presenters:  Julian D. Ford, Jill Hill and D. Michael Coy.

ISSTD is offering a $50 discount to all EMDRNZ members who are registered for the EMDRNZ Conference on registration for the ISSTD event (please email Indra on info@emdr.org.nz for discount code after you have registered for the EMDRNZ Conference).

Take advantage of our Early Bird Discount!
This year we are offering a special Early Bird rate for those attending both Dr Roger Solomon’s Workshop and the Conference Day. To receive the discounted fee, please make sure to select the Special Early Bird Fee Package during registration. Early Bird Discount is valid until 30th September.
All in person registrations are open until 10th October (or will be closing sooner if fully booked!) and online registrations until 28th October.

Both days will be recorded and available for viewing for a limited time after the Conference. Electronic access will NOT be offered following the close of registrations.

For more information please email to info@emdr.org.nz

events.id: UpliftED: Empowering Educators | Strengthening the Profession | Shaping the Future-Wallace Street, Mount Cook, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: UpliftED: Empowering Educators | Strengthening the Profession | Shaping the Future
events.venue: Wallace Street, Mount Cook, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
events.description:
The UpliftEd Conference is an energising and thought-provoking event designed for educators who are passionate about their profession and the future of education in Aotearoa. Hosted by the Aotearoa Educators' Collective, this conference brings together leading thinkers, researchers, and practitioners to explore what it truly means to uplift and empower teachers.
Expect inspiring keynotes, engaging panel discussions, and opportunities to connect with fellow educators who share your vision for the future of teaching and learning.
Thursday 30 October – Keynote Speakers & Discussions
Opening Keynote: Professor Guy Claxton
Renowned education thinker Guy Claxton will deliver a one-hour keynote, setting the stage for two days of deep thinking and discussion.
Other featured speakers include*:
Professor Peter O’Connor 
Professor Russell Bishop
Dr Simon McCallum 
Dr Hana O'Regan
Dr. Julia Atkin
Janelle Riki-Waaka 
Dr. Michael Johnston
Sitting Members of Parliament Panel
*More speakers to be announced soon. 
Key Themes:
Uplifting the Profession – Trusting teachers and celebrating their expertise
Silver Linings – Finding optimism and opportunity in education
Empowering Educators – Strengthening teacher agency and professionalism
Diversity in Education – Ensuring equity and inclusion
Te Tiriti o Waitangi – Honouring Te Tiriti and its foundational place in education
Future-Focused Learning – Looking ahead to innovative, evidence-informed approaches rather than returning to outdated models
What is the Purpose of School? – A critical exploration of education’s role
Friday 31 October – Unconference & Special Interest Groups
Building on the ideas and challenges presented by speakers, Friday will be a dynamic, participant-driven day where educators engage in deeper discussion and action planning.
Unconference Sessions – Attendees will propose and lead discussions around key themes, sharing insights and strategies in an informal, collaborative environment.
Special Interest Groups – Spaces for educators to connect around shared areas of passion, from Te Tiriti-based education to innovative assessment practices.
Networking Opportunities – Create meaningful connections with educators, researchers, and advocates from across Aotearoa.
Who Should Attend?
Teachers at all levels, from ECE to secondary
School leaders and policymakers
Researchers and academics
Education advocates and community leaders
Early Bird Registration
Take advantage of our early bird discount – register by 28 April 2025 to secure your spot at a reduced rate.  All tickets include access to both days of the conference and catering.

events.id: New Zealand Cricket Home International Season--Wellington NZ
events.name: New Zealand Cricket Home International Season
events.description:
It looks like New Zealand Cricket (NZC) has slogged it for six. The 2025-26 international home season of cricket promises an exciting 46 days of action across the country. Wellington has scored six major opportunities to see the BLACKCAPS and WHITE FERNS in action. Four formidable opponents are travelling to New Zealand shores. Australia, England, West Indies, and South Africa will compete across multiple formats. The live T20I action at Sky Stadium and Test matches at Cello Basin Reserve will have Wellington buzzing.
The 2024-25 season saw bumper crowds, so NZC are hoping to build on this exciting momentum. As rising WHITE FERNS star Georgia Plimmer says, “The atmosphere in Wellington — sitting on the bank, having a drink and watching some great cricket — that’s what you want on a summer’s day in New Zealand.”

events.id: The Saints-Meow Nui, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: The Saints
events.venue: Meow Nui, Wellington
events.description:
The Saints ’73-’78 announce their New Zealand debut this spring, with concerts at The Powerstation in Auckland on 31 October and Meow Nui in Wellington on 1 November, before they head north to the UK and US.

The Plus1 24-hour presale begins 9am Tuesday 25th February at plus1.co.nz

Tickets are on general sale at plus1.co.nz from 9am Wednesday 26th February.

Feel and Plus1 proudly present the band’s New Zealand tour which follows their hugely successful Australian tour in 2024 to crowds of 12,000 people across 12 shows.

Featuring founding Saints members, guitarist Ed Kuepper and drummer Ivor Hay alongside honorary Saints; singer Mark Arm of Seattle rockers Mudhoney, former The Birthday Party / Bad Seeds guitarist Mick Harvey and bassist Peter Oxley of Australia’s legendary Sunnyboys.

The Saints 73-78 carry on where the original band left off in 1978 performing the material from their three incendiary albums (I’m) Stranded (1977), Eternally Yours (1978) and Prehistoric Sounds (1978).

“The Saints first three albums rank among the best records ever made. They have been a part of my life since stumbling upon them in the early 80s. Their influence looms large in Mudhoney world. I am stoked, stunned, and humbled that I get to joi in on this Rock ‘n’ Roll Reality Camp with Ed, Ivor, Peter and Mick!”– Mark Arm

The tour also comes off the back of arecent 4 LP box set of 1977’s ground breaking debut (I’m) Stranded which features the original album remastered forvinyl for the first time in over 40 years, the previously unreleased 1976 mix of the album, a 5-song live performance from April 1977 at Sydney’s Paddington Town Hall, a full live show from the London’s Hope and Anchor in November 1977 plus all recordings from the 1977 Top 40 charting This Perfect Day and 1-2-3-4 ep sessions.

Note: You'll be working on pre-cut, supplied sampling pieces - you do not make a pair of trousers in this course.

events.name: Kaylee Bell — Cowboy Up Tour
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
Wellington will be getting its ‘yeehaw’ on for a much-anticipated concert this November. New Zealand country-pop force Kaylee Bell rides into town to set up at the Michael Fowler Centre. Fans can expect a full-throttle live show featuring hits from her three studio albums, the most recent being ‘Nights Like This’ released in 2023. Have a listen out for viral, banjo-infused hits like Cowboy Up, Red Dirt Romeo, Boots N’ All, and Good Things.
As part of a five-city tour of the country this is her biggest headline show to date. It comes off the back of a whirlwind 18 months that’s seen Kaylee cement her place as one of Australasia’s leading country artists. She won Best Female Artist at the 2024 Golden Guitar Awards and Global Country Music Artist at the 2023 CMA awards. Kaylee has carved out a career that bridges Nashville polish with Kiwi grit. This concert promises to be her boldest and most exciting yet.

events.id: An Evening with Cowboy Junkies-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: An Evening with Cowboy Junkies
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
Canadian band Cowboy Junkies returns to Wellington with its special mix of alternative country and folk-rock. Formed in 1985 when a lot of music was flashy and loud, the Canadian band has stayed their gentle course with whisper-close vocals and subtle instrumentation. Cowboy Junkies prove that there continues to be an audience waiting for something quiet, beautiful, and reflective. 
Cowboy Junkies will perform a range of songs from their four decades and 29 albums. Expect to hear hits from their 1988 multiplatinum album ‘The Trinity’ and the acclaimed 2023 album ‘Such Ferocious Beauty’. The band of four comprises siblings — Margo, Michael, and Pete Timmins, and bassist Alan Anton. This long-lasting group has never had a breakup or hiatus. It’s a testament to the appreciation they have for each other and their dedication to creating beautiful music.

events.id: Cowboy Junkies - Celebrating 40 Years-The Opera House, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: Cowboy Junkies - Celebrating 40 Years
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington
events.description:
Cowboy Junkies will be performing a career-spanning show from The Trinity Session to their recent album, Such Ferocious Beauty!

Tour Dates
Tuesday 4th November – Town Hall, Auckland
Thursday 6th November – Opera House, Wellington
Friday 7th November – Regent Theatre, Palmerston North
Sunday 9th November – Isaac Theatre, Christchurch
Tuesday 11th November – Fortitude Music Hall, Brisbane
Thursday 13th November – Civic Theatre, Newcastle
Friday 14th November – State Theatre, Sydney
Tuesday 18th November – Astor Theatre, Perth
Thursday 20th November – Woodville Town Hall, Adelaide
Sunday 23rd November – Palais Theatre, Melbourne

About Cowboy Junkies

Sometimes revolutions begin quietly.

In 1988, Cowboy Junkies proved that there was an audience waiting for something quiet, beautiful and reflective. The Trinity Session was like a whisper that cut through the noise — and it was compelling. It stood out in the midst of the flash and bombast that came to define the late 80’s. The now classic recording combined folk, blues and rock in a way that had never been heard before and went on to sell more than a million copies.

events.id: No Cigar tickets-Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand-Ticketek
events.name: No Cigar tickets
events.venue: Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
Presented by: Eccles Entertainment
Breakout Aotearoa five-piece NO CIGAR have announced a three-date tour across New Zealand this November, in celebration of their highly anticipated third studio album Under the Surface, due for release July 30th.
Since forming in 2019, NO CIGAR have built a fiercely loyal fanbase across Aotearoa and beyond, carving out a unique niche that blends elements of indie, surf, and alternative rock. Their upcoming album is crafted for the stage — shaped by the band’s dynamic chemistry and a deep connection with their audience.
NO CIGAR’s 2023 sophomore album The Great Escape spent more than 74 consecutive weeks on the NZ Top 20 Albums Chart and featured the breakout hit “Concubine,” voted the 10th best rock song of 2024 by listeners of The Rock FM.
Their past tours across NZ, Australia and the UK have consistently sold out, driven by a word-of-mouth buzz and a reputation for electric, unforgettable performances. This tour will host their biggest headline shows on home soil to date and are not to be missed!

events.id: Tina: The Ultimate Tribute to the Queen of Rock ‘n’ Roll-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Tina: The Ultimate Tribute to the Queen of Rock ‘n’ Roll
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
Her distinctive husky delivery captivated audiences from the 60s through to the 90s. Tina Turner is a rock and roll icon. She had a string of hits across four decades and was renowned for high-octane stage shows. In ‘Tina: The Ultimate Tribute to the Queen of Rock ‘n’ Roll’, you’ll hear all her energetic rock and rhythm and blues hits. Listen to Simply The Best, What’s Love Got To Do With It, River Deep Mountain High, Proud Mary, We Don’t Need Another Hero, Private Dancer, It Takes Two, and many more. You’ll see why Tina became one of the 20th century’s biggest names in music. 
South African Caroline Borole will pick up the microphone to pay homage to Tina Turner. She has previously been seen on ‘South African Idols’. Joining her on stage will be a band with a wild brass section. There’ll also be backing vocalists and dancers to make this simply the best tribute to the Queen of Rock ‘n’ Roll.

events.id: CNA Members’ Hui: Forward, Stronger!-1 Whitmore Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: CNA Members’ Hui: Forward, Stronger!
events.venue: 1 Whitmore Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Hui2025 marks CNA’s 50th year as an important sector organisation and resource for Aotearoa/New Zealand.
In the last three years, our membership has grown, not only in numbers but also in the range of kaupapa and services that you provide all across the Motu. We are proud to be your umbrella organisation and continue to provide information, representation, and support.
This celebratory networking event is aimed at ensuring your organisation lasts as long as we have. Yes, that is a brag!
Sessions include practicable ideas on ‘Getting the Dosh – Ensuring Financial Health’; ‘Wicked Solutions for Wicked Problems’; and ‘Collaborating Beyond the Usual’.

Presenters and panellists include:
Poto Williams - Former Minister for the Community and Voluntary Sector Minister for Disability Issues
Holly Snape - Chief Executive, Community Waikato
Murray Edridge - City Missioner at The Wellington City Mission
Belinda Gorman - Partnership & collaboration facilitator, trainer, coach
Ros Rice - Executive Officer, Community Networks Aotearoa
Barry Baker - NFP and Membership organisations Specialist at Grant Thornton New Zealand
Sadly, this is the last CNA Members’ Hui without a registration fee. As finances tighten, this will be the last FREE Hui for CNA. In the past we've been in a unique position to value our members by providing the Hui for free. 2027 will see the introduction of a registration fee.
🎂 WE’RE 50! 🎂
CNA started life as NZCOSS, which was formed as a national social service umbrella organisation on 10th November 1975 by signed order from the Minister of Social Welfare, Norman King, under the Department of Social Welfare Act 1971.
Since then, we’ve changed our name but continued to provide substantial resources, reports, and representation to the sector and at the government level.
We’ve taken on banks, the State of the Sector Report, Select Committees, and more in order to lessen pain points and provide easier ways forward.
Come celebrate with us at our Members’ Hui – meet some old faces, and some even older faces. A blast from the past as we start our next half century. Time for cake and some bubbles.
Need financial help to attend our LAST FREE Hui?
CNA has a Membership Support Fund that can help. Specifically aimed at Tier 4 and 3 members, please contact Ros at eo@communitynetworksaotearoa.org.nz for more details. Applications close Saturday 31st of May.
Current financial members and guests of CNA are able to attend this event.

Introducing the PDC ANZ Premier League 2025!
Get ready for the biggest darts tournament Australia and New Zealand have ever seen! This October and November, the PDC ANZ Premier League will take over eight iconic arenas, bringing the ultimate darts showdown to fans across the region.
Eight elite players from the Australian and New Zealand circuits will battle it out over eight electrifying Saturdays, competing not just for glory, but for a coveted spot in the 2025/26 World Darts Championship, London.
Kicking off in Cairns to arenas in Newcastle, Adelaide, Canberra, Hobart, Wellington and Brisbane, this tour will bring sport’s biggest party to cities across the Tasman.
This is your chance to dress up, grab your mates and witness world-class darts action LIVE, as the sport’s top talents in Australia and New Zealand light up the oche in a pulsating atmosphere like no other.
It’s darts, its drama, it’s PDC ANZ Premier League 2025 – Are you ready to play?

events.id: Professional Darts Corporation ANZ Premier League-TSB Arena, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Professional Darts Corporation ANZ Premier League
events.venue: TSB Arena, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
It’s a bullseye for lovers of darts. A new Australasian competition will stop off at Wellington’s TSB Arena in November 2025. You’ll be able to watch as darts players aim for glory. The Professional Darts Corporation (PDC) ANZ Premier League acts as a springboard into the 2025/26 World Darts Championship. There are eight positions open to New Zealanders and Australians. The eventual champion heads off to a place in the global competition. 
PDC chief executive Matt Porter describes the new competition as a huge boost for professional darts in the region. “The PDC ANZ Premier League is an exciting moment for us,” he says. “We want to encourage the next generation of stars to emulate the likes of Simon Whitlock, Damon Heta, and Haupai Puha.” Simon Whitlock, known as ‘The Wizard’, has confirmed his return to the big stage for the Wellington show. The European Champion and World Cup of Darts winner will be joined by the famous English darts referee Russ ‘The Voice’ Bray.  They’re both ready to light up the TSB Arena.

Bob Ross Landscape Painting Workshop
If you don’t already know who Bob Ross is then Google him, and you will be amazed at how he creates fantastic paintings using simple tools.  You can too! 
Please wear old clothes and bring your lunch.  You'll go home with an oil painting completed 100% by yourself.
All materials are included in course fee –  a 16x20 inch professional canvas, Bob Ross oil paints, brushes, and all equipment, as seen on NZ TV and YouTube.

events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Cheesemaking - Farmhouse Cheddar Cheese Workshop
During this hands-on workshop, you’ll be guided through each step of the cheesemaking process while making your very own round of farmhouse style cheddar.
The fee includes a cheese press (value $95.00) which can be used every time you want to make a hard cheese. It holds up to 6 litres of milk and this is what you’ll be taking your cheese home in to press for 12 hours after the workshop. All ingredients, recipes and a full set of course notes are provided.
You’ll also receive comprehensive instruction on how to wax (if you choose to) and then mature your cheese over the next five weeks. Alexis will also demonstrate how to make halloumi cheese which will then be grilled for you to enjoy! There’ll be a short lunch break and cheese making supplies such as wax will be available to purchase.
By the end of the workshop, you’ll be able to:
• Describe the basics of sanitisation and hygiene
• Recognise the difference between raw and pasteurised milk and know where to source them
• Make a round of cheddar cheese using a cheese press
• Describe how to wax and mature the cheese
• Describe how to make halloumi, following a demonstration 
Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. Guns 2 Roses, the UK's most notorious Guns N' Roses tribute band established in 2002, is set to perform in New Zealand for the first time. They will play the classic GNR debut album Appetite For Destruction in its entirety top to bottom, along with a set of fan favourites.

“THE MOST NOTORIOUS GUNS N ROSES TRIBUTE IN HISTORY EST 2002 – THE ONLY GNR TRIBUTE TO PLAY LIVE WITH 4 DIFFERENT MEMBERS OF GUNS N ROSES! THEY HAVE PLAYED ALL THE TOP VENUES AND FESTIVALS IN THE UK – EUROPE – DUBAI – INDIA & USA. GUNS 2 ROSES ARE THE LONGEST RUNNING, CLOSEST LOOKING AND MOST INTERNATIONALLY RECOGNISED G’N’R TRIBUTE IN THE WORLD!”

events.id: Pub Choir — Average at Best-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Pub Choir — Average at Best
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
Sing out loud and sing out strong with a cast of eager strangers. Pub Choir takes the concept of ‘a bit of a sing-along’ to a whole new level. You don’t have to know how to sing to attend. In fact, creator Astrid Jorgensen assumes you’re not going to be the best or worst singer in the world. She wants all the average people to come, laugh, and learn a song en masse. Pub Choir has been running for eight years now, and Astrid regularly fills big venues with happy punters. Singing together creates an enticing sense of community. 
What will happen at the show? Astrid says it’s an entirely improvised, comedy music lesson, where you are the main attraction. “There’ll be no auditions and no homework. Just bring your voice and we’ll do the rest.” You’ll get taught one song in three-part harmony and have a lot of fun on the way. 
By purchasing a ticket, you are giving your consent to be filmed and photographed during this show.

events.id: Bill Bailey — Vaudevillean-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Bill Bailey — Vaudevillean
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
It’s a celebration of comedy, songs, and multifarious skills. Bill Bailey Vaudevillian is a wild ride through the lost art of vaudeville. Before streaming, before TV, before cinema, even before radio, there was vaudeville. 
A theatrical tradition invented mid-19th century in France, vaudeville was a type of variety show. It might have included popular and classical musicians, singers, dancers, magicians, ventriloquists, strongmen, impersonators, or clowns. 
British comedian Bill Bailey is familiar to Wellington audiences. He’s toured several popular stand-up shows to the Michael Fowler Centre. His latest will put his musical and humorous skills to the test. 
As a versatile musician and comedian, Bill is a modern-day vaudevillian. Come one, come all and experience his modern take on a classic tradition.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BvGE7HCJEtw&t=4s
Help and Healing on the Spiritual Path through the teaching of Bruno Groening - Medically Verifiable.
With the growing awareness of holistic medicine, the possibility for healing on the spiritual path is finding increasing attention, even in professional circles.
Bruno Groening (1906-1959) brought a simple message: there is a higher power that is the basis of all living things and it can heal. He showed how this energy can be absorbed freely into the body, and through his teaching many people were cured back then as today, even from diseases that are considered incurable.
Numerous medically documented success reports demonstrate the current effects of his teaching. These success reports have been proven and documented within the Medical Scientific Group – a world-wide forum of independent medical doctors, psychologists and health care professionals within the Bruno Groening Circle of Friends.
Our Information Lecture is open to all interested people. Feel free to invite friends or family who you think may benefit.

Quakers Meeting House, 7 Moncrieff Street, Mt Victoria, Wellington
Duration: 75 -90 minutes (approx.)
No fee. Donations are appreciated

events.description:
The star of popular 90s band Matchbox Twenty brings his first-ever solo tour to Wellington. Rob Thomas is a multi-platinum singer-songwriter. His All Night Days Tour celebrates his forthcoming sixth solo album ‘All Night Days’. It also coincides with the 20th anniversary of his acclaimed debut solo record ‘Something to Be’. Fans are in for a treat as artists of this calibre don’t often play intimate theatre settings. 
The tour promises to deliver the captivating live performances that Thomas is known for. Audiences can expect timeless hits including Lonely No More, This Is How A Heart Breaks, Her Diamonds, and Street Corner Symphony. He’ll also be performing new singles as well as Matchbox Twenty favourites like 3am and Unwell. “After such amazing Matchbox shows in 2024, it’s so great to revisit the solo catalogue, and I can’t wait to come back and share these songs with my Kiwi fans. It’s going to be a very special run of shows,” said Rob.

events.id: Self-Hypnosis - Hypnotise Yourself-Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington-Wellington High School
events.name: Self-Hypnosis - Hypnotise Yourself
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Self-Hypnosis - Hypnotise Yourself
Self-hypnosis is a fantastic self-development tool. It can also be used for controlling pain, accelerated healing, letting go of limiting behaviours and a number of other applications. This workshop will provide you with a good insight into the world of hypnosis, demystify it and dispel the myths that surround it.
You’ll learn a structured method of taking yourself into hypnosis (informed by scientific research), some of the classic applications of self-hypnosis and evidence-based skills that will convince you without doubt of your ability to hypnotise yourself.
By the end of the workshop, you’ll be able to:
• Define and discuss hypnosis
• Practice self-hypnosis
• Create and write hypnosis scripts for personal change
• Use the language of self-hypnosis
• Relax hypnotically to deep levels
Tea and coffee provided but bring your lunch, pen and paper.

events.name: Beekeeping - Next Step
events.venue: Wellington High School, 249 Taranaki Street, Te Aro, Wellington
events.description:
Beekeeping - Next Step
This is a practical and hands-on experience so bring your beekeeper’s outfit and your lunch. Please check your course instructions for more information on what you need to bring on the day.  The tutor can lend you a veil if you don't have one, please let the CEC office know a week before the course is due to run so this can be arranged.
The workshop starts in the classroom and is followed by a visit to a local apiary.  (Please note that you will working with live bees during the visit so there is a chance of being stung by one.)
If weather isn't suitable on the day, the morning session will still go ahead but the visit will be postponed to the next available Saturday.   Please note that if you can't make the catch-up visit, it's not possible to join in later courses due to number restrictions (a part-refund will be made). You must have done the Beginners' course first.
By the end of the workshop, you'll be able to:
• List the key steps in setting up a hive
• Describe how honey is extracted
• State what causes swarming and some ways of preventing it
• Describe what needs to be done to manage Varoa and American Foul Brood 
• Construct kitset frames for a honey super
• Open up and inspect a hive

events.description:
Cooking: Thai Home-Style
Thai cuisine and cooking has a key secret - the secret is that authentic Thai food balances key flavour elements. Combining sweet, salty, bitter, sour and spicy, Thai cuisine creates sumptuous and exciting flavour combinations. Come along to this half-day cooking course and learn to make some home-style Thai dishes.
Not suitable for vegetarians. All ingredients included in course fee, you just need to bring your apron, a couple of tea towels, a dishcloth and containers to take leftovers home in.
 By the end of the course, you’ll be able to:
Make some  Thai dishes at home with more confidence
Use ingredients/spices/herbs to match with dishes
Apply some aspects of the Thai eating style at home or when visiting Thailand
Note:  Our cooking courses are designed to provide a collaborative and immersive learning experience where learners often work in pairs and/or groups. While we wish to create an inclusive environment for all participants, it is important to note that our courses are unable to accommodate specific food allergies or deviate from the preplanned dishes and menus.

events.id: Rob Thomas - The All Night Days Tour-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: Rob Thomas - The All Night Days Tour
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington
events.description:
Multi-platinum singer-songwriter Rob Thomas today announced three nationwide New Zealand dates on his global The All Night Days Tour, celebrating his forthcoming sixth solo album All Night Days and the 20th anniversary of his acclaimed debut solo record …Something to Be.

The All Night Days Tour will travel to theatres this November, taking in Auckland’s Kiri Te Kanawa Theatre on Tuesday 11th, Te Pae Christchurch Convention Centre on Thursday 13th, before finishing up at Wellington’s Michael Fowler Centre on Saturday 15th.

Promoted in New Zealand by TEG Van Egmond, this highly anticipated tour marks Rob’s first New Zealand solo headline shows, and follows last year’s sold-out tour with Matchbox Twenty.

After such amazing Matchbox shows in 2024, it’s so great to revisit the solo catalogue, and I can't wait to come back and share these songs with my Kiwi fans. It’s going to be a very special run of shows, said Thomas.

Managing Director of TEG Van Egmond, Christo Van Egmond said “We’re absolutely thrilled to be bringing Rob Thomas back to New Zealand for this incredible run of shows. To see an artist of his calibre in intimate theatre settings is a rare treat, and it’s going to be a truly memorable experience for fans around the country.”

The upcoming tour promises to deliver the captivating live performances that Thomas is known for, and audiences can expect a night filled with timeless hits including “Lonely No More,” “This Is How A Heart Breaks,” “Her Diamonds,” “Street Corner Symphony,” the Grammy-winning Santana collaboration “Smooth,” as well as Matchbox Twenty favourites like “3AM” and “Unwell.” Rob will also perform his powerful new single “Hard To Be Happy,” giving fans a taste of All Night Days.

OTHER VOICES are a Christchurch based 4 piece post-punk and indie covers band.
Featuring Penny Cain on Vocals/guitar/keyboards, Linda Baran on Bass, Nick Ford on Guitar/keyboards and Wade Byers on Drums/samples.

One of the greatest hitmakers in British music history is heading to New Zealand shores for the first time in 12 years. Sir Cliff Richard has a string of chart-topping hits to his name. The pop legend will sing some of his biggest songs at Wellington’s Michael Fowler Centre. Now 84 years old, the ever-youthful icon has produced 14 number-one singles and seven number-one albums across a 66-year career. Fans will be treated to a setlist packed with timeless classics. Bop along to Living Doll, We Don’t Talk Anymore, Devil Woman, and plenty more. Known for his energy, charisma, and enduring stage presence, Cliff continues to capture hearts and inspire audiences.

events.id: Luke Kidgell — Good Intentions-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Luke Kidgell — Good Intentions
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
You’ve seen him on the internet, now it’s time to see him in real life. Luke Kidgell established a reputation as a social media star. His YouTube content and podcasts cemented his comedic credentials. He’s since turned his hand to live shows. Now, following a successful tour of the United States, Canada, Australia, and Europe, Luke is coming to Wellington. His brand-new show, Good Intentions, is set to make The Opera House giggle.   
Luke is known for his viral crowd-work interactions. These often lead to unusual, yet hilarious encounters. Despite not having much control over his impulsive thoughts, the Australian insists that deep down he means well. This year, he’s on a mission to prove that he really does have good intentions. 
In 2016, Luke went viral with his ‘You don’t own me’ videos. In these, he humorously disobeyed societal norms. His comedy fame has earned him over 600k followers on Instagram. He is also the host of the autobiographical podcast ‘Memoirs of a White Guy’.

Cooking: Singapore Nyonya Food
Create some classic mouth-watering and flavourful Nyonya dishes. Come and discover how to blend ingredients with distinct spices and cooking techniques. You can easily replicate these dishes at home.
Some ingredients supplied but a list of additional ingredients needed (approximate cost $35) will be sent out when course numbers are confirmed.
Please bring an apron, dish cloth, sharp knife, tea towels and containers to take food home.
Target audience: Adventurous food lovers!
NOTE: Nuts and gluten will be used in some recipes - this course is not suitable for vegetarians.
By the end of the course, you’ll have:
• Made a selection of Nyonya dishes to take home.
• Become more familiar with using the various spices.
• Understood more about the Nyonya cooking.
• Become more confident to cook Nyonya food at home.
Note:  Our cooking courses are designed to provide a collaborative and immersive learning experience where learners often work in pairs and/or groups. While we wish to create an inclusive environment for all participants, it is important to note that our courses are unable to accommodate specific food allergies or deviate from the preplanned dishes and menus.
Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

events.name: Ben Ottewell And Ian Ball By Request Tour | Wellington
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.description:
Ben Ottewell and Ian Ball, founding members of the legendary band Gomez, are bringing their very special By Request tour to Aotearoa this November.

Calling all fans, Tijuana Lady’s, actually Me, You, Everybody to See The World through the eyes of Ian Ball and Ben Ottewell as they Bring Their Lovin’ Back Here to New Zealand

Expect the best tunes from the best of 25 years of touring to Australia and the best albums Bring It On, Liquid Skin, and beyond all delivered with Ben Ottewell’s unmistakable growl and Ian Ball’s melodic brilliance.

No rules. Just two mates, two guitars, some electronic stuff, and decades of songs that have soundtracked road trips, breakups, breakdowns and breakthroughs.

It’ll be intimate and loose, but it’s your chance to hear the songs you love, the way you’ve never heard them before. By request.

Make sure you fill out the song request form here: bit.ly/GomezByRequest

events.id: Sharon Van Etten & The Attachment Theory-The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Sharon Van Etten & The Attachment Theory
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
Sharon Van Etten’s music blends elements of folk, indie rock, and dream pop. Over the past 16 years, audiences have come to expect a gothic stage presence (think 6-inch black patent leather stilettos) and personal song lyrics. 
This concert follows on from the release of Sharon’s seventh studio album ‘Sharon Van Etten & The Attachment Theory’. Despite being 16 years into her rock career, this is the first album with the band. It shows Sharon’s willingness to continually reinvent herself. The Attachment Theory includes Devra Hoff on bass guitar and backing vocals, Teeny Lieberson on keys, guitar, and backing vocals, and Jorge Balbi on drums. 
Sharon’s talent doesn’t stop at just musician and singer-songwriter. She is also an actress. She starred as Rachel in Netflix mystery drama The OA and has appeared in the feature films Never Rarely Sometimes Always and How It Ends.

 After what must be their 10,000th voyage to their favourite touring destination (give or take a few), Ben Ottewell and Ian Ball, founding members of the legendary Gomez, return to Australia and New Zealand for another run of unforgettable, up-close-and-personal shows.

events.id: Sharon Van Etten And The Attachment Theory | Wellington-The Opera House, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: Sharon Van Etten And The Attachment Theory | Wellington
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington
events.description:
BANISHED MUSIC & STRANGE NEWS PRESENT
SHARON VAN ETTEN & THE ATTACHMENT THEORY

TUESDAY 25 NOVEMBER - THE OPERA HOUSE, WELLINGTON*
THURSDAY 27 NOVEMBER - ISAAC THEATRE ROYAL, CHRISTCHURCH*
SATURDAY 29 NOVEMBER - THE OTHERS WAY FESTIVAL, AUCKLAND

* with special guest SHANNON LAY (USA)

Tickets from Banished Music

“...right up there with Van Etten’s most majestic tracks ever” - www.consequence.net

“A new dawn for the music of the night.” – The Times

“...you could be forgiven for thinking that this latest incarnation of Sharon Van Etten has seen her reborn.” – The Herald (Glasgow)

Following the gigantic recent announcement that Sharon Van Etten & The Attachment Theory are headlining The Others Way Festival this November, Banished Music and Strange News are delighted to reveal the band are also set to play their very own shows in Wellington and Christchurch, with very special international guest Shannon Lay joining in support at both shows.

Hot on the (six-inch patent black stiletto) heels of their self-titled album, Tuesday 25 November will see Sharon returning to Wellington’s Opera House with her remarkable new band in tow, and playing Christchurch’s Isaac Theatre Royal on Thursday 27 November, before heading up to slay The Other’s Way’s very first outdoor Karangahape Road stage.

That her band’s debut album is her own seventh album is a testament to Van Etten’s willingness to reinvent and follow her instincts for change, even after this long on the job. Now sixteen years into an extraordinary career, it seems our heroine has fully accepted her mantle as one of the world’s great rock stars, fronting her gothic-tinged new outfit to widespread awe and acclaim, Devra Hoff on bass guitar and backing vocals, Teeny Lieberson on keys, guitar, and backing vocals, and Jorge Balbi on drums.

“The Attachment Theory are a tight unit, woven together by Devra Hoff’s inventive, intelligent bass lines... this show was less about [Sharon’s] past and more about her future, which appears to lie with The Attachment Theory - a band who, on this evidence, are bringing the very best out of her.” – Manchester Evening News

Also performing at The Others Way, and playing support in Wellington and Christchurch, American songwriter Shannon Lay is much of a punk as she is a folk singer, citing both The Ramones and Nick Drake as influences. As a member of garage rocker Ty Segall’s Freedom Band, Lay can certainly make a racket, but for these shows, she will be opening as a solo act. The Guardian were quick to assure us that “This is no mere indie-folk musician,” and Pitchfork said her most recent studio album “presents a quiet, lovely, undramatic rendering of the dramatic”.

We truly could not be more excited to be welcoming Queen Shazza back to Aotearoa for these shows, and with the addition of both her band The Attachment Theory and Shannon Lay’s opening spot, you should be dang well excited too!

“Sharon Van Etten and The Attachment Theory’s self-titled record is an early Album of the Year contender” - www.independent.co.uk

events.id: Pixies-St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Pixies
events.venue: St James Theatre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
They influenced the sound of the 90s. American alt-rock band Pixies formed in 1986. Their jarring pop sound draws from punk rock and surf rock. Still popular more than 35 years later, they are heading to the St James Theatre for a two-night residency. In a unique twist, they’ll present two different concerts. On the first night, they’ll play two 90s classic albums in their entirety – ‘Bossanova’ and ‘Trompe Le Monde’. For the second night, they’ll play from their new album ‘The Night The Zombies Came’ plus other songs from their catalogue. 
Pixies are known for surreal lyrics, wild shifts in song structure, and dynamic contrast. They are said to have influenced other 90s bands like Nirvana, Radiohead, Smashing Pumpkins, and Weezer. Their tenth, and most recent album, ‘The Night the Zombies Came’ was received with critical acclaim. United Kingdom music magazine DIY stated, “Pixies remain one of the most consistent, influential bands on the planet.”

events.id: Pixies - 2025 New Zealand Tour-St James Theatre, Wellington-Under The Radar
events.name: Pixies - 2025 New Zealand Tour
events.venue: St James Theatre, Wellington
events.description:
PIXIES have announced a 2025 New Zealand tour which will see the alt-rock legends perform two consecutive nights in both Auckland and Wellington. On the first night, they’ll play classic albums, 1990’s Bossanova and 1991 follow up Trompe Le Monde in their entirety, followed by a cross catalogue set and songs from their new album The Night The Zombies Came on the second night.

Pixies have just released their tenth studio album The Night the Zombies Came to critical acclaim, with MOJO saying, This most thrillingly deathly of bands remains alive and DIY stating, Pixies remain one of the most consistent, influential bands on the planet.

Pixies wowed UK fans in August with their mainstage performance at London’s All Points East, described as “raucous” by Rolling Stone UK after their sold-out Glasgow Academy show was tipped as “a full-on head rush of classics by the Scottish Sun and as relevant in 2024 as they were over 35 years ago by Glasgow World.

35 years since their groundbreaking Platinum-certified album Doolittle catapulted the band into the UK Top Ten, and 20 years since their celebrated reformation at Coachella, Pixies are deep into their second act, and in the midst of a creative purple patch.

events.id: Darren Watson Sings John Hiatt - The Shed-46a Victoria Street, Alicetown, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: Darren Watson Sings John Hiatt - The Shed
events.venue: 46a Victoria Street, Alicetown, Lower Hutt 5010, New Zealand
events.description:
This will be Darren's first performance in the Wellington region in almost half a decade! Strictly limited tickets so book early to avoid disappointment.
Enjoy an amazing night with legendary blues artist Darren Watson. Darren is a seasoned singer-songwriter and blues musician with over three decades of experience in the music industry. Based in Aotearoa/New Zealand, Darren has built a reputation for his authentic blues sound, combining traditional influences with contemporary themes. His music is characterized by thoughtful lyrics, skilled guitar work, and a voice that carries both grit and soul.
With Darren for this intimate Shed appearance will be stellar double bassist Steve Moodie, and once wunderkind but still wunderful guitarist Chris Armour.
Darren first gained recognition in the 1980s as the leader and frontman of the New Zealand band Chicago Smoke Shop. Since then, he has pursued a successful solo career, releasing a series of well-received albums. His 2020 album, Getting Sober for the End of the World, was widely praised for its sharp social commentary and musical craftsmanship, earning airplay and accolades both locally and internationally. It saw Darren nominated as a finalist for the 2021 Aotearoa Music Award for Best Folk Artist.
Watson's new album 'Darren Watson sings John Hiatt' is due for release in late 2025.

events.name: Urzila Carlson — You Don’t Say
events.venue: The Opera House, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
The trademark cheeky wit is back. South African-Kiwi Urzila Carlson is heading to Wellington with a new show. ‘You Don’t Say’ continues to cement her reputation as an undeniable force in the comedy world. Urzila recently presented this show at the Melbourne International Comedy Festival. There she was awarded People’s Choice Award for the most popular show of the festival. Talking about the upcoming tour she said, “It’s a show born out of sarcasm and storytelling from the mind of a woman who might be slightly out of her mind!” 
This year is huge for the comedy queen. It began with a starring role in rom-com ‘Kinda Pregnant’ alongside Amy Schumer. The film has racked up over 25 million views on Netflix. Later in the year, Urzila will embark on her first national tour of the United States and her biggest tour of the United Kingdom.

events.id: SharePoint Online/2019 for Power Users, 4-Day Training Course in Wellington-100 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
events.name: SharePoint Online/2019 for Power Users, 4-Day Training Course in Wellington
events.venue: 100 Willis Street, Wellington Central, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
events.description:
Course: SPOPEU
Duration: 4 Days
Audience: End Users
Microsoft Course: 55215
Overview
This course delivers the complete site owner story from start to finish in an engaging and practical way to ensure you have the confidence to plan and create new sites or manage your existing sites, whether you're using SharePoint Online through Microsoft 365, or SharePoint 2019 on-premises. Your goal is to learn how to make SharePoint relevant to your team by using a sites functionality to help you share information and collaborate with your colleagues. During the class you will also learn best practices and ‘what not to do’ as you watch live, interactive demonstrations and put theory into practice with hands on exercises.
Module List
Module 1: Introduction to SharePoint
Module 2: Finding Content
Module 3: Working with Lists
Module 4: Working with Libraries
Module 5: Working with Publishing Features
Module 6: Leveraging Social Content in the Business
Module 7: Site Owner Responsibilities
Module 8: Creating and Managing Sites
Module 9: Site Customisation
Module 10: Permissions and Security
Module 11: Creating & Managing Lists & Libraries
Module 12: Advanced Document Management
Module 13: Power Platform Integration
Module 14: Creating & Managing Content Types
Click here for the full 'SharePoint Online for Power Users' course outline
Click here for the full 'SharePoint 2019 for Power Users' course outline

events.id: Throwing Muses (USA)-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Throwing Muses (USA)
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.description:
Throwing Muses - one of the most acclaimed US college bands of the 1990s - will perform two New Zealand shows in December.
The band has announced concerts at San Fran, Wellington on 9 December, and Double Whammy in Auckland on 10 December.
Plus1 proudly presents the Throwing Muses tour as part of the New Zealand promoter’s 25th Anniversary series.
These are Throwing Muses' first shows in Aotearoa since 1994.
Formed by Kristin Hersh with high school friends, the band pioneered a new alternative sound, releasing a string of critically celebrated albums and touring the world.
Throwing Muses - featuring Kristin Hersh, David Narcizo and Bernard Georges - recently released new album ‘Moonlight Concessions’ which has been described by Pitchfork Magazine as: “A stunning return to form”.
‘Moonlight Concessions’ goes back to basics, a return for Throwing Muses to their esoteric off-kilter best courtesy of Kristin’s pin-sharp sketches and their suitably abrasive musical arrangements. The album follows ‘Sun Racket’ from 2020, a heady set filled with tough and tender tales spiked with surreal imagery.
Don't miss Throwing Muses performing their career-spanning concerts in Auckland and Wellington in December.

Full tour information at Plus1.co.nz

events.id: Nadia Reid tickets-Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand-Ticketek
events.name: Nadia Reid tickets
events.venue: Meow Nui, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
Presented by: Banished Music
"[Nadia] embraces a full-bodied sound halfway between Haim’s sophisticated pop sparkle and Sharon Van Etten’s full-throated songcraft" — The Guardian
This December acclaimed songwriter Nadia Reid journeys back to New Zealand and Australia in celebration of Enter Now Brightness; her critically lauded fourth album which was released on Chrysalis in February 2025.
The Manchester-based expatriate New Zealander is known for her ruminative and well-crafted folk-inflected songwriting, and with Enter Now Brightness she presents a record of poise and great beauty, the sound of a cellular shift, of pain giving way to tenderness and joy.
“There’s a questing robustness to these songs, a sense of somebody finally having the perspective to seek out answers to long-hanging questions.” ★★★★ — MOJO
Enter Now feels different. It is an album, she says, of departure and questioning, that has reminded her how songwriting can be “the most useful thing to do with pain and joy and thoughts and feelings and anger.” That through music we can find great change. “I’m so much better off now that it exists,” she says. “Now feels like a new time.”

events.id: Kirk Franklin — The World Tour-Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand-Wellington NZ
events.name: Kirk Franklin — The World Tour
events.venue: Michael Fowler Centre, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
He’s considered a transformative force in contemporary gospel music. Kirk Franklin is a trailblazer in his field, and he’s sharing his talents with a Wellington audience. Kirk is known for masterfully blending rhythm and blues, hip-hop, pop, and gospel. The 20-time Grammy Award-winning gospel artist has a unique sound that resonates across generations. 
For his Michael Fowler Centre performance, he’ll draw from his extensive repertoire, including his 2023 album ‘Father’s Day’. That release featured the number one hit single All Things which earned him Grammy number 20 in 2024. In 2025, he released the soul-stirring new single Do It Again which quickly connected with audiences. It reinforced his reputation to deliver messages that expand the reach of gospel into mainstream culture. Whether it’s in the studio or live on stage, Kirk continues to inspire millions. He connects with a message rooted in faith, love, and resilience.

events.name: Cryptopsy
events.venue: Valhalla, Wellington
events.description:
Valhalla Touring are proud to announce direct from Canada, one of the worlds most brutal Death Metal bands, the mighty CRYPTOPSY, headlining 2 shows to close out the year of 2025, on their ALL SO VILE tour!!!

More than 30 years into their storied career, Montreal Death Metal innovators Cryptopsy return with their ninth studio album, An Insatiable Violence, set for release on June 20, 2025 on Season of Mist.

Revered in extreme Metal circles for such groundbreaking classics as 1994’s Blasphemy Made Flesh and the 1996 magnum opus None So Vile, Cryptopsy find yet another gear on An Insatiable Violence, which further solidifies the band’s place in the upper echelon of Death Metal.

Coming out of the pandemic, the band dedicated themselves to staying on top of their game more than ever before, with the intention of consistently putting out a new record every two years. That started with 2023’s acclaimed As Gomorrah Burns, which WON them a CANADIAN GRAMMY, and continues 21 months later with An Insatiable Violence.

CRYPTOPSY will destroy December 2025 in Auckland/Tamaki Makaurau and Wellington/Te Whanganui-a-Tara

events.venue: TSB Arena, Wellington, New Zealand
events.description:
One of Britain’s favourite funny exports is bringing a new comedy tour to Wellington. Jimmy Carr: Laughs Funny will bring the comedian’s signature dark brand of humour to TSB Arena. The presenter, actor, and writer is known for his one-liners, rapid-fire delivery, and signature laugh. His content is often described as “edgy”, so be prepared for a raised eyebrow or two. Just like a magnet, it attracts some people and repels others. For those who are attracted to risqué jokes with a bit of spice, this is a show not to miss. 
Jimmy Carr has been a comedy staple for British audiences since the late 1990s. He appears as the host of ‘The Big Fat Quiz of the Year’, ‘8 Out of 10 Cats’, and ‘8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown’. He has also taken part in numerous television panel shows, radio shows, and podcasts.

He never fails to light up a crowd with his provocative and biting observations. Australian actor and comic Jim Jefferies is heading to Wellington. His new show, Son of a Carpenter, is further proof that he is one of the most electrifying comedy stars on the scene. He is known for his ability to push boundaries with incisive and intelligent insights. The Times UK says his act “… increasingly finds a beautiful balance between the jagged and the shrewd, the vicious, and the vulnerable.”  
Jim is one of the most popular and respected comedians of his generation. He has released 10 monumental stand-up specials and entertains live audiences across the globe. From New York’s Madison Square Garden to London’s O2 Arena, he consistently leaves sold-out venues in his wake.

It’s a first for New Zealand and a hole lot of fun for golfing enthusiasts. See the Women’s Amateur Asia-Pacific (WAAP) championship at Heretaunga’s Royal Wellington Golf Club in February 2026. This is the eighth edition of WAAP, and the first time in New Zealand. The competition has become the preeminent women’s amateur championship in the Asia-Pacific region.   
Each year, WAAP provides the winner with life-changing opportunities. They gain entry into three global women’s major championships and elite amateur championships. This includes the AIG Women’s Open, the Chevron Championship, Amundi Evian Championship, and the Augusta National Women’s Amateur.

Wellington, get ready! Irish legends Hothouse Flowers return February 2026 for the first time in over twenty years.
Celebrated for their explosive fusion of rock, Irish folk, and gospel, the Dublin-born band has captivated audiences around the world for decades.
From their street-performing roots to major global stages, they’ve earned a reputation for unforgettable live shows filled with raw emotion, spontaneity, and soul.
Known for their boundless energy and musical improvisation, every Hothouse Flowers concert is a unique experience.
Their performances blend powerful anthems, tender ballads, and traditional songs that reflect the depth of Irish storytelling, creating an emotional and uplifting journey.
With a deep connection to their audiences and a talent for turning every gig into a one-of-a-kind event, their long-awaited return promises to be one of the most talked-about live music moments of the year.
Don’t miss one of the most celebrated returns of the year.

events.description:
ALL AGES EVENT

Critically acclaimed Irish folk outfit Amble will return to Australia in February 2026 for a string of headline shows, celebrating the release of their highly anticipated debut album, Reverie. Reverie captures the essence of Amble’s signature style — raw authenticity, heartfelt storytelling, and melodic intimacy, wrapped in warm acoustic instrumentation and ethereal vocal harmonies. Recorded live across studios in Ireland and Los Angeles, the album reflects the spirit and simplicity of the band’s early days.

 

Looking for Accessible tickets? All accessible tickets need to be purchased directly by the ticketing agent’s accessible hotline or form. Have further accessible queries? Email us at accessibility.aunz@livenation.com.au

events.id: Amble | Wellington-San Fran, Wellington-Ticket Master
events.name: Amble | Wellington
events.venue: San Fran, Wellington
events.description:
Amble, the critically acclaimed three-piece folk group hailing from Ireland, today announce their return to Australia and New Zealand in February 2026, in support of their highly anticipated debut album, Reverie.
Irish trio Amble harness a rare magic threaded into the fabric of their novelistic folk. Originally hailing from the West Region of Ireland, the group—Robbie Cunningham (lead vocals/guitar), Ross McNerney (mandolin/bouzouki), and Oisin McCaffrey (vocals/guitar)—have unassumingly gone from quitting their day jobs in rural Ireland to the doorstep of an international breakthrough, buoyed by over 100 million streams and sold-out shows around the world.
Amble’s debut album, Reverie, set for release on Friday, 23 May this year, showcases Amble's signature sound: relatability, intimate storytelling, and authenticity seamlessly blended with no-frills acoustic instrumentation, serene soundscapes, and heavenly natural harmonies. The album, recorded live in various studios between Ireland and Los Angeles, captures the spirit of the band's early days. 

San Fran holds a Supervised License, meaning minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue. Minors are of course not allowed to purchase alcohol under any circumstance.

events.id: CubaDupa--Wellington NZ
events.name: CubaDupa
events.description:
One weekend every March, CubaDupa takes over some of Wellington’s central city streets for an epic party. The free annual festival brings a carnival vibe to the end of the summer. It offers live music, street theatre, dance, parades, and other cultural experiences. 
CubaDupa is New Zealand’s largest outdoor arts and music festival. It takes place over two days on Cuba Street and the surrounding roads, right in the heart of Wellington. The festival is suitable for the whole family with performances and activities running throughout the day and night. Multiple performance spaces showcase New Zealand’s emerging musical talent alongside established artists. The lineup usually includes over 140 local and international acts.

events.description:
About NZ Tech Rally conference
NZ Tech Rally is our annual flagship conference for Aotearoa’s software community — a space to connect, grow, and celebrate together.
It’s a multi-track event featuring 3 keynote talks and 16 talks across four dedicated tracks:
Engineering & Platforms
Product, Design & UX
Software Testing & Quality
AI, Data & Ethics
Buying a ticket means you chose to respect our Code of Conduct.
